div1.sense: strong, staunch, stout, sturdy; c. inf., καρτερὸς ἐναίρειν strong to kill, Il.; τὰ καρτερώτατα the strongest, Soph.
c. gen. possessed of a thing, lord or master of it, Theogn., Theocr.
like καρτερικός, steadfast, patient, πρὸς πάντα Xen.: obstinate, Plat.

of things, strong, mighty, potent, ὅρκος Il.; κ. ἔργα deeds of might, Il.; κ. μάχη strongly contested, desperate, Hdt., Thuc.; —τὸ καρτερόν, τόλμης τὸ κ. the extremity of daring, Eur.:— κατὰ τὸ καρτερόν by force, Hdt., Ar., etc.; so, πρὸς τὸ καρτερόν Aesch.; τὸ καρτερόν, absol., Theocr.
of place, like ὀχυρός, strong, Thuc.; τὸ καρτερώτερον τοῦ χωρίου Thuc.
adv. -ρῶς, strongly, etc., κ. ὑπνοῦσθαι to sleep soundly, Hdt.
the common comp. and Sup. are κρείσσων and κράτιστος (qq. v.): but the regular forms καρτερώτερος, -ώτατος, occur now and then, Pind., Attic

div1.head: καρτερούντως
div1.sense: strongly, stoutly, Plat.

div1.head: καρτερόχειρ
div1.sense: strong-handed, Hhymn.

div1.head: κάρτος
div1.sense: strength, vigour, courage, Hom., Hes.

div1.head: Καρύαι
div1.sense: a place in Laconia with a famous temple of Artemis, Thuc.:—hence,
Καρυᾶτις, ἡ, a name of Artemis

div1.head: Καρυατίζω
div1.sense: to dance the Caryatic dance, Luc.

div1.head: καρύκη
div1.sense: a Persian dish, composed of blood and rich spices, Luc.

div1.head: καρύκινος
div1.sense: dark-red, Xen.

div1.head: καρυκοποιέω
div1.sense: to make a καρύκη or rich sauce, Ar.

div1.head: καρυοναύτης
div1.sense: one who sails in a nut-shell, Luc.

div1.head: κάρυον
div1.sense: any kind of nut, Ar., Xen.; distinguished into various kinds, as κ. βασιλικά or Περσικά, walnuts, also called simply κάρυα, Batr.; κ. κασταναϊκά or κασταναῖα chestnuts, etc.

div1.head: καρφαλέος
div1.sense: dry, parched, Od.:—of sound, καρφαλέον ἀσπὶς ἄϋσε the shield rang dry, i. e. hollow, Il.

div1.head: κάρφη
div1.sense: dry grass, hay, Xen.

div1.head: καρφηρός
div1.sense: of dry straw, Eur.

div1.head: καρφίτης
div1.sense: built of dry straws, Anth.

div1.head: κάρφος
div1.sense: a dry stalk, Lat. palea, stipula, a chip of wood, Ar.: in pl. the dry sticks of cinnamon, Hdt.; dry twigs, chips, straws, bits of wool, such as birds make nests of, Ar.

div1.head: κάρφω
div1.sense: to dry up, wither, κάρψω χρόα καλόν I will wither the fair skin, wrinkle it, Od.; ἠέλιος χρόα κάρφει Hes.

div1.head: καρχαλέος
div1.sense: rough, δίψῃ καρχαλέοι rough in the throat with thirst, Virgilʼs siti asper, Il.

div1.head: καρχαρόδους
div1.sense: with sharp, jagged teeth, of dogs, Il.; applied to Cleon by Ar.

div1.head: κάρχαρος
div1.sense: sharp-pointed, jagged, with sharp or jagged teeth, κάρχαρον μειδήσας, of the wolf, Babr.: —metaph. sharp, biting, of language, Luc.

div1.head: Καρχηδονίζω
div1.sense: to side with the Carthaginians, Plut.

div1.head: Καρχηδών
div1.sense: Carthage, Hdt.:—adj. Καρχηδόνιος, α, ον, Carthaginian, Hdt.

div1.head: καρχήσιον
div1.sense: a drinking-cup narrower in the middle than the top and bottom, Sapph., etc.
the mast-head of a ship, Pind., etc.; in pl., Eur.

div1.head: κασαλβάζω
div1.sense: to abuse in harlot fashion, Ar.

div1.head: κασαλβάς
div1.sense: a courtesan, harlot, Ar.

div1.head: κασῆς
div1.sense: a carpet or skin to sit upon, a saddle, Xen.

div1.head: κασία
div1.sense: cassia, an Arabian spice like cinnamon, but of inferior quality, Hdt.

div1.head: κασιγνήτη
div1.sense: a sister, Hom., etc.

div1.head: κασίγνητος
div1.sense: a brother, Hom., etc.:—in more general sense, a cousin, Il.
as adj., κασίγνητος, η, ον, brotherly, sisterly, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: κάσις
div1.sense: a brother, Aesch., Soph.:— a sister, Eur.

div1.head: Κασσιτερίδες
div1.sense: the Cassiterides or tin-islands, prob. the Scilly islands and Cornwall, Hdt.

div1.head: κασσίτερος
div1.sense: tin, Lat. stannum, Il. It was melted, and then cast upon χαλκός, hence χεῦμα κασσιτέροιο a plating of tin, Il.

div1.head: κάσσυμα
div1.sense: anything stitched, esp. the sole stitched under a shoe or sandal, a shoe-sole, Ar.; metaph., ὑποδύσασθαι ἐχθρῶν παρʼ ἀνδρῶν καττύματα to put on shoes made by an enemy, Ar.

div1.head: κασσύω
div1.etym: prob. for κατα-σύω, though σύω only occurs in Lat. suo
div1.sense: to stitch or sew together like a shoemaker, Plat.
metaph. to stitch up a plot, like Lat. dolos suere, Ar.

div1.head: Κασταλία
div1.sense: the famous spring of the Muses on Mt. Parnassus, Hdt., Soph., etc.
div1.etym: Prob. akin to καθαρός, Lat. castus.

div1.head: Καστόρειος
div1.sense: of or for Castor;— τὸ Κ. μέλος, a martial song, set to the flute, used in celebrating victories in the chariot-race (Castor being the inventor of the ξυνωρίς) , Pind., Plut.; ὁ Κ. ὕμνος Pind.

div1.head: καστορίδες
div1.sense: a Laconian breed of hounds, first reared by Castor, Anth.: also καστόριαι κύνες Xen.

div1.head: Κάστωρ
div1.sense: Castor, son of Zeus (or Tyndareus) and Leda, brother of Pollux, Hom.

div1.head: κάστωρ
div1.sense: the beaver, Hdt.

div1.head: καταβάδην
div1.sense: going down or downstairs: cf. ἀναβάδην.

div1.head: καταβαθμός
div1.sense: a descent, name of the steep descent from Nubia to Egypt, Aesch.

div1.head: καταβαίνω
div1.sense: to step down, go or come down, Lat. descendere, ἐξ ὄρεος from the mountain, Il.; κ. πόλιος to go down from the city, Il.; κ. δίφρου to dismount from the chariot, Il.; c. acc. loci, θάλαμον κατεβήσετο she came down to her chamber, Od.:—but also c. acc., κατέβαινʼ ὑπερώϊα she came down from the upper floor, Od.; κλίμακα κατεβήσετο came down the ladder, Od.; absol. to come down stairs, Ar.; hence in Pass., ἵππος καταβαίνεται the horse is dismounted from, Xen.
to go down from the inland parts to the sea, esp. from central Asia (cf. ἀναβαίνω II. 3), Hdt.; κ. ἐς Πειραιᾶ, Plat.
to come to land, get safe ashore, Pind.
to go down into the arena, κ. ἐπʼ ἄεθλα Hdt.; and absol., like Lat. in certamen descendere, Soph., Xen.
of an orator, to come down from the tribune, κατάβα: —answer, καταβήσομαι Ar.
πόσσω κατέβα τοι ἀφʼ ἵστω; at what price did [the robe] come down from the loom? Theocr.

metaph., καταβαίνειν εἴς τι to come to a thing in the course of speaking, κατέβαινε ἐς λιτάς he ended with prayer, Hdt.; c. part., κατέβαινεν παραιτεόμενος ended in begging, Hdt.; κ. ἐπὶ τελευτήν Plat.
trans. to bring down, Pind.

div1.head: καταβακχιόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be full of Bacchic frenzy, καταβακχιοῦσθε δρυὸς κλάδοις in oak-wreath ye rave with Bacchic fury, Eur.

div1.head: καταβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw down, overthrow, Hom., etc.; κ. εἰς τὸ μηδέν to bring down to nothing, Hdt.
to strike down with a weapon, to slay, Il., Hdt., etc.
to throw or bring into a certain state, Eur., Plat.
to cast down or away, cast off, reject, Xen.
in milder sense, to let fall, drop down, Hom.; κ. ἱστία to lower sail, Theogn.; τὰς ὀφρῦς κ. Eur.
to lay down, set down, Lat. deponere, Il., Ar.
to bring or carry down, esp. to the sea-coast, Hdt.
to pay down, yield or bring in, Hdt.:— to pay down, pay, Thuc., etc.:—Mid. to cause to be deposited, Dem.
to put in, render, μαρτυρίαν Dem.
to throw down seed, sow, Dem.; κ. φάτιν, Lat. spargere voces, Hdt.
to lay down as a foundation, mostly in Mid., Eur.:—Pass., καταβεβλημένος laid down, ordinary, Arist.

div1.head: καταβάπτω
div1.sense: to dip down into, Luc.

div1.head: καταβαρέω
div1.sense: to weigh down, overload, Luc.

div1.head: κατάβασις
div1.sense: a going down, way down, descent, Hdt., Attic; cf. καταίβασις.
the descent from Central Asia, Xen.

div1.head: καταβατέον
div1.sense: one must descend, Ar., Plat.
one must attack, Ar.

div1.head: καταβαΰζω
div1.sense: to bark at, τινός Anth.

div1.head: καταβεβαιόομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to affirm strongly, Plut.

div1.head: καταβιάζω
div1.sense: usu. mid.
to constrain, Thuc.
Pass. to be forced, Plut.

div1.head: καταβιβάζω
div1.sense: Causal of καταβαίνω to make to go down, bring down, bring down, Hdt., Plut.
to bring down by force, Xen.

div1.head: καταβιβαστέος
div1.sense: to be brought down, Plat.

div1.head: καταβιβρώσκω
div1.sense: to eat up, devour, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: καταβιόω
div1.sense: to bring life to an end, Plat.

div1.head: καταβλάπτω
div1.sense: to hurt greatly, damage, Hhymn., Plat.

div1.head: καταβλέπω
div1.sense: to look down at, Plut.

div1.head: καταβλητικός
div1.sense: fit for throwing off horseback, Xen.

div1.head: καταβληχάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to bleat loudly, Theocr.

div1.head: καταβλώσκω
div1.sense: to go down through a place, c. acc., Od.

div1.head: καταβοάω
div1.sense: to cry down, cry out against, c. gen., Hdt.; κ. τινῶν ὅτι τὰς σπονδὰς λελυκότες εἶεν Thuc.; c. acc. to bawl down, outcry, Ar.

div1.head: καταβοή
div1.sense: an outcry against, c. gen., Thuc.

div1.head: καταβόησις
div1.sense: a crying out against, Plut.

div1.head: καταβολή
div1.sense: a throwing or laying down, NTest.
metaph.,
a foundation, beginning, Pind., NTest.
a paying down, by instalments, Dem.
a periodical attack of illness, a fit, access, Plat.

div1.head: καταβόσκω
div1.sense: to feed flocks upon or in a place, Lat. depascere, χὠ τὰν Σαμίαν καταβόσκων the shepherd of Samos, Theocr.

div1.head: καταβόστρυχος
div1.sense: with flowing locks, Eur.

div1.head: καταβραβεύω
div1.sense: to give judgment against, c. acc., NTest.:—Pass. to have judgment given against one, Dem.

div1.head: καταβρέχω
div1.sense: to wet through, drench:—metaph., μέλιτι καταβρέχειν Pind.

div1.head: καταβρίθω
div1.sense: intr. to be heavily laden or weighed down by a thing, c. dat., Hes., Theocr.
trans. to weigh down, to outweigh, ὄλβῳ κ. βασιλῆας Theocr.

div1.head: καταβροχθίζω
div1.sense: to gulp down, Ar.

div1.head: καταβρύκω
div1.sense: to bite in pieces, eat up, Anth.

div1.head: καταβυρσόω
div1.sense: to cover quite with hides, Thuc.

div1.head: καταγγελία
div1.sense: proclamation, Luc.

div1.head: καταγγέλλω
div1.sense: to denounce, betray, Xen.
to declare, πόλεμον Lys.

div1.head: κατάγγελτος
div1.sense: denounced, betrayed, Thuc.

div1.head: κατάγειος
div1.sense: in or under the earth, underground, subterranean, Hdt., Xen., etc.

div1.head: Καταγέλα
div1.sense: Comic name of a supposed town, with a play on the Sicil. Gela, Γέλα καὶ Καταγέλα Ar.

div1.head: καταγέλαστος
div1.sense: ridiculous, absurd, Hdt., Ar.: adv. -τως, Sup. -τότατα, Plat.

div1.head: καταγελάω
div1.sense: to laugh at, jeer or mock at, c. gen., Hdt., Ar., etc.; also c. dat., Hdt.:—absol. to laugh scornfully, Eur., Ar., etc.
c. acc. to laugh down, deride, Eur.: —Pass. to be derided, Aesch., Ar., etc.

div1.head: κατάγελως
div1.sense: mockery, derision, ridicule, Lat. ludibrium, ἐμαυτοῦ καταγέλωτα τάδε; these ornaments which bring ridicule upon me? Aesch.; κ. πλατύς sheer mockery, Ar.; ὁ κ. τῆς πράξεως the crowning absurdity of the matter, Plat.

div1.head: καταγηράσκω
div1.sense: to grow old, Lat. senescere, Od., Hdt.

div1.head: καταγίγνομαι
div1.sense: to abide, dwell, ap. Dem.

div1.head: καταγιγνώσκω
div1.sense: to remark, discover, esp. something to oneʼs prejudice, οὐκ ἐπιτήδεα κατά τινος κ. having formed unfavourable prejudices against one, Hdt.; καταγνοὺς τοῦ γέροντος τοὺς τρόπους having observed his foibles, Ar.
c. acc. criminis, to lay as a charge against a person, κακίαν, ἀδικίαν κ. τινός Plat.:—Pass., perf. part. κατεγνωσμένος condemned, NTest.
c. gen. criminis, παρανόμων κ. τινός Dem.

c. inf., κ. ἑαυτοῦ ἀδικεῖν to charge oneself with wrong-doing, Aeschin.; so, κ. ἑαυτοῦ μὴ περιέσεσθαι he passed sentence of non-survival against himself, Thuc.: Pass., καταγνωσθεὶς νεώτερα πρήσσειν being suspected of doing, Hdt.
c. acc. poenae, to give as judgment or sentence against a person, κ. τινὸς θάνατον to pass sentence of death on one, Lat. damnare aliquem mortis, Thuc.:—Pass., θάνατός τινος κατέγνωστο ap. Dem.
of a suit, to decide it against one, δίκην Ar.:—Pass. to be decided, Aesch.

div1.head: καταγινέω
div1.sense: to bring down, Od.

div1.head: καταγλαΐζω
div1.sense: to glorify, Anth.

div1.head: καταγλωττίζω
div1.sense: Pass. to be talked down, Ar.

div1.head: κάταγμα
div1.sense: wool drawn or spun out, worsted, Plat.: a flock of wool, Soph.

div1.head: καταγνάμπτω
div1.sense: to bend down, Anth.

div1.head: καταγνάφω
div1.sense: to comb away, lacerate, Hdt.

div1.head: κατάγνυμι
div1.sense: to break in pieces, shatter, shiver, crack, Hom., Attic
to break up, weaken, enervate, Eur., Plat.

Pass. with perf. act. to be broken, δόρατα κατεηγότα Hdt.; κατεαγέναι or καταγῆναι τὴν κεφαλήν to have the head broken, Ar., etc.; c. gen., τῆς κεφαλῆς κατέαγε he has got a bit of his head broken, Ar.

div1.head: κατάγνωσις
div1.sense: a thinking ill of, a low or contemptuous opinion of, c. gen., Thuc.
judgment given against one, condemnation, Thuc., Dem.; τοῦ θανάτου to death, Xen.

div1.head: καταγνωστέος
div1.sense: one must condemn, τινός Luc.

div1.head: καταγοητεύω
div1.sense: to enchant, bewitch: to cheat or blind by trickery, τινά Xen.

div1.head: καταγοράζω
div1.sense: to buy up, φορτία Dem.

div1.head: καταγορεύω
div1.sense: to denounce, τί τινι Ar., Thuc.; τι πρός τινα Xen.

div1.head: κατάγραφος
div1.sense: embroidered, Luc.

div1.head: καταγράφω
div1.sense: to scratch away, lacerate, Hdt.
to engrave, inscribe, νόμους Plut.
to paint over, Luc.
to fill tablets with writing Eur.
to write down, register, record, Plat.

div1.head: καταγυμνάζω
div1.sense: to exercise much, discipline, Luc.

div1.head: κατάγω
div1.sense: to lead down, Lat. deducere, Od., etc.; esp. into the nether world, Od.; εἰς Ἀΐδαο Od.
to bring down to the sea-coast, Il., Xen.
to bring down from the high seas to land, Od.; κατ. ναῦν to bring a ship into port, Hdt., Attic: —Pass. to come to land, land, opp. to ἀνάγεσθαι, Od., Hdt., Attic
κατάγεσθαι παρά τινι to turn in and lodge in a personʼs house, Lat. deversari apud aliquem, Dem.
to draw down or out, spin, Lat. deducere filum, Plat.
to reduce to a certain state, ἐς κίνδυνον κ. τὴν πόλιν Thuc.
κ. θρίαμβον, Lat. deducere triumphum, Plut.: to escort, like πομπεύω, Plut.
κ. γένος to derive a pedigree, Plut.
κατ. βοάν to lower the voice, Eur.
to bring back, Lat. reducere, Od.: to bring home, recall, Hdt., Attic: generally, to restore, Hdt.:—Pass. to return, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: καταγωγή
div1.sense: a bringing down from the high sea: a landing, landing-place, Thuc.:—generally, a halting-place, inn, Lat. statio, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: καταγώγιον
div1.sense: a place to lodge in, an inn, hotel, Thuc., Xen., etc.

div1.head: καταγωνίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to struggle against, prevail against, conquer, Luc.: as Pass., καταγωνισθεὶς ὑπό τινος Luc.

div1.head: καταδαίνυμαι
div1.sense: Dep. to devour, Theocr.

div1.head: καταδάκνω
div1.sense: to bite in pieces, Batr., Theocr.

div1.head: καταδακρύω
div1.sense: to bewail, τὴν τύχην Xen.: absol. to weep bitterly, Eur.

div1.head: καταδαμάζω
div1.sense: Mid. to subdue utterly, Thuc.

div1.head: καταδαπανάω
div1.sense: to squander, lavish, Xen.:— Pass., τὰ χρήματα καταδεδαπάνητό σφι Hdt.
to consume entirely, of an army, Xen.

div1.head: καταδάπτω
div1.sense: to rend in pieces, devour, Hom.: metaph. in Mid., καταδάπτεται ἦτορ Od.

div1.head: καταδαρθάνω
div1.sense: to fall asleep, in aor. to be asleep, sleep, Od.:—in pres. to be just falling asleep, Plat.; perf. καταδεδαρθηκώς having fallen asleep, Plat.
simply to pass the night, κατέδαρθον ἐν ὅπλοις Thuc.

div1.head: καταδατέομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to divide among themselves, tear and devour, Il.

div1.head: καταδεής
div1.sense: wanting or failing in, lacking a thing, c. gen., Hdt.: absol., needy, Dem.
comp. καταδεέστερος, weaker, inferior, Dem., etc.
adv. -δεῶς, mostly in comp., καταδεεστέρως ἔχειν περί τι to be very ill off in a thing, Dem.

div1.head: καταδεῖ
div1.sense: impers. there is wanting, v. καταδέω.

div1.head: καταδείδω
div1.sense: to fear greatly, τι Ar., Thuc.

div1.head: καταδείκνυμι
div1.sense: to discover and make known, Hdt., Plat., etc.; c. inf. to give notice that . . , Aeschin.:—Pass., c. part., κατεδέδεκτο ἐοῦσα χρηστή had been proved to be good, Hdt.
to invent and teach, introduce, exhibit, Ar., Plat.; c. inf. to shew how to do, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: καταδειλιάω
div1.sense: to shew signs of fear, Xen.

div1.head: καταδέρκομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to look down upon, Od., Soph.

div1.head: κατάδεσμος
div1.sense: a tie, band: a magic knot, Plat.

div1.head: καταδεύω
div1.sense: to wet through, Il., Hes.:—of a river, to water, πεδία Eur.

div1.head: καταδέχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to receive, admit, Plat., etc.
to receive back, take home again, Oratt.: —aor1 pass. καταδεχθῆναι in pass. sense, Luc.

div1.head: καταδέω
div1.sense: to bind on or to, bind fast, Hom., Hdt.:—Pass., καταδεδεμένος τοὺς ὀφθαλμούς, having his eyes bound, Hdt.; ἐν φόβῳ καταδεθεῖσα Eur.; καταδεῖται ψυχὴ ὑπὸ τοῦ σώματος Plat.:—Mid. to bind to oneself, Eur.
to put in bonds, imprison, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; κ. τὴν ἐπὶ θανάτῳ (sc. δέσιν) to bind him for execution, Hdt.
to convict and condemn of a crime, κ. τινα φῶρα εἶναι Hdt.
to tie down, stop, check, ἀνέμων κατέδησε κελεύθους Od.; κατέδησε κέλευθα stopped my course, Od.

div1.head: καταδέω
div1.sense: to want, lack, need, c. gen., esp. of numbers, καταδέει πεντεκαίδεκα σταδίων ὡς μὴ εἶναι πεντακοσίων it wants 15 stadia of being 500, Hdt.
Dep. καταδέομαι to intreat earnestly, Lat. deprecari, c. gen. pers., Plat.

div1.head: κατάδηλος
div1.sense: quite manifest, plain, visible, Hdt., Thuc.; κατάδηλον ποιεῖν to make known, discover, Hdt., Soph.; κ. εἶναι to be discovered, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: καταδημαγωγέω
div1.sense: to conquer by the arts of a demagogue:—Pass. to be so conquered, Plut.

div1.head: καταδημοβορέω
div1.sense: to consume publicly, Il.

div1.head: καταδιαιτάω
div1.sense: to decide as arbitrator against, give judgment against c. gen., Dem.: Pass. to be decided against one, Dem.

div1.head: καταδιαλλάσσω
div1.sense: to reconcile again, Ar.

div1.head: καταδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give away, intr. to open into, ἡ Προποντὶς καταδιδοῖ ἐς τὸν Ἑλλήσποντον Hdt.

div1.head: καταδικάζω
div1.sense: to give judgment against a person, pass sentence upon him, condemn him, opp. to ἀποδικάζω, c. gen. pers. et acc. rei, κ. τινὸς θάνατον to pass sentence of death upon him, Hdt.; c. inf., κ. τινὸς τὰ ἔσχατα παθεῖν to condemn him to suffer extreme penalties, Xen.:—Mid. to get sentence given against one, δίκην καταδικάζεσθαί τινος Thuc.:—Pass., καταδικασθείς condemned, Plat.; c. inf., καταδικάζεται ἀποθανεῖν Luc.; of the sentence, ἀντέλεγον μὴ δικαίως σφῶν καταδεδικάσθαι they contended that judgment had been given against them unjustly, Thuc.
to declare by express judgment, Xen.

div1.head: καταδίκη
div1.sense: judgment given against one: the damages awarded, Thuc.

div1.head: καταδιώκω
div1.sense: to pursue closely, Thuc.

div1.head: καταδοκέω
div1.sense: to suppose a thing to any oneʼs prejudice, c. inf., κ. τινα ποιεῖν τι to suspect one of doing so and so, Hdt.; κ. σφέας εἶναι κλῶπας to suspect them of being thieves, Hdt.; also, οὐκ ἄν κοτε κατέδοξα ἔνθεν ἦν should never have guessed whose son he was, Hdt.

div1.head: καταδοξάζω
div1.sense: = καταδοκέω, Xen.

div1.head: καταδουλόω
div1.sense: to reduce to slavery, enslave, Hdt., Thuc.:—Pass., καταδεδούλωντο, κατεδουλώθησαν Hdt.
Mid. to make a slave to oneself, to enslave, Hdt., Xen.: so in perf. pass., Eur., Plat.
to enslave in mind:—Pass., Xen., Plat.

div1.head: καταδούλωσις
div1.sense: enslavement, subjugation, Thuc.

div1.head: καταδουπέω
div1.sense: to fall with a heavy sound, Anth.

div1.head: Κατάδουποι
div1.sense: the Cataracts of the Nile, Hdt. (Commonly derived from καταδουπέω, as if downroars.)

div1.head: καταδρέπω
div1.sense: to strip off from, τί τινος Hdt.

div1.head: καταδρομή
div1.sense: an inroad, raid, Thuc., etc.:—metaph. a vehement attack, invective, Aeschin.

div1.head: κατάδρομος
div1.sense: overrun, wasted, Eur.

div1.head: κατάδρυμμα
div1.sense: a tearing or rending, Eur.

div1.head: καταδρύπτω
div1.sense: to tear in pieces, rend, Anth.:— Mid., Hes.

div1.head: καταδυναστεύω
div1.sense: to exercise power over, Xen.

div1.head: κατάδυσις
div1.sense: a going down into, descent, Luc.

div1.head: καταδυσωπέω
div1.sense: to put to the blush by earnest intreaty, Luc.

div1.head: καταδύω
div1.sense: intr., in act. pres. καταδύνω and mid. καταδύομαι:— to go down, sink, set, of the sun, ἠέλιος κατέδυ Il.; ἐς ἠέλιον καταδύντα till sun set, Od.; of ships, to be sunk or rather to be disabled (v. infr. II), Hdt., Thuc.:—of persons, καταδεδυκώς having popped down, Ar.

to go down into, plunge into, c. acc., καταδῦναι ὅμιλον, μάχην, δόμον, πόλιν Hom.; foll. by a prep., καταδυσόμεθʼ εἰς Ἀΐδαο δόμους we will go down into . . , Od., etc.:—with a notion of secresy, to insinuate oneself, steal into, Plat.
to slink away and lie hid, καταδύομαι ὑπὸ τῆς αἰσχύνης Xen.
to get into, put on, τεύχεα Hom.
Causal, to make to sink, Lat. submergere, ἐμὲ καταδύουσι τῷ ἄχει Xen.; mostly in aor1, τοὺς γαυλοὺς καταδύσας Hdt.; καταδῦσαι ναῦν to cut it down to the waterʼs edge, disable it, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: κατᾴδω
div1.sense: to sing to, Lat. occinere, and so,
trans. to charm or appease by singing, Luc.; c. dat. to sing a spell or incantation (ἐπῳδή) to another, Hdt.
to deafen by singing, Luc.: Pass. to have another sing before one, Luc.
to sing by way of incantation, βάρβαρα μέλη Eur.

div1.head: καταδωροδοκέω
div1.sense: to take presents, or bribes, Ar.; so in Mid., Ar.

div1.head: καταέννυμι
div1.etym: only in imperf., aor1 and perf. pass.
div1.sense: to clothe, cover, θριξὶ νέκυν καταείνυσαν Il.:— Pass., ὄρος καταειμένον ὕλῃ Od.

div1.head: καταζαίνω
div1.sense: to make quite dry, parch quite up, καταζήνασκε δὲ δαίμων (Ionic aor1), Od.

div1.head: καταζάω
div1.sense: to live on, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: καταζεύγνυμι
div1.sense: to yoke together, yoke, Pind.:—Pass. to be united, Plat.
Pass., also, to be straitened, confined, imprisoned, Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: κατάζευξις
div1.sense: a yoking together:—opp. to ἀνάζευξις, encamping, Plut.

div1.head: καταζώννυμι
div1.sense: to gird fast; Mid. to gird for oneself, Eur.

div1.head: καταθαμβέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be astonished at, c. acc., Plut.

div1.head: καταθάπτω
div1.sense: to bury, Il., Aesch.

div1.head: καταθαρσύνω
div1.sense: to embolden or encourage against, τινὰ πρὸς τὸ μέλλον Plut.:—Pass., in form καταθρασύνομαι, Luc.

div1.head: καταθεάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to look down upon, watch from above, Xen.:—generally, to contemplate, Xen.

div1.head: καταθέλγω
div1.sense: to subdue by spells or enchantments, Od.

div1.head: κατάθελξις
div1.sense: enchantment, Luc.

div1.head: καταθεματίζω
div1.sense: to curse, NTest.

div1.head: καταθέω
div1.sense: to run down, Thuc., Xen.: of ships, to run into port, Xen.
to make inroads, Xen.:—c. acc. to overrun a country, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: καταθεωρέω
div1.sense: to contemplate from above, Plat.

div1.head: καταθήγω
div1.sense: to sharpen, whet, Anth.

div1.head: καταθηλύνω
div1.sense: to make womanish, Luc.

div1.head: καταθλέω
div1.sense: to exercise oneself much, ἠθληκότες well-trained, of soldiers, Plut.

div1.head: καταθλίβω
div1.sense: to press down, press out: aor. 2 pass. part. καταθλιβείς, Plut.

div1.head: καταθνῄσκω
div1.sense: to die away, be dying, and in aor2 and perf. to be dead, Il., Trag.
to die away, disappear, Mosch., Bion.

div1.head: καταθνητός
div1.sense: mortal, Il.

div1.head: καταθορυβέω
div1.sense: to cry down, Plat.

div1.head: καταθραύω
div1.sense: to break in pieces, shatter, Plat.

div1.head: καταθρηνέω
div1.sense: to bewail, lament, mourn, Eur.

div1.head: καταθρῴσκω
div1.sense: to leap down, Il.; c. acc., κ. τὴν αἱμασιήν to leap down the wall, Hdt.

div1.head: καταθυμέω
div1.sense: to be quite cast down, lose all heart, Xen.

div1.head: καταθύμιος
div1.sense: in the mind or thoughts, Od.; μηδέ τί τοι θάνατος κατ. ἔστω let not death sit heavy on thy heart, Il.
according to oneʼs mind, satisfactory, Theogn., Hdt.

div1.head: καταθύω
div1.sense: to sacrifice, Hdt., Xen.
to offer, dedicate, τὴν δεκάτην Xen.
Mid., φίλτροις καταθύσομαι I will compel by magic sacrifices, Theocr.

div1.head: καταθωρακίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be armed at all points, Xen.

div1.head: καταιβάτης
div1.sense: a name of Zeus as descending in thunder and lightning, Ar.:—also of his thunder, descending, hurled down, Aesch.
of Ἀχέρων, that to which one descends, downward, Eur.

div1.head: καταιβατός
div1.sense: θύραι κ. gates by which men descend, downward-leading, Od.

div1.head: καταιγίζω
div1.sense: to rush down like a storm, Aesch.:—generally, to be tempestuous, Anth.

div1.head: καταιδέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to feel shame or reverence before another, stand in awe of him, Hdt., Soph., etc.: c. inf. to be ashamed to do a thing, Eur.

div1.head: καταιθαλόω
div1.sense: to burn to ashes, Eur., Ar.:— Pass., Τροίας πυρὶ κατῃθαλωμένης Eur.

div1.head: καταιθύσσω
div1.sense: to wave or float adown, πλόκαμοι νῶτον καταίθυσσον Pind.; Κάστωρ καταιθύσσει ἑστίαν Castor sheds his lustre down upon the hearth, Pind.

div1.head: καταίθω
div1.sense: to burn down, burn to ashes, Aesch., Eur.: —metaph. of love, Theocr.

div1.head: καταικίζω
div1.sense: to wound severely, to spoil utterly, Od.; so Mid., Eur.

div1.head: καταίνεσις
div1.sense: an agreement: a betrothal, Plut.

div1.head: καταινέω
div1.sense: to agree to a thing, approve of it, c. acc. rei, Hdt.; also c. dat. rei, Thuc.
to agree or promise to do, c. inf., Pind., Soph.; also, κ. τοῦτον βασιλέα σφίσι εἶναι to agree that he should be king, Hdt.
to grant, promise, Soph.: to promise in marriage, betroth, Eur.

div1.head: καταίρω
div1.sense: intr. to come down, make a swoop, of birds, Ar.; of persons, Eur., etc.
of ships, to put into port, put in, Thuc.

div1.head: καταισθάνομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to come to full perception of, Soph.

div1.head: καταίσιος
div1.sense: all righteous, Aesch.

div1.head: καταισχυντήρ
div1.sense: a dishonourer, Aesch.

div1.head: καταισχύνω
div1.sense: to disgrace, dishonour, put to shame, Od., Hdt., Attic; τὴν σὴν οὐ κατ. φύσιν I put not thy nature to shame, i. e. show myself not unworthy of thee, Soph.; ἐμὸν καταίσχυνε χρέος covered me with dishonour in that my debt remained unpaid, Pind.
Mid. to feel shame before, θεούς Soph.; so in aor1 pass., καταισχυνθῆναι, ὅπως μὴ δόξει . . to be ashamed of being thought, Thuc.

div1.head: καταιτιάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to accuse, arraign, reproach, Hdt., Dem.:—Mid. to accuse one another, Hdt.
c. acc. rei, to lay something to oneʼs charge, impute, ἀμαθίαν Thuc.
part. aor1 pass. καταιτιαθείς is used in pass. sense, an accused person, defendant, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: καταῖτυξ
div1.sense: a low helmet or skull-cap of neatʼs leather, Il.

div1.head: καταιωρέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to hang down, κατῃωρεῦντο (Ionic imperf.) Hes.

div1.head: κατακαγχάζω
div1.sense: to laugh aloud at, τινός Anth.

div1.head: κατακαίω
div1.sense: to burn down, burn completely, Hom., Il., Hdt.; κ. τοὺς μάντιας to burn them alive, Hdt.; ζώοντα κατακαυθῆναι Hdt.
Pass., of fire, in tmesi, κατὰ πῦρ ἐκάη had burnt down, burnt out, Il.

div1.head: κατακαλέω
div1.sense: to call down, summon, invite, Thuc.:—Mid., Plut.

div1.head: κατακαλύπτω
div1.sense: to cover up, Il., Hdt., Attic:— Mid., in tmesi, κατὰ κρᾶτα καλυψάμενος having covered his head, Od.; so -καλυψάμενος alone, having veiled oneself, Hdt.; and -κεκαλυμμένος Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: κατακάμπτω
div1.sense: to bend down, so as to be concave, Plat.:—metaph., μ. ἐλπίδας to bend down, overthrow hopes, Eur.:—Pass. to be bent (by intreaty), Aeschin.

div1.head: κατακάρφω
div1.sense: Mid.-pass. to wither away, Aesch.

div1.head: κατακαυχάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to boast against one, exult over him, τινος or κατά τινος NTest.: to have no fear of, τινος NTest.

div1.head: κατάκειμαι
div1.etym: Pass., only in pres. and imperf.
div1.sense: to lie down, lie outstretched, Hom., Ar.; κατακείω used as fut. of κατάκειμαι κατακείετε οἴκαδʼ ἰόντες, Od.; σπείσαντες κατακείομεν (Epic for -κείωμεν) , Od.; κακκείοντες ἔβαν (Epic part.) they went to lie down, Hom.
to lie hid, lurk, Hom.
to lie stored up, Lat. reponi, Il., Hes.
to lie sick, Hdt.:— also to lie idle, Xen.
to recline at meals, Lat. accumbere, πῖνε, κατάκεισο Ar.
of land, to lie sloping to the sea (so Hor. Usticae cubantis), Pind.

div1.head: κατακείρω
div1.sense: to shear off:—Mid., κ. τὰς κεφαλάς to crop their heads close, Hdt.
metaph. to cut away, destroy, squander, Od.

div1.head: κατακεκράκτης
div1.sense: one who cries down, a bawler, Ar.

div1.head: κατακελεύω
div1.sense: to command silence, Ar.: generally, to command, c. inf., Plut.
of the κελευστής, to give the time in rowing, Ar.

div1.head: κατακερδαίνω
div1.sense: to make gain of a thing wrongfully, Xen.

div1.head: κατακερματίζω
div1.sense: to change into small coin: generally, to divide into small parts, to cut up, Plat.

div1.head: κατακερτομέω
div1.sense: to rail violently, Hdt.

div1.head: κατακηλέω
div1.sense: to charm away, Lat. delinire, Soph.

div1.head: κατακηρόω
div1.sense: to cover with wax, Hdt.

div1.head: κατακηρύσσω
div1.sense: to proclaim or command by public crier, Xen.
in an auction, κ. τι εἴς τινα to order it to be knocked down to one, Plut.

div1.head: κατακλαίω
div1.sense: to bewail loudly, lament, Ar.; so in Mid., Eur.
absol. to wail aloud, Eur.

div1.head: κατακλάω
div1.sense: to break down, break short, snap off, Il., Hdt.
metaph. to break down, οὐδένα ὅντινα οὐ κατέκλασε he broke us all down, broke all our hearts, Plat.: Pass., κατεκλάσθη φίλον ἦτορ Od.; φρένας κατεκλάσθη Eur.

div1.head: κατακλείς
div1.sense: an instrument for fastening doors, a key, Ar.

div1.head: κατακλείω
div1.sense: c. acc. pers. to shut in, inclose a mummy in its case, Hdt.; τοὺς Ἕλληνας ἐς τὴν νῆσον κ. to drive them into the island and shut them up there, Thuc.:—Mid. to shut oneself up, Xen.; κατακλᾴξασθαι to shut up the bride with oneself, Theocr.
metaph., νόμῳ κ. to shut up, i. e. to compel, oblige, Dem.; also, εἰς κίνδυνον μέγιστον κατακεκλεῖσθαι to be reduced, Dem.
c. acc. rei, to shut up, close, τὰς πυλίδας Hdt.; τὰ ἱρά Hdt., etc.

div1.head: κατακληροδοτέω
div1.sense: to distribute by lot, NTest.

div1.head: κατακληρονομέω
div1.sense: to obtain by inheritance, Plut.

div1.head: κατακληρόω
div1.sense: to portion out:—Mid. to receive as oneʼs portion, Plut.

div1.head: κατακλινής
div1.sense: sloping, Anth.

div1.head: κατακλίνω
div1.sense: to lay down, δόρυ κατακλίνας ἐπὶ γαίῃ, Od.; κατ. τοὺς Πέρσας εἰς λειμῶνα having made them recline (for dinner) in a meadow, Hdt.; κ. τινὰ εἰς Ἀσκληπιοῦ to lay a sick person in the temple of Aesculapius, that he might sleep there and so be cured, Ar.: —Pass. to lie at table, sit at meat, Lat. accumbere, Hdt., Ar., etc.
metaph. to lay prostrate, overthrow, Theogn.

div1.head: κατάκλισις
div1.sense: a making one to lie down, seating him at table, Plat.; ἡ κ. τοῦ γάμου the celebration of the marriage feast, Hdt.
(from Pass.) a lying at table, sitting at meat, Plat.

div1.head: κατακλύζω
div1.sense: to dash over, flood, deluge, inundate, Hdt., etc.:—metaph. to deluge, overwhelm, Eur., Plat.:—Pass., κύματι κατακλυσθῆν (aor1 inf., poet. for -κλυσθῆναι) , Aesch.
to wash down or away, Pind.
to wash out, wash away, Xen.

div1.head: κατακλυσμός
div1.sense: a deluge, inundation: metaph., Dem.

div1.head: κατακνάω
div1.sense: to scrape away, make away with, Ar.

div1.head: κατακνίζω
div1.sense: to pull to pieces, shred small, Luc.
to tickle: Pass. to itch, Ar.

div1.head: κατακοιμάω
div1.sense: intr. to sleep through, κ. τὴν φυλακήν to sleep out the watch, i. e. sleep all the time of oneʼs watch, Hdt.; so, κατακοιμῆσαι τὴν ἡμέραν Xen.: absol. to go to sleep, Hdt.
in Causal sense, to put to sleep, Soph.:—Pass., aor1 κατακοιμηθῆναι, to go to sleep, sleep, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: κατακοινωνέω
div1.sense: to make one a partaker, Dem.; κ. τὰ τῆς πόλεως to share the public property among themselves, Aeschin.

div1.head: κατακολουθέω
div1.sense: to follow after, obey, Plut.

div1.head: κατακολπίζω
div1.sense: to run into a bay, Thuc.

div1.head: κατακολυμβάω
div1.sense: to dive down, Thuc.

div1.head: κατακομιδή
div1.sense: a bringing down to the sea-shore for exportation, Thuc.

div1.head: κατακομίζω
div1.sense: to bring down, esp. from the inland to the coast, Thuc.
κ. ναῦν to bring it into harbour, Dem.
metaph. to bring into a place of refuge, Dem.

div1.head: κατάκομος
div1.sense: with long falling hair, Eur.

div1.head: κατακονά
div1.sense: destruction, Eur.

div1.head: κατακονδυλίζω
div1.sense: to buffet sharply, Aeschin.

div1.head: κατακοντίζω
div1.sense: to shoot down, Hdt., Dem.

div1.head: κατακόπτω
div1.sense: to cut down, cut in pieces, cut up, Hdt., Ar., etc.: Pass., aor2 part. κατακοπείς cut in pieces, Hdt.
to kill, slay, Hdt., Attic
in a military sense, to cut in pieces, "cut up, " Dem.; Pass., aor2 inf. κατακοπῆναι Xen.
generally, to break in pieces, destroy, Dem.
to coin into money, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: κατακορής
div1.sense: satiated, glutted: metaph. insatiable, excessive, wearisome, Plat.

div1.head: κατάκορος
div1.sense: adv. -ρως, to excess, intemperately, ap. Dem.

div1.head: κατακοσμέω
div1.sense: to set in order, arrange, Od. (in Mid.); ἐπὶ νευρῇ κατακόσμει ὀϊστόν was fitting it on the string, Il.
to fit out completely, adorn, Ar., Plat.
to reduce to order, Plut.

div1.head: κατακούω
div1.sense: to hear and obey, be subject to another, c. dat., Hdt.; c. gen., τινός Dem.
to hearken or give ear to one, Dem.
to hear plainly, τι or τινά, Eur., Thuc., etc.; τινός Ar.

div1.head: κατακράζω
div1.sense: to cry down, outdo in crying, Ar.

div1.head: κατακρατέω
div1.sense: to prevail over, τινός· absol. to prevail, gain the mastery, Hdt., Aesch.; of a name, to prevail, become current, Hdt.

div1.head: κατακρεμάννυμι
div1.sense: to hang up, Od., Hdt.
κατακρέμαμαι Pass. to hang down, be suspended, Hdt.

div1.head: κατακρῆθεν
div1.sense: better κατὰ κρῆθεν, v. κράς II.

div1.head: κατακρημνίζω
div1.sense: to throw down a precipice, Dem., Plut.
generally, to throw headlong down, ἐκ τριηρέων Xen.:—Pass. to be so thrown down, Xen.

div1.head: κατάκρημνος
div1.sense: steep and rugged, Batr.

div1.head: κατάκρης
div1.sense: better κατʼ ἄκρης, v. ἄκρα.

div1.head: κατάκριμα
div1.sense: condemnation, judgment, NTest.

div1.head: κατακρίνω
div1.sense: to give as sentence against, τινός:—Pass., τοῖσι κατακέκριται θάνατος sentence of death has been passed upon them, Hdt.; κατακεκριμένων οἱ τούτων when this sentence has been given against him, Hdt.; impers., ἢν κατακριθῇ μοι if sentence be given against me, Xen.
c. acc. pers. to condemn, κατέκρινάν μιν ἔκδοτον ἄγεσθαι Hdt.; κ. τινὰ θανάτῳ NTest.:—Pass. to be condemned, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: κατακρύπτω
div1.sense: to cover over, hide away, conceal, Hom., etc.
absol. to use concealment, to conceal oneself, of the gods, Od.

div1.head: κατακρυφή
div1.sense: concealment: a subterfuge, Soph.

div1.head: κατακρώζω
div1.sense: to croak at, croak down, like jackdaws, Ar.

div1.head: κατακτάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to get for oneself entirely, gain possession of, and in past tenses, to have in full possession, Soph., etc.

div1.head: κατακτείνω
div1.etym: fut. mid. in pass. sense κατακτανέεσθε
part. mid. κατακτάμενος in pass. sense
div1.sense: to kill, slay, murder, Hom., Hdt.

div1.head: κατακτός
div1.sense: to be sunk or let down, Ar.

div1.head: κατακυβεύω
div1.sense: to lose in dicing:—Pass. to be gambled away, Aeschin.

div1.head: κατακυκλόω
div1.sense: to encircle; in Mid., Plut.

div1.head: κατακυλίνδω
div1.sense: to roll down:—Pass. to be rolled down or thrown off, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: κατακύπτω
div1.sense: to bend down, stoop, Il.:— bend down and peep into a thing, Luc.

div1.head: κατακυριεύω
div1.sense: to gain dominion over, c. gen., NTest.

div1.head: κατακυρόω
div1.sense: to confirm, ratify, Soph.:—Pass., ψήφῳ θανάτου κατακυρωθείς, κατακριθείς, condemned to death, Eur.

div1.head: κατακωλύω
div1.sense: to hinder from doing, Ar.: to detain, keep back, Xen.:—Pass., c. gen. rei, κατεκωλύθη τοῦ πλοῦ Dem.

div1.head: κατακωμάζω
div1.sense: to burst riotously in upon, τὸ δαιμόνιον κατεκώμασε δώμασιν Eur.

div1.head: καταλαζονεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to boast or brag largely, Dem.

div1.head: καταλαλέω
div1.sense: to talk loudly, to blab, Ar.

div1.head: καταλαλιά
div1.sense: evil report, slander, NTest.

div1.head: κατάλαλος
div1.sense: a slanderer, NTest.

div1.head: καταλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to seize upon, lay hold of, Lat. occupare, Od., Hdt., Attic:—Mid. to seize for oneself, Lat. capesso, Hdt.
to seize, overpower, of death and fatigue, Hom.
to seize with the mind, apprehend, comprehend, Plat.
to catch, overtake, come up with, τοὺς φεύγοντας Hdt.: of mischances, to overtake, befall, Hdt.
to surprise, catch, find, Lat. deprehendo, with a partic., κ. τινὰ ζῶντα Hdt.; καταλαμβάνει τοὺς ἄρχοντας ἐξιόντας Dem., etc.
impers., καταλαμβάνει τινά, c. inf., like the Attic συμβαίνει, it happens to one, it is oneʼs fortune to do so and so, τοῦτον κατέλαβε κεῖσθαι Hdt.
absol., τὰ καταλαβόντα τὰ συμβάντα, what happened, the circumstances, Hdt.; ἢν πόλεμος καταλαβῇ Thuc.

to repress, arrest, check, τὴν δύναμιν Κύρου Hdt.; κ. τὸ πῦρ to get it under, Hdt.; κ. ἑαυτόν Hdt.; κ. τὰς διαφοράς to put an end to them, Hdt.:—Pass., ὁ θάνατος καταλαμφθεὶς ἐσιγήθη inquiries about the death being checked, Hdt.
to bind, κ. πίστι, ὁρκίοις, Lat. jurejurando adstringere, to bind by oath, Hdt., Thuc.
to force or compel one to do, c. inf., ἀναγκαίη μιν κ. φαίνειν forces him to bring out the truth, Hdt.:—Pass., καταλαμβανόμενος being constrained, Hdt.

div1.head: καταλαμπτέος
div1.sense: to be arrested, Hdt.

div1.head: καταλάμπω
div1.sense: to shine upon or over, c. gen., Plat.: c. acc., κ. τοὺς στενωπούς to light them, Plut.
absol. to shine, Eur.; so in Mid., Eur.

div1.head: καταλγέω
div1.sense: to suffer much, feel sore pain, Soph.

div1.head: καταλέγω
div1.sense: to lay down: Mid. and Pass. to lie down, go to bed, aor1 κατελέξατο Hom.; Epic syncop. aor2 pass. κατέλεκτο Il., etc.; part. καταλέγμενος and inf. καταλέχθαι Od.; fut. καταλέξομαι Hes.

to pick out, choose out of many, Hdt.:— to choose as soldiers, to enrol, enlist, Ar., Thuc.; Mid. to choose for himself, Hdt., Thuc., etc.:—Pass. to be enlisted or enrolled, Lat. conscribi, Hdt., etc.
to recount, tell at length or in order, in fut. or aor1, ταῦτα καταλέξω Il.; πᾶσαν ἀληθείην κατάλεξον Il.:—Pass., τούτων δὴ τῶν καταλεχθέντων of those which have been recounted, Hdt.
to reckon up, Od., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: καταλείβω
div1.sense: to pour down; absol. to shed tears, Eur.:- Pass. to drop down, Il., Eur.

div1.head: κατάλειπτος
div1.sense: anointed, Ar.

div1.head: καταλείπω
div1.sense: to leave behind, Il.; esp. of persons dying or going into a far country, οἷόν μιν Τροίηνδε κιὼν κατέλειπεν Ὀδυσσεύς Od.; κ. τινὰ μόνον Soph., etc.; so in Mid., καταλείπεσθαι παῖδας to leave behind one, Hdt., etc.: —Pass. καταλελειμμένος τοῦ ἄλλου στρατοῦ being part of the army left behind, Hdt.
to leave as an heritage, Od., Attic; καταλείψει οὐδὲ ταφῆναι will leave not enough to be buried with, Ar.
in Mid., simply, to leave in a certain state, Hdt.
to forsake, abandon, leave in the lurch, Hom., Attic
to leave remaining, ὀκτὼ μόνον Xen.: Mid. to reserve for oneself, Xen.:—Pass., καταλείπεται μάχη yet remains to be fought Xen.
to leave alone, Xen.

div1.head: καταλειτουργέω
div1.sense: to spend all oneʼs substance in bearing the public burdens (λειτουργίαι) , Dem.

div1.head: κατάλειψις
div1.sense: a leaving behind, Plat.

div1.head: καταλεπτολογέω
div1.sense: to waste in subtle talk, Ar.

div1.head: καταλεύω
div1.sense: to stone to death, Hdt., Ar., etc.

div1.head: καταλέω
div1.sense: to grind down, Od., Hdt.

div1.head: καταλήγω
div1.sense: to leave off, end, stop, Aesch.; ποῖ καταλήξει; at what point will it cease? Aesch.:— τὰ καταλήγοντα the limits of a district, Plut.

div1.head: καταλήθομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to forget utterly, τινός Il.

div1.head: καταληπτέος
div1.sense: to be seized or occupied, Plut.

div1.head: καταληπτικός
div1.sense: able to keep down or check, c. gen., Ar.

div1.head: καταληπτός
div1.sense: to be achieved, Thuc.
act. seizing suddenly; πένθος θεόθεν καταληπτόν grief that falls on us from the gods, Eur.

div1.head: κατάληψις
div1.sense: a seizing, ἐν καταλήψει within oneʼs grasp, Thuc.:— an assaulting, Ar.
a taking possession, occupation, Plat., Dem., etc.

div1.head: καταλιθόω
div1.sense: to stone to death, Dem.

div1.head: καταλιμνάζω
div1.sense: to make into a lake or swamp, Byz.

div1.head: καταλιπαρέω
div1.sense: to entreat earnestly, Luc.

div1.head: καταλλαγή
div1.sense: exchange, esp. of money: the profits of the money-changer, Dem.
a change from enmity to friendship, reconciliation, Aesch., etc.
reconciliation of sinners with God, NTest.

div1.head: καταλλακτικός
div1.sense: easy to reconcile, placable, Arist.

div1.head: καταλλάσσω
div1.sense: to change money, Plut., etc.; and so in Mid., Dem.:—Mid. to exchange one thing for another Plat.

to change a person from enmity to friendship, reconcile, Hdt., NTest.:— Mid., καταλλάσσεσθαι τὴν ἔχθρην τινί to make up oneʼs enmity with any one, Hdt.:—Pass., esp. in aor1 κατηλλάχθην or aor2 κατηλλάγην [ᾰ], to become reconciled, Soph., Eur., etc.

div1.head: καταλοάω
div1.sense: to crush in pieces, make an end of, Xen., Aeschin.

div1.head: καταλογάδην
div1.sense: by way of conversation, in prose, Plat.

div1.head: καταλογίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to count up, number, reckon, Xen.; κ. τὸ εὐεργέτημα πρός τινα to put it down to his account, Dem.; καταλογιζέσθω μηδεὶς τοῦθʼ ὑμῖν ἐν ἀρετῇ let no one impute it to you as a virtue, Aeschin.
to count or reckon among, Lat. annumerare, τοὺς ἀχαρίστους ἐν τοῖς ἀδίκοις Xen.

div1.head: κατάλογος
div1.sense: an enrolment, register, list, catalogue, Plat.; κ. νεῶν the catalogue of ships in Il. 2.

at Athens, the register of citizens, Ar., etc.: ὁπλῖται ἐκ καταλόγου soldiers on the list for service, Thuc., etc.; οἱ ἐν τῷ καταλόγῳ Xen.; οἱ ἔξω τοῦ κ., or, οἱ ὑπὲρ τὸν κ., the superannuated, Lat. emeriti, Xen.; καταλόγοις χρηστοῖς ἐκκριθέν, of picked troops, Thuc.

div1.head: καταλοκίζω
div1.sense: to cut into furrows, Eur.

div1.head: καταλούομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to spend in bathing, καταλόει [metri grat. pro -λούει Ar.

div1.head: καταλοφάδεια
div1.sense: = κατὰ τὸν λόφον, on the neck, βῆν δὲ καταλοφάδεια φέρων (sc. τὸν ἔλαφον) Od.

div1.head: καταλοχίζω
div1.sense: to distribute into λόχοι, and generally to distribute, Plut.

div1.head: καταλοχισμός
div1.sense: distribution into bodies, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: κατάλυμα
div1.sense: an inn, lodging, NTest.

div1.head: καταλυμαίνομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to ruin utterly, destroy, Xen.

div1.head: καταλύσιμος
div1.sense: to be dissolved or done away, Soph.

div1.head: κατάλυσις
div1.sense: a dissolving, dissolution of governments, Thuc., etc.
the dismissal or disbanding of a body of men, στρατιᾶς Xen.; εἰς κατάλυσιν till dismissal, of soldiers at a review, Xen.
κ. τοῦ πολέμου an ending of the war, pacification, Thuc., Xen.
generally, an end, termination, Xen.
a resting, lodging, rest, Eur.
= κατάλυμα, a resting-place, guest-chamber, quarters, lodging, καταλύσιες (Ionic for -λύσεις) , Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: καταλύω
div1.sense: to put down, destroy, Il., Eur.

of governments, to dissolve, break up, put down, Hdt., Ar., etc.; κ. τύραννον to put down, to depose, Thuc.; κ. τινὰ τῆς ἀρχῆς Xen.:—Pass., τῶν ἄλλων καταλελυμένων στρατηγῶν having been dismissed, Hdt.,
to dissolve, dismiss, disband a body, καταλύειν τὴν βουλήν Hdt.; τὸ ναυτικόν Dem.
τὴν φυλακὴν κ. to neglect the watch, Ar.
to end, bring to an end, βίοτον Eur.; τὸν βίον Xen.
κ. τὴν εἰρήνην to break the peace, Aeschin.

κ. τὸν πόλεμον to end the war, make peace, Thuc., Xen., etc.; and absol. (sub. τὸν πόλεμον) καταλύειν τινί or πρός τινα to make peace with him, Thuc.:—so in Mid., Thuc., etc.; καταλύεσθαι τὰς ἔχθρας Hdt.
to unloose, unyoke, ἵππους Od.; τὸ σῶμα τοῦ ἀδελφεοῦ κ. to take it down from the wall, Hdt.

intr. to take up oneʼs quarters, to lodge, παρʼ ἐμοὶ καταλύει he is my guest, Plat.; κ. παρά τινα to go and lodge with him, Thuc.: absol. to take oneʼs rest, Ar.; Mid., θανάτῳ καταλυσαίμαν may I take my rest in the grave, Eur.

div1.head: καταλωφάω
div1.sense: to rest from a thing, c. gen., Od.

div1.head: καταμαγεύω
div1.sense: to bewitch, Luc.

div1.head: καταμαλακίζω
div1.sense: to make soft, or effeminate, Jo_chrys.:—Pass. to be or become so, Xen.

div1.head: καταμαλάσσω
div1.sense: to soften much, Luc.; metaph. to appease, Luc.

div1.head: καταμανθάνω
div1.sense: to observe well, examine closely, Hdt., Xen.
to learn thoroughly, τι Plat., etc.
to perceive, understand, Plat., etc.
to discover, find, c. part., καταμαθόντες μιν ἀγοράζοντα Hdt.; κ. τινὰ θύοντα Xen.
to learn thoroughly, and in perf. to have learnt, to be aware, Xen.
to consider, τι Xen.

div1.head: καταμαντεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to divine, surmise, Arist.

div1.head: καταμαργάω
div1.sense: to be stark mad, Hdt.

div1.head: καταμάρπτω
div1.sense: to catch, Lat. deprehendo, Il.; esp. to catch one running away, Hom., Pind.

div1.head: καταμαρτυρέω
div1.sense: to bear witness against, τινός or κατά τινος Oratt.; c. acc. pers. et inf., καταμαρτυροῦσιν αὐτὸν λαβεῖν Dem.:—Pass. to have evidence given against one, Dem.
Pass. also of the evidence, to be given against one, Dem.

div1.head: καταμάχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to subdue, conquer, Plut.

div1.head: καταμάω
div1.etym: used by Hom. only once in Epic aor1 mid. κατ-αμήσατο
div1.sense: to scrape over, pile up, heap up, Il.
in Act., to cut down, reap like corn (cf. ἀμάω) , Soph.

div1.head: καταμβλύνω
div1.sense: to blunt, or dull, Soph.: aor1 pass. κατημβλύνθην Anth.

div1.head: καταμεθύσκω
div1.sense: Causal, to make quite drunk, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: καταμελέω
div1.sense: to take no care of, c. gen., Xen.: absol. to pay no heed, be heedless, Soph., Xen.

div1.head: καταμελιτόω
div1.sense: to spread over with honey, metaph. of the nightingaleʼs voice, Ar.

div1.head: κατάμεμπτος
div1.sense: blamed by all, abhorred, Soph.: neut. pl. as adv. so as to have cause to find fault, Il.

div1.head: καταμέμφομαι
div1.sense: to find great fault with, blame greatly, accuse, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: κατάμεμψις
div1.sense: a blaming, finding fault, Thuc.; οὐκ ἔχει τινὶ κατάμεμψιν it leaves him no ground for censure, Thuc.

div1.head: καταμένω
div1.sense: to stay behind, stay, Hdt., Attic
to remain fixed, continue in a certain state, Xen.

div1.head: καταμερίζω
div1.sense: to cut in pieces, Luc.
to distribute, Xen.

div1.head: καταμετρέω
div1.sense: to measure out to, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: καταμηλόω
div1.sense: to put in a probe: metaph., κημὸν κ. to use the ballot-box as a probe, i. e. make a peculator disgorge what he has stolen, Ar.

div1.head: καταμηνύω
div1.sense: to point out, make known, indicate, Hdt.
to inform against, τινός Xen.

div1.head: καταμιαίνω
div1.sense: to taint, defile, Pind., Plat.:— Pass. to wear squalid garments as a sign of grief, wear mourning (cf. Lat. sordidatus), Hdt.

div1.head: καταμίγνυμι
div1.sense: to mix up, mingle the ingredients, Il., Ar.

div1.head: καταμισθοφορέω
div1.sense: to spend in paying public servants or soldiers, Ar., Aeschin.

div1.head: κατάμομφος
div1.sense: liable to blame, inauspicious, Aesch.

div1.head: καταμόνας
div1.sense: better divisim κατὰ μόνας, v. μόνος.

div1.head: καταμονομαχέω
div1.sense: to conquer in single combat, Plut.

div1.head: καταμπέχω
div1.sense: to encompass, κ. ἐν τύμβῳ, i. e. to bury him, Eur.

div1.head: κατάμυσις
div1.sense: a closing of the eyes, Plut.

div1.head: καταμύσσω
div1.sense: to tear, scratch, Theocr.:—Mid., καταμύξατο χεῖρα she scratched her hand, Il.

div1.head: καταμυττωτεύω
div1.sense: to make mincemeat of, Ar.

div1.head: καταμύω
div1.sense: to shut or close the eyes, Xen., NTest.:—hence to drop asleep, doze, Batr., Ar.

div1.head: καταμφικαλύπτω
div1.sense: to put all round, Od.

div1.head: καταμωκάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to mock at, τινος Plut.

div1.head: καταναγκάζω
div1.sense: to overpower by force, confine, Eur.
to coerce, τινὰ ἐς ξυμμαχίαν Thuc.

div1.head: κατανάθεμα
div1.sense: a curse, NTest.

div1.head: καταναθεματίζω
div1.sense: to curse, NTest.

div1.head: καταναίω
div1.sense: to make to dwell, settle, only used in aor1 κατένασσα Hes.:—Mid., aor1 κατανασσαμένη Aesch.: —Pass. to take up oneʼs abode, dwell, only in aor1 κατενάσθην, Eur.; poet. 3rd pl. κατένασθεν Ar.

div1.head: καταναλίσκω
div1.sense: to use up, spend, lavish, Xen., Plat.:—Pass., with perf. act., to be lavished, Plat.

div1.head: καταναρκάω
div1.sense: to be slothful towards, press heavily upon, c. gen., NTest.

div1.head: κατανάσσω
div1.sense: to stamp or beat down firmly, Hdt.

div1.head: καταναυμαχέω
div1.sense: to conquer in a sea-fight, Xen., etc.:—Pass. to be so conquered, Luc.

div1.head: κατανέμω
div1.sense: to distribute, allot, assign, esp. as pasture-land, Hdt., Dem.
to distribute, divide into separate bodies, Xen.:—of a single person, κ. τινὰ εἰς τὴν τάξιν to assign him to his post, Aeschin.
Mid. or Pass. to divide among themselves, Thuc., Plat.
to occupy with cattle, to graze land, Lat. depasci, Isocr.:—metaph. to plunder, Babr.

div1.head: κατανεύω
div1.sense: to nod assent, Il.: c. acc. rei, to grant, promise, Il.; so c. inf., generally, to make a sign by nodding the head, Od.

div1.head: κατανέω
div1.sense: to heap up, Hdt.

div1.head: κατανθρακίζω
div1.sense: to burn to cinders, Anth.

div1.head: κατανθρακόω
div1.sense: to burn to cinders,

div1.head: κατανίφω
div1.sense: to cover with snow, Ar.: metaph. to sprinkle as with snow, Luc.
absol., κατανίφει it snows, κεἰ κριμνώδη κατανίφοι even were it to snow thick as meal, Ar.

div1.head: κατανοέω
div1.sense: to observe well, to understand, Hdt., Plat.
to perceive, Thuc.
to learn, Thuc.
to consider, περί τινος Xen.

div1.head: κατανόησις
div1.sense: observation: means of observing, Plut.

div1.head: κατάνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be used up or wasted, Od.

div1.head: κατανοτίζω
div1.sense: to bedew, Eur.

div1.head: κάταντα
div1.sense: down-hill, Il.

div1.head: κατάντης
div1.sense: down-hill, downward, steep, Ar.; εἰς τὸ κάταντες downwards, Xen.
metaph. prone, inclined, πρός τι Eur.

div1.head: κατάντηστιν
div1.sense: better κατʼ ἄντηστιν, so as to face, right opposite, Od.

div1.head: καταντικρύ
div1.sense: prep. with gen. straight down from, Od.
= ἀντῑκρύ, right opposite, ἐς τὰ κ. Κυθήρων to the parts opposite Cythera, Thuc.; κατ. ᾗ εἰσρεῖ exactly opposite to the point at which it flows in, Plat.
as adv. of Place, right opposite, ἡ ἤπειρος ἡ κ. Thuc.; ἐκ τοῦ κ. from the opposite side, Plat.
straightforward, downright, Thuc.

div1.head: καταντίον
div1.sense: over against, right opposite, facing, c. gen., Hdt.; c. dat., Hdt.; absol., Soph.

div1.head: καταντλέω
div1.sense: to pour water over:—metaph. to pour a flood of words over, τινός Ar.

div1.head: κατάνυξις
div1.sense: stupefaction, slumber, NTest.

div1.head: κατανύσσω
div1.sense: in Pass. to be sorely pricked, κατενύγησαν τῇ καρδίᾳ NTest.
to be stupefied, to slumber, Lxx.

div1.head: κατανύω
div1.sense: to bring to quite an end: esp.,
to accomplish a certain distance, δρόμον, ὁδόν Hdt., Xen.
(the acc. being omitted) intr. to arrive at a place, Hdt., Soph., etc.
to accomplish, perpetrate, Eur.; κ. αἷμα to murder, Eur.

div1.head: καταξαίνω
div1.sense: to card or comb well: to tear in pieces, rend in shreds, Eur.; καταξαίνειν τινὰ εἰς φοινικίδα to pound him to red rags, Ar.:—Pass., καταξανθείς crushed to atoms, Soph.; πρὶν κατεξάνθαι Eur.
to wear or waste away, Lat. atterere, Aesch.: Pass., κατεξάνθην πόνοις, δακρύοις Eur.

div1.head: καταξενόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be received as a guest, perf. part. κατεξενωμένος Aesch.

div1.head: κατάξιος
div1.sense: quite or very worthy of, c. gen., Soph.; absol., Eur. adv. -ίως, Eur.

div1.head: καταξιόω
div1.sense: to deem worthy, Plat.:—Mid. to hold in high esteem, Aesch.
πολλὰ χαίρειν ξυμφοραῖς καταξιῶ I bid a long farewell to calamities, Aesch.; σύ τοι κατηξίωσας thou wouldʼst have it so, Soph.

div1.head: καταπαίζω
div1.sense: to mock at, τινός Anth.

div1.head: καταπακτός
div1.sense: shutting downwards, καταπακτὴ θύρα a trap-door, Hdt.

div1.head: καταπαλαίω
div1.sense: to throw in wrestling, Ar.: metaph. to overthrow, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: καταπάλλομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to vault or leap down, οὐρανοῦ ἐκ κατέπαλτο (Epic syncop. aor2 for κατεπάλετο) , Il.

div1.head: καταπάσσω
div1.sense: to besprinkle or bespatter, Ar.:—Pass., καταπαττόμενος Ar.
c. acc. rei, to sprinkle or strew over, Ar.

div1.head: κατάπαστος
div1.sense: besprinkled, Ar.
embroidered, Ar.

div1.head: καταπατέω
div1.sense: to trample down, trample under foot, Thuc., etc.; κ. ὑσὶ τὸ σπέρμα to trample down the seed (i. e. have it trampled down) by swine, Hdt.: —Pass., Hdt., Thuc., etc.
metaph. in tmesi, κατὰ δʼ ὅρκια πιστὰ πάτησαν Il.

div1.head: κατάπαυμα
div1.sense: a means of stopping, Il.

div1.head: κατάπαυσις
div1.sense: a putting to rest: a putting down, deposing, Hdt.
a cessation, calm, NTest.

div1.head: καταπαύω
div1.sense: to lay to rest, put an end to, Hom., Hdt.:— Mid., Eur.
c. acc. pers. to lay to rest, i. e. kill, Il.
to make one stop from a thing, hinder or check from, c. gen., Hom.:—and c. acc. only, to stop, keep in check, Hom., Hdt.
like καταλύω, to put down or depose from power, κ. τινὰ τῆς ἀρχῆς, τῆς βασιληΐης Hdt.; κ. τοὺς τυράννους Hdt.:—Pass., τῆς βασιληΐης κατεπαύθη Hdt.
to put down, τὴν Κύρου δύναμιν Hdt.; τὸν δῆμον Thuc.
Pass. and Mid. to leave off from, cease from, τινος Hdt., etc.
absol. to leave off, cease, Ar., etc.
the Act. is also used intr. like Mid., Eur.

div1.head: καταπεδάω
div1.sense: to fetter, hamper, Hom.

div1.head: καταπείθω
div1.sense: to persuade, Luc.

div1.head: καταπειλέω
div1.sense: to threaten loudly, κατ. ἔπη to use threatening words, Soph.; τὰ κατηπειλημένα the threats uttered, Soph.

div1.head: κατά

trans.i: down, downwards, with gen. or acc.

div1.sense: prep. with gen. or acc. Radical sense down, downwards.
WITH GENIT.,
denoting motion from above, down from, βῆ δὲ κατʼ Οὐλύμποιο καρήνων Il., etc.
denoting downward motion,
down upon or over, κατὰ χθονὸς ὄμματα πήξας Il.; of the dying, κατʼ ὀφθαλμῶν κέχυτʼ ἀχλύς a cloud settled upon the eyes, Il.; so, ὕδωρ κατὰ χειρός, v. χείρ II. 6.
down into, νέκταρ στάξε κατὰ ῥινῶν Od.; so, κατὰ χθονὸς (or γῆς) δῦναι Trag.; κατὰ χθονὸς κρύπτειν to bury, Soph., etc.

εὔχεσθαι or ὀμόσαι κατά τινος to vow or swear by a thing (because one calls down the vengeance of the gods upon it), Thuc., Dem.:—also to make a vow towards something, i. e. make a vow of offering it, Ar.

in hostile sense, against, Aesch., etc.; esp. of judges giving sentence against a person, Aesch.; λόγος κατά τινος a speech against one accused, Lat. in aliquem; λόγος πρός τινα an answer to an opponent, Lat. adversus aliquem.
Lat. de, upon, in respect of, concerning, σκοπεῖν κατά τινος Plat.; ἔπαινος κατά τινος praise bestowed upon one, Aeschin., etc.
WITH ACCUS.,
of motion downwards, κατὰ ῥόον down stream, Hdt.; κατʼ οὖρον ἰέναι, ῥεῖν to sail down (i. e. with) the wind, Aesch.
of motion, on, over, throughout a space, Hom., etc.; καθʼ Ἑλλάδα Aesch.; κατὰ γῆν καὶ θάλασσαν by land and sea, etc.: —also to hit upon the shield, Il.
opposite, over against, κατὰ Σινώπην πόλιν Hdt.; ἀνὴρ κατʼ ἄνδρα Aesch.
κατὰ τὸ προάστειον somewhere in the suburb, Hdt.
distributively, of a whole divided into parts, κατὰ φῦλα, κατὰ φρήτρας by tribes, by clans, Il.; κατὰ κώμας κατῳκῆσθαι to live in separate villages, Hdt.; κατʼ ἄνδρα man by man, Hdt.
so of parts of Time, καθʼ ἡμέραν, κατʼ ἦμαρ day by day, daily, v. ἡμέρα III, ἦμαρ.
of numbers, by so many at a time, καθʼ ἕνα one at a time, Hdt.; κατὰ τὰς πέντε καὶ εἴκοσι μνᾶς πεντακοσίας δραχμὰς εἰσφέρειν to pay 500 drachmae on every 25 minae, Dem., etc.
of direction towards an object, πλεῖν κατὰ πρῆξιν on a business, for or after, Od.; κατὰ ληΐην in quest of booty, Hdt.; κατὰ θέαν ἥκειν to have come for the purpose of seeing, Thuc.
of pursuit, κατʼ ἴχνος on the track, Soph.

according to, κατὰ θυμόν Hom.; καθʼ ἡμέτερον νόον after our liking, Il.; κατὰ μοῖραν as is meet and right, Hom.; so, κατʼ αἶσαν, κατὰ κόσμον Hom.; καθʼ ἡδονήν so as to please, Aesch.; κατὰ δύναμιν to the best of oneʼs power, et.

in relation to, concerning, τὰ κατʼ ἀνθρώπους τὰ ἀνθρώπινα, Aesch.; so, τὸ καθʼ ὑμᾶς as far as concerns you, Hdt.; κατὰ τοῦτο according to this way, in this view; κατὰ ταὐτά in the same way, καθʼ ὅτι so far as, etc.

implying comparison, κατὰ λοπὸν κρομύοιο like the coat of a leek, Od.; κατὰ Μιθραδάτην answering to the description of him, Hdt.; κατὰ πνιγέα very like an oven, Ar.; κηδεῦσαι καθʼ ἑαυτόν to marry in oneʼs own rank of life, Aesch.; κατʼ ἄνθρωπον like a man, as befits a man, Aesch.; κατʼ ἄνδρα, μὴ θεόν Aesch.:—after a comp., μείζων ἢ κατʼ ἀνθρώπου greater than befits a man, Hdt.; μείζω ἢ κατὰ δάκρυα too great to weep for, Thuc.
by the favour of a god, κατὰ δαίμονα, Lat. non sine numine, Pind.; κατὰ θεόν Hdt.
of loosely stated numbers, nearly, about, κατὰ ἑξηκόσια ἔτεα 600 years more or less, Hdt.
of Time, during, sometime in a period, κατὰ τὸν πόλεμον in the course of the war, Hdt.; καθʼ ἡμέραν by day, Aesch.
about, κατὰ τὸν αὐτὸν χρόνον Hdt.; κατὰ Ἄμασιν βασιλεύοντα about the time of Amasis, Hdt.
used periphr. for Adverbs, as, καθʼ ἡσυχίην, κατὰ τάχος, etc., for ἡσύχως, ταχέως, Hdt.; κατὰ μέρος partially; κατὰ φύσιν naturally; etc.
Position: when κατά follows its case it is written with anastr. κάτα.
absol. as adv. like κάτω, downwards, Hom.
κατά in Compos.,
downwards, down, as in καταβαίνω.
in answer to, in accordance with, as in κατᾴδω, καταθύμιος.
against, in hostile sense, as καταγιγνώσκω, κατακρίνω.
often only to strengthen the notion of the simple word, as κατακόπτω, καταφαγεῖν.

κατά as a prep. was sometimes shortened, esp. in Epic into κάγ, κάκ, κάμ, κάν, κάπ, κάρ, κάτ, before γ, κ, μ, ν, π (or φ, ῥ, τ (or θ) , respectively; see these forms in their own places. Mss. and the older Edd. join the prep. with the following word, as καγγόνυ, καδδε, κακκεφαλῆς, καππεδίον, καπφάλαρα, καρρόον, καττάδε, καττόν, etc. In compd. Verbs, κατά sometimes changes into καβ, καλ, καρ, κατ, before β, λ, ρ, θ, respectively, as κάββαλε, κάτθανε, κάλλιπε, καρρέζουσα; and before στ, σχ, the second syll. sometimes disappears, as in καστορνῦσα, κάσχεθε, κασσύω, as also in Doric forms καβαίνων, κάπετον.

div1.head: καταπειρατηρία
div1.sense: a sounding-line, Hdt.

div1.head: καταπελτάζω
div1.sense: to overrun with light-armed troops (πελτασταί) , Ar.

div1.head: καταπεμπτέος
div1.sense: to be sent down, Luc.

div1.head: καταπέμπω
div1.sense: to send down, Hes.; esp. from the inland to the sea-coast, Xen.
to send from head-quarters, to dispatch, Dem.

div1.head: καταπενθέω
div1.sense: to mourn for, bewail, Anth.

div1.head: καταπέρδομαι
div1.sense: to break wind at, τινός Ar.

div1.head: καταπέσσω
div1.sense: to boil down, to digest food, Arist.:—metaph. to digest, keep from rising, Lat. concoquere, κ. χόλον Il.; κ. μέγαν ὄλβον, i. e. to bear great fortune meekly, Pind.

div1.head: καταπετάννυμι
div1.sense: to spread out over, Il., Eur.
to spread or cover with, τί τινι Ar., Xen.

div1.head: καταπέτασμα
div1.sense: a curtain, veil, NTest.

div1.head: καταπέτομαι
div1.sense: to fly down, Hdt., Ar., etc.

div1.head: καταπετρόω
div1.sense: to stone to death, Xen.

div1.head: καταπεφρονηκότως
div1.sense: contemptuously, Dem.

div1.head: καταπήγνυμι
div1.sense: to stick fast in the ground, plant firmly, Il., Hdt., etc.
Pass., with perf. and plup. act., to stand fast or firm in, Il.; absol., στήλη καταπεπηγυῖα Hdt.

div1.head: καταπηδάω
div1.sense: to leap down, Xen.

div1.head: καταπίμπλημι
div1.sense: to fill full of a thing, c. gen., Plat.

div1.head: καταπίμπρημι
div1.sense: to burn to ashes, Anth.

div1.head: καταπίνω
div1.sense: to gulp or swallow down, Hes., Hdt., Attic
metaph., κ. Εὐριπίδην to drink in Euripides, i. e. imbibe his spirit, Ar.
to swallow up, consume, Ar.
to spend in tippling, Aeschin.

div1.head: καταπιπράσκω
div1.sense: to sell outright, καταπραθείς Luc.

div1.head: καταπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall or drop down, Hom., Hdt., Attic;—used as Pass., κάππεσε κατεβλήθη, Aesch.
metaph., κάππεσε θυμός their spirit fell, Il.; κ. εἰς ἀπιστίαν Plat.
to have the falling sickness, Luc.

div1.head: καταπισσόω
div1.sense: to cover with pitch, to pitch over and burn (as a punishment), Plat.

div1.head: καταπιστεύω
div1.sense: to trust, Plut.

div1.head: καταπλάσσω
div1.sense: to plaster over with clay, etc., Hdt., Ar.:—Mid., καταπλάσσεσθαι τὴν κεφαλήν to plaster oneʼs own head, Hdt.; τοῦτο καταπλάσσονται ὅλον τὸ σῶμα this they plaster over their whole body, Hdt.

div1.head: καταπλαστός
div1.sense: plastered over, καταπλαστὸν φάρμακον a plaster, Ar.

div1.head: καταπλέκω
div1.sense: to entwine, plait, Hdt.
metaph. to implicate, κ. τινὰ προδοσίᾳ Hdt.
to finish twining: metaph. to bring to an end, τὴν ζόην, τὴν ῥῆσιν Hdt.

div1.head: κατάπλεος
div1.sense: gen. ω, quite full, τινος of a thing:— fouled or stained with a thing, γῆς κατάπλεως καὶ αἵματος Xen.

div1.head: καταπλέω
div1.sense: to sail down: i. e.,
to sail from the high sea to shore, sail to land, put in, Od., Hdt., Attic; νεωστὶ καταπεπλευκώς having lately come ashore, Plat.
to sail down stream, κατ. τὸν Εὐφρήτην Hdt.
to sail back, Hdt.

div1.head: κατάπληξις
div1.sense: amazement, consternation, Thuc.

div1.head: καταπλήσσω
div1.sense: to strike down: metaph. to strike with amazement, astound, terrify, Thuc., Xen., etc.:—Pass. to be panic-stricken, amazed, astounded, κατεπλήγη (aor2) Il.; Attic aor2 inf., καταπλαγῆναι Thuc.; 2nd pl. perf. καταπέπληχθε Thuc.; c. acc., καταπλαγέντες τὸν Φίλιππον Dem.

div1.head: καταπλήξ
div1.sense: stricken with amazement, astounded, Lys.
shy, bashful, Arist.

div1.head: κατάπλοος
div1.sense: a sailing down to land, a putting ashore, putting in, Thuc.
a sailing back, return, Xen.

div1.head: καταπλουτίζω
div1.sense: to enrich greatly, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: καταπλύνω
div1.sense: to wash by pouring over, to drench, Xen.
to wash out:—Pass., metaph., τὸ πρᾶγμα καταπέπλυται the affair is washed out, i. e. forgotten, Aeschin.

div1.head: κατάπλυσις
div1.sense: a bathing in water, Xen.

div1.head: καταπνέω
div1.sense: to breathe upon or over, c. gen., Eur.
to inspire, Aesch.; θεὸς καταπνεῖ σε Eur.

div1.head: καταπνοή
div1.sense: a blowing, Pind.

div1.head: καταπόδα
div1.sense: -πόδας, less correct forms for κατὰ πόδα, κατὰ πόδας.

div1.head: καταπολεμέω
div1.sense: to war down, i. e. to exhaust by war, subdue completely, reduce, Lat. debellare, Thuc., Xen.: in pres. to attempt to subdue, Thuc.: —Pass., ἐλπίζοντες τὴν πόλιν καταπεπολεμῆσθαι Thuc.

div1.head: καταπολιτεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to subdue by policy, Dem.

div1.head: καταπολύ
div1.sense: less correct form for κατὰ πολύ

div1.head: καταπονέω
div1.sense: to subdue after a hard struggle: — Pass. to be so subdued, Aeschin.

div1.head: κατάπονος
div1.sense: tired, wearied, Plut.

div1.head: καταποντίζω
div1.sense: to throw into the sea, drown therein, Dem., καταποντίζω, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: καταποντιστής
div1.sense: one who throws into the sea, Dem.

div1.head: καταπορνεύω
div1.sense: to prostitute, Hdt.

div1.head: καταπράσσω
div1.sense: to accomplish, execute, Xen.
to achieve, gain, Xen.:—Mid. to achieve for oneself, Xen.:—Pass., τὰ καταπεπραγμένα Xen.

div1.head: καταπραΰνω
div1.sense: to soften down, appease, Plat.

div1.head: καταπρηνής
div1.sense: down-turned, of the hand as used in striking or grasping, χειρὶ καταπρηνεῖ with the flat of his hand, Il.; χείρεσσι καταπρηνέσσι Od.

div1.head: καταπρηνόω
div1.sense: to throw headlong down, Anth.

div1.head: καταπρίω
div1.sense: to saw up, Hdt.
to cut or bite into pieces, Theocr.

div1.head: καταπροδίδωμι
div1.sense: to betray utterly, leave in the lurch, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: καταπροΐξομαι
div1.etym: a fut. without any pres. in use
div1.sense: to do a thing without return, i. e. with impunity, used with a negat., οὐκ ἐμὲ λωβησάμενος καταπροΐξεται he shall not escape for having insulted me, Hdt.; οὐ καταπροΐξονται ἀποστάντες, Hdt.; οὔ τοι καταπροίξει πολλὰ κλέψας Ar.:— absol., ἐκείνους οὐ καταπροΐξεσθαι ἔφη he said that they should not get off scot-free, Hdt.
c. gen. pers., οὔ τοι ἐμοῦ καταπροίξει you will not escape for this despite done to me, Ar.

div1.head: κατάπτερος
div1.sense: winged, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: καταπτήσσω
div1.sense: to crouch down, to lie crouching or cowering, Hom., Hes.
c. acc. to cower beneath, Plut.

div1.head: κατάπτυστος
div1.sense: to be spat upon, abominable, despicable, Aesch., Eur., Dem.

div1.head: καταπτυχής
div1.sense: with ample folds, Theocr.

div1.head: καταπτύω
div1.sense: to spit upon or at, esp. as a mark of abhorrence, c. gen., Dem., Aeschin.

div1.head: καταπτωχεύω
div1.sense: to reduce to beggary, Plut.

div1.head: καταπυγοσύνη
div1.sense: brutal lust, Ar.

div1.head: καταπύγων
div1.sense: a lewd fellow, Ar.

div1.head: καταπύθω
div1.sense: to make rotten, Hhymn.:— Pass. to become rotten, Il.

div1.head: κατάπυκνος
div1.sense: very thick, Theocr.

div1.head: καταπυκνόω
div1.sense: to stud thickly with a thing, Plut.

div1.head: κατάρα
div1.sense: a curse, κατάρην ποιεῖσθαί τινι to lay a curse upon one, Hdt.; διδόναι τινὰ κατάρᾳ Eur.

div1.head: καταράομαι
div1.sense: Dep.

to call down curses upon, imprecate upon, τί τινι Hom., Hdt.:—c. inf., καταρῶνται ἀπολέσθαι they pray that he may perish, Theogn.:—c. dat. pers. only, to curse, execrate, Hdt., Ar., etc.; later, c. acc. pers., Plut., NTest.
absol. to utter imprecations, Ar.
perf. pass. part. κατ-ηρᾱμένος in pass. sense, accursed, Ar.

div1.head: κατάρατος
div1.sense: accursed, abominable, Eur., Ar.; comp. -ότερος Dem.; †sup. -ότατος Soph.

div1.head: καταργέω
div1.sense: to leave unemployed or idle, Eur.; κ. τὴν γῆν to occupy the ground uselessly, cumber it, NTest.
to make of none effect, NTest.:—Pass., καταργηθῆναι to be abolished, cease, NTest.; κ. ἀπὸ τοῦ νόμου to be set free from the law, NTest.

div1.head: καταργίζω
div1.sense: to make to tarry, v. sub ἀπαρτίζω.

div1.head: κάταργμα
div1.sense: only in pl. κατάργματα, the first offerings, Eur.
the purifications made by such offerings, Plut.

div1.head: καταργυρόω
div1.sense: to cover with silver:—Pass., καταργυρωμένος (Ionic for kathrg-) silvered, Hdt.
to buy or bribe with silver, κατηργυρωμένος Soph.

div1.head: κατάρδω
div1.sense: to water:—metaph. to besprinkle with praise, Ar.

div1.head: καταριγηλός
div1.sense: making one shudder, horrible, Od.

div1.head: καταριθμέω
div1.sense: to count or reckon among, Eur., Plat.
to recount in detail, Plat.:—in Mid. to recount, enumerate, Plat.

div1.head: καταρκέω
div1.sense: to be fully sufficient, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: καταρνέομαι
div1.sense: to deny strongly, persist in denying, Soph.

div1.head: καταρόω
div1.sense: to plough up, τὴν γῆν Ar.

div1.head: καταρραθυμέω
div1.sense: to lose from carelessness, Xen., Dem.:—Pass., τὰ κατερρᾳθυμημένα things lost through negligence, Dem.
intr. to be very careless, καταρρᾳθυμήσαντες through carelessness, Xen.

div1.head: καταρρακόω
div1.sense: to tear into shreds: perf. pass. part. κατερρακωμένος in rags or tatters, Soph.

div1.head: καταρράκτης
div1.sense: as adj. down-rushing, τὸν καταρράκτην ὀδόν (Attic for οὐδόν) to the downward entrance [of Hades], Soph.
as Subst. broken water, a waterfall, Lat. cataracta, Strab.
a kind of portcullis, Plut.
a sea-bird, so called from rushing down upon its prey, a gull, Ar.

div1.head: καταρρακτός
div1.sense: κ. θύρα, a trap-door, Plut.

div1.head: καταρράπτω
div1.sense: to stitch on or over, θύρη κατερραμμένη ῥιπὶ καλάμων a frame lashed to a crate of reeds, Hdt.
to stitch tight, Plut.
metaph. to devise, compass, Aesch.

div1.head: κατάρραφος
div1.sense: sewn together, patched, Luc.

div1.head: καταρρέζω
div1.sense: to pat with the hand, to stroke, caress, like Lat. mulcere, χειρὶ δέ μιν κατέρεξε (Epic for katerr-) Hom.; also καρρέζουσα (Epic for katarr-) Il.

div1.head: καταρρέπω
div1.sense: to make to incline downwards, make to fall, Soph.

div1.head: καταρρέω
div1.sense: to flow down, Il., Hdt., Attic
of men, to stream or rush down, Ar., Thuc.
of fruit, leaves, etc., to fall off, Xen.
to fall in ruins, Dem.
κ. εἴς τινα to come to, fall to the lot of, Theocr., Bion.
κ. φόνῳ to run down with blood, Eur.; so in Mid., Plut.

div1.head: καταρρήγνυμι
div1.sense: to break down, τὴν γέφυραν Hdt.; μέλαθρα Eur.
to tear in pieces, rend, Dem.:—Mid., κατερρήξαντο τοὺς κιθῶνας they rent their coats, Hdt.
in Soph. Ant. 675 τροπὰς καταρρήγνυσι ἡ ἀναρχία breaks up armies and turns them to flight.
Pass., aor2 κατερράγην [ᾰ], with perf. act. κατέρρωγα:— to be broken down, to be thrown down and broken, Hdt.
to fall or rush down, to break or burst out, of storms, Hdt.; of tears, Eur.:—metaph., ὁ πόλεμος κατερράγη Ar.
to be broken in pieces, Αἴγυπτος μελάγγαιός τε καὶ κατερρηγμένη with black and crumbling soil, Hdt.
to dash down, break in pieces, τοὺς λοιπούς κατήραξεν ἐς τὸν Κιθαιρῶνα drove them shattered to Cithaerae, Hdt.; τὸ στράτευμα κατηράχθη εἰς τὰ τειχίσματα Thuc.
intr. to fall down, fall headlong, Plut.

div1.head: καταρρινάω
div1.sense: to file down:— metaph., κατερρινημένον τι polished, elegant, Ar.

div1.head: καταρρίπτω
div1.sense: to throw down, overthrow, Aesch.

div1.head: κατάρροος
div1.sense: a running from the head, a catarrh, Plat.

div1.head: καταρροφέω
div1.sense: to gulp or swallow down, Xen.

div1.head: καταρρυής
div1.sense: falling away, Soph.

div1.head: κατάρρυτος
div1.sense: irrigated, watered, Eur.
carried down by water, alluvial, of the Delta, Hdt.

div1.head: καταρρωδέω
div1.sense: to fear, dread, Hdt.

div1.head: καταρρώξ
div1.sense: jagged, broken, Soph.

div1.head: κάταρσις
div1.sense: a landing-place, Thuc.

div1.head: καταρτάω
div1.sense: to hang down from, hang on or append, Plut.
to adjust, χρῆμα κατηρτημένον a well-adjusted or convenient thing, Hdt.

div1.head: καταρτίζω
div1.sense: to adjust or put in order again, restore, Hdt.; κ. δίκτυα to put nets to rights, mend them, NTest.:—metaph. to restore to a right mind, NTest.
to furnish completely: perf. pass. part. κατηρτισμένος, absol., well-furnished, complete, Hdt., NTest.

div1.head: κατάρτισις
div1.sense: restoration, NTest.
a training, education, discipline, Plut.

div1.head: καταρτιστήρ
div1.sense: one who restores order, a mediator, Hdt.

div1.head: καταρτύω
div1.sense: to prepare, dress, of food, Luc.
generally, to train, educate, discipline: — Pass. to be trained, disciplined, Solon., Soph.
c. inf., κ. μολεῖν to procure his coming, Soph.
intr. in part. perf., κατηρτυκὼς ἱκέτης, metaph., a complete suppliant, one who has done all that is required, Aesch.

div1.head: καταρχαιρεσιάζω
div1.sense: to defeat in an election, esp. by unfair means, Plut.

div1.head: καταρχάς
div1.sense: less correct form for κατʼ ἀρχάς

div1.head: κατάρχω
div1.sense: to make beginning of a thing, c. gen., Aesch.; ὁδοῦ κατάρχειν to lead the way, Soph.:— rarely c. acc. to begin a thing, Plat.:—c. part. to begin doing, Xen.
to honour, Eur.
Mid. to make a beginning, to begin, like Act., c. gen., Eur., Plat.; also c. acc., Eur.: absol., κατάρχεται μέλος is beginning, Eur.

in religious sense, to begin the sacrificial ceremonies, Νέστωρ χέρνιβά τʼ οὐλοχύτας τε κατήρχετο Nestor began [the sacrifice] with the washing of hands and sprinkling the barley on the victimʼs head, Od.; κατάρχομαι I begin the function, Eur.:—c. gen., κατάρχεσθαι τοῦ τράγου to make a beginning of the victim, i. e. consecrate him for sacrifice by cutting off the hair of his forehead, Ar.; πῶς δʼ αὖ κατάρξει θυμάτων; Eur.
to sacrifice, slay, Eur.:—Pass., σὸν κατῆρκται σῶμα hath been devoted, Eur.
simply, to strike, Plut.

div1.head: κατασβέννυμι
div1.sense: to put out, quench, Lat. extinguere, Il., Eur., etc.:—metaph., ἔστιν θάλασσα, τίς δέ νιν κατασβέσει; who shall dry it up? Aesch.; κ. βοήν, ἔριν to quell noise, strife, Soph.
Pass., aor1 κατ-εσβήθην, with intr. aor2 act. κατέσβην, inf. κατα-σβῆναι, perf. act. κατ-έσβηκα:— to go out, be quenched, Hdt.:—metaph., κλαυμάτων πηγαὶ κατεσβήκασι Aesch.

div1.head: κατασείω
div1.sense: to shake down, throw down, Thuc.

κατασεῖσαι τὴν χεῖρα to shake or make a motion of the hand; so, κ. τὰ ἱμάτια, by way of signal, Plut.; but also, κ. τῇ χειρί to beckon with the hand, NTest.: absol., κατασείειν τινί to beckon to another, as a sign for him to be silent, Xen.

div1.head: κατασεύομαι
div1.sense: Pass., to rush back into, c. acc., κῦμα κατέσσυτο (Epic aor2) ῥέεθρα Il.

div1.head: κατασημαίνομαι
div1.sense: to seal up: Mid. to have a thing sealed up, Plat.

div1.head: κατασήπω
div1.sense: to make rotten, let rot, Xen.:—Pass., aor2 κατ-εσάπην [ᾰ], Epic 3rd sg. subj. -σαπήῃ, with perf. 2 act. κατα-σέσηπα, to grow rotten, rot away.

div1.head: κατασθενέω
div1.sense: to weaken, Anth.

div1.head: κατασθμαίνω
div1.sense: to pant and struggle against a thing, c. gen., Aesch.

div1.head: κατασιγάω
div1.sense: to become silent, Plat.

div1.head: κατασικελίζω
div1.sense: τυρόν, to Sicilise (i. e. to consume) the cheese (in allusion to the peculations of Laches in Sicily), Ar.

div1.head: κατασιτέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to eat up, feed on, Hdt.

div1.head: κατασιωπάω
div1.sense: to be silent about a thing, Dem.
Causal, to make silent, silence, Xen.: Mid. to cause silence, Xen.

div1.head: κατασκάπτω
div1.sense: to dig down, destroy utterly, rase to the ground, overthrow, Hdt., Soph., etc.:— Pass., οἰκία οἱ κατεσκάφη (aor2) Hdt.

div1.head: κατασκαφή
div1.sense: a rasing to the ground, destruction, Trag.
γῆς κατασκαφαία grave deep dug in earth, Aesch.; θανόντων ἐς κατασκαφάς, i. e. to the grave, Soph.

div1.head: κατασκαφής
div1.sense: dug down, κ. οἴκησις the deep-dug dwelling, i. e. the grave, Soph.

div1.head: κατασκεδάννυμι
div1.sense: to scatter, or pour upon or over, τι κατά τινος Ar.; also τί τινος, Dem., etc.
κ. φήμην to spread a report against one, Plat.
Mid. to pour or sprinkle about, Xen.

div1.head: κατασκέλλομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to become a skeleton, wither or pine away, Aesch.:—so in perf. act. κατέσκληκα and plup. κατεσκλήκει, Babr.

div1.head: κατασκευάζω
div1.sense: to equip or furnish fully, Dem.; so in Mid., Xen.:—Pass., σκηνὴ χρυσῷ κατεσκευασμένη Hdt., etc.

to get ready, make, build, Hdt., Plat., etc.:—hence, to prepare, arrange, δημοκρατίαν Xen.; συμπόσιον Plat., etc.: —Mid. to make for oneself, esp. to build a house and furnish it, Thuc.: to pack up, also opp. to ἀνασκευάζεσθαι, Xen.
of fraudulent transactions, to get up, trump up, Xen., etc.; of persons, to suborn, Arist.
to make so and so, with a second acc., εἰ μὴ Γοργίαν Νέστορά τινα κατασκευάζεις unless you make Gorgias a kind of Nestor, Plat.: also, to represent as so and so, κ. τινὰ πάροινον, Dem.
in Logic, to construct an argument, Arist.
absol. in Mid. to make ready for doing, ὡς πολεμήσοντες Thuc.; ὡς οἰκήσων Xen.

div1.head: κατασκεύασμα
div1.sense: that which is prepared or made, a building, structure, edifice, Dem.
an arrangement, contrivance, device, Dem.

div1.head: κατασκευασμός
div1.sense: contrivance, Dem.

div1.head: κατασκευαστέος
div1.sense: one must prepare or make, Xen.

div1.head: κατασκευή
div1.sense: preparation, ἐν κατασκευῇ τοῦ πολέμου in preparing for it, Thuc.; the equipment of ships, engines, etc., Thuc.
any kind of furniture that is fixed, opp. to what is movable (παρασκευή) , buildings, fixtures, Thuc.; but also, like παρασκευή, any furniture, Hdt., Thuc.
the state, condition, constitution of a thing, Eur., Plat.
a device, trick, Aeschin.

div1.head: κατασκέω
div1.sense: to practise much: part. perf. pass. κατησκημένος, regular, ascetic, Plut.

div1.head: κατασκηνόω
div1.sense: to pitch oneʼs camp or tent, take up oneʼs quarters, encamp, Xen.; generally, to rest, lodge, settle,

div1.head: κατασκήνωμα
div1.sense: a covering, veil, Aesch.

div1.head: κατασκήνωσις
div1.sense: an encamping:—of birds, a resting-place, nest, NTest.

div1.head: κατασκήπτω
div1.sense: to rush down or fall upon, c. dat., of lightning and storms, Hdt.; of divine wrath, Hdt.; of the plague, Thuc.:—rarely, κατασκῆψαί τινα to fall on one, Eur.
κ. λιταῖς to storm or importune with prayers, Soph.

div1.head: κατασκιάζω
div1.sense: to overshadow, cover over, Hes.; κ. κόνει to bury one, Soph.

div1.head: κατάσκιος
div1.sense: shaded or covered with something, Hes., Hdt., Aesch.
trans. overshadowing, Aesch., Eur., Ar.

div1.head: κατασκοπέω
div1.sense: to view closely, spy out, Eur.: to reconnoitre, Xen.:— also in Mid., Xen.

div1.head: κατασκοπή
div1.sense: a viewing closely, spying, Soph., Eur.; ἐπὶ κατασκοπῇ, κατασκοπῆς ἕνεκα Xen.

div1.head: κατάσκοπος
div1.sense: one who keeps a look out, a scout, spy, Hdt., Eur.:—in Thuc., a person sent to examine and report, an inspector.

div1.head: κατασκώπτω
div1.sense: to make jokes upon, to jeer or mock, Hdt.

div1.head: κατασμικρίζω
div1.sense: to disparage, depreciate, Arist.

div1.head: κατασμύχω
div1.sense: to burn with a slow fire, burn up, Il.; metaph. of love, Theocr.; in Pass., of a lover, to smoulder away, Theocr.

div1.head: κατασοφίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to conquer by sophisms or fallacies, to outwit, Luc.:—also as Pass. to be outwitted, Luc.

div1.head: κατασπάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to embrace, Plut.

div1.head: κατασπαράσσω
div1.sense: to tear down, pull to pieces, Ar.

div1.head: κατασπαταλάω
div1.sense: to live wantonly, to wanton, Anth.

div1.head: κατασπάω
div1.sense: to draw or pull down, κ. τὰς νῆας to haul ships down to the sea, Hdt.; κ. σημεῖα to pull the flags down (in token of defeat), Thuc.; κ. τινὰ ἀπὸ τοῦ ἵππου Xen.
to quaff or swallow down, Lat. deglutire, Ar.

div1.head: κατασπείρω
div1.sense: to sow thickly: metaph., ἀνίας κ. to sow a crop of sorrows, Soph.
to beget, τέκνα Eur.
to scatter over, as in sowing, c. gen., Plut.
to besprinkle, Anth.

div1.head: κατάσπεισις
div1.sense: self-devotion, Plut.

div1.head: κατασπένδω
div1.sense: to pour as a drink-offering, Lat. libare, Eur., Ar.:—absol. to pour drink-offerings, Hdt.
c. acc., κ. τινὰ δακρύοις to honour with offerings of tears, Eur.; κ. τινά lament with tears, Anth.
to consecrate, Plut., Anth.

div1.head: κατασπέρχω
div1.sense: to urge on, Ar.;—absol., κατασπέρχον urgent, pressing, causing anxiety, Thuc.

div1.head: κατασπεύδω
div1.sense: to press, urge, or hasten on, Aeschin.

div1.head: κατασποδέω
div1.sense: to throw down in the dust: Pass., perf. part. κατεσποδημένοι Aesch.

div1.head: κατασπουδάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to be very earnest or serious, Hdt.; οὐδαμῶς κατεσπουδασμένος ἀνήρ Hdt.

div1.head: καταστάζω
div1.sense: of persons,
to let fall in drops upon, pour upon, shed over, τί τινος Eur.
c. dat. rei, to run down with a thing, νόσῳ κ. πόδα to have oneʼs foot running with a sore, Soph.; κ. ἀφρῷ to run down with foam, Eur.
of the liquid,
intr. to drop down, drip or trickle down, Eur., Xen.
trans. to drop down over, wet, ἱδρὼς καταστάζει δέμας Soph.

div1.head: καταστασιάζω
div1.sense: to form a counter-party in the state, Plut.
Pass. to be factiously opposed or overpowered, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: κατάστασις
div1.sense: trans. a settling, appointing, appointment, institution, Aesch., Dem.; δαιμόνων κατ. their ordinance, Eur.
appointment of magistrates, Plat.
a bringing of ambassadors before the senate or assembly, an introduction, presentation, Hdt.
κ. ἐγγυητῶν a bringing oneʼs bail forward, Dem.
a putting down, calming, Arist.
intr. a standing firm, a settled condition, fixedness, Soph.
a state, condition, Hdt., Eur., etc.
a constitution, system, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: καταστατέος
div1.sense: one must appoint, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: καταστάτης
div1.sense: an establisher, restorer, Soph.

div1.head: καταστατικός
div1.sense: fitted for calming: τὸ κ. a power to calm, of music, Plut.

div1.head: καταστεγάζω
div1.sense: to cover over, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: καταστέγασμα
div1.sense: a covering, Hdt.

div1.head: κατάστεγος
div1.sense: covered in, roofed, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: καταστείβω
