div1.sense: to tread down, κ. πέδον to tread the ground, Soph.

div1.head: καταστέλλω
div1.sense: to put in order, arrange, Eur.
to keep down, repress, check, Eur., NTest.

div1.head: καταστένω
div1.sense: to sigh over or lament, τινά Soph., Eur.; ὑπέρ τινος Eur.

div1.head: καταστεφανόω
div1.sense: to crown, Anth.

div1.head: καταστεφής
div1.sense: crowned, Soph.; of suppliant branches, wreathed with wool, Eur.

div1.head: καταστέφω
div1.sense: to deck with garlands, crown, wreath, Eur.; κ. νεκρόν (with libations), Eur.; κ. τινά to supplicate him, Eur.:—Pass., perf. inf., κατεστέφθαι Aeschin.

div1.head: κατάστημα
div1.sense: a condition or state of helath, Plut.

div1.head: καταστηματικός
div1.sense: established: sedate, Plut.

div1.head: κατάστικτος
div1.sense: spotted, speckled, brindled, Eur.

div1.head: καταστιλβόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be brilliant, Greg.

div1.head: καταστίλβω
div1.sense: to send beaming forth, σέλας Hhymn.
intr. to beam brightly, Anth.

div1.head: καταστοναχέω
div1.sense: to bewail, Anth.

div1.head: καταστράπτω
div1.sense: to hurl down lightning, κατὰ τόπον upon a place, Soph.; absol., καταστράπτει it lightens, Plut.
trans. to strike with lightning, dazzle, τὰς ὄψεις Plut.

div1.head: καταστρατοπεδεύω
div1.sense: to put into cantonments, encamp, Xen.: to station a fleet, Xen.
Mid. to take up quarters, encamp, Xen.

div1.head: καταστρέφω
div1.sense: to turn down, trample on, Hhymn.: to turn the soil, Xen.
to upset, overturn, Ar.
Mid. to subject to oneself, to subdue, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; κατεστρέψατο ἐς φόρου ἀπαγωγήν subdued and made them tributary, Hdt.; so, Ἰωνίην κατεστρέψατο δασμοφόρον εἶναι Hdt.
Pass., in aor1 and perf., to be subdued, Hdt.; ἀκούειν σοῦ κατέστραμμαι am constrained to hear, Aesch.:—but the perf. pass. is also used in sense of Mid., Hdt., Dem.
to turn back, bring back, κατέστρεψε λόγους εἰς φιλανθρωπίαν Aeschin.
to turn round, bring to an end, Aesch.:—absol. to come to an end, die, Plut.
to twist up: metaph., λέξις κατεστραμμένη a close periodic style, opp. to a loose running style (εἰρομένη) Arist.

div1.head: καταστρηνιάω
div1.sense: to behave wantonly towards, τινός NTest.

div1.head: καταστροφή
div1.sense: an overturning, Aesch.
a subduing, subjugation, reduction, Hdt., Thuc.
a sudden turn or end, a close, conclusion, Aesch.; of death, Soph., Thuc.: in drama, the catastrophe, Luc.

div1.head: κατάστρωμα
div1.sense: that which is spread over: in a ship, the deck, Hdt., Thuc.; οἱ ἀπὸ τῶν καταστρωμάτων the marines, opp. to the rowers, Thuc.

div1.head: καταστρώννυμι
div1.sense: to lay low, Eur., Xen.:—Pass., κατέστρωντο οἱ βάρβαροι Hdt.
div1.etym: part. fem. καστορνῦσα as if from καταστόρνυμι
div1.sense: to over-spread or cover with a thing, τί τινι Il.
to spread upon, Od.
to throw down, lay low, Hdt.; καταστ. κύματα, Lat. sternere aequor, Anth.

div1.head: καταστυγέω
div1.sense: to shudder at, abhor, abominate, Hom.

div1.head: καταστύφελος
div1.sense: very hard or rugged, Hes.

div1.head: καταστύφω
div1.sense: to make sour: Pass., perf. part., τὸ κατεστυμμένον sourness, harshness, Plut.

div1.head: καταστωμύλλομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to chatter: perf. part. κατεστωμυλμένος a chattering fellow, Ar.

div1.head: κατασύρω
div1.sense: to pull down, lay waste, ravage, Hdt.
to drag away, NTest.

div1.head: κατασφάζω
div1.sense: to slaughter, murder, Hdt.: Pass., Trag.

div1.head: κατασχεθεῖν
div1.sense: to hold back, Od., Soph.; κάσχεθε (Epic for κατέσχεθε) , Il.
intr., Θορικόνδε κατέσχεθον they held on their way to Thoricum, Hhymn.

div1.head: κατάσχετος
div1.sense: held back, Soph.

div1.head: κατασχηματίζω
div1.sense: to dress up or invest with a certain form or appearance, Isocr., Plut.:—Mid. or Pass. to conform oneself, Plut.

div1.head: κατασχίζω
div1.sense: to cleave asunder, split up, Ar.; Mid., κατεσχίσω τὸ ῥάκος Ar.; κατασχ. τὰς πύλας to burst them open, Xen.

div1.head: κατασχολάζω
div1.sense: to pass the time in idleness, χρόνου τι κ. to tarry somewhat too long, Soph.

div1.head: κατασώχω
div1.sense: to rub in pieces, grind down, Hdt.

div1.head: κατατάσσω
div1.sense: to draw up in order, arrange, τὴν στρατιάν Xen.
to appoint, ἐπί τι to do a thing, Dem.
κατατάξασθαί τινι to make arrangements with one, Dem.

div1.head: κατατείνω
div1.sense: to stretch or draw tight, Il., Hdt.; κ. τὰ ὅπλα to draw the cables taut, Hdt.
to stretch so as to torture, Dem., etc.
to stretch or draw in a straight line, Hdt.
to hold tight down, Plut.
intr. to stretch oneself: hence,
to extend or run straight towards, Lat. tendere, Hdt., Xen.: absol. to extend, Hdt.
to strive against, strive earnestly, be vehement, Eur., Xen.: aor1 part., with all oneʼs might, λέγω κατατείνας Plat.

div1.head: κατατέμνω
div1.sense: to cut in pieces, cut up, Hdt., Ar., etc.: so in Mid., Eur.:— Pass., τελαμῶσι κατατετμημένοις with regularly cut bandages, Hdt.; σπλάγχνα κατατετμημένα Ar.
κ. χώρην ἐς διώρυχας to cut it up into ditches or canals, Hdt.; κατετέτμηντο τάφροι ἐπὶ τὴν χώραν Xen.
c. dupl. acc. κ. τινὰ καττύματα to cut him into strips, Ar.:—Pass., κατατμηθείην λέπαδνα may I be cut up into straps, Ar.
κ. τὸν Πειραιᾶ to lay it out for building, Arist.:—Pass., ἡ πόλις κατατέτμηται τὰς ὁδοὺς ἰθείας has its streets cut straight, Hdt.
to cut into the ground, κατετέτμηντο τάφροι there were trenches cut, Xen.

div1.head: κατατήκω
div1.sense: trans. to melt away, to make to fall away, Hdt.
Pass., with perf. act. κατατέτηκα, to melt or be melting away, Od., Hdt., Attic

div1.head: κατατίθημι
div1.note: subj Epic . καταθείομαι subj. for καταθῶμαι
div1.sense: to place, put, or lay down, Hom.

to propose as a prize, Hom.; κ. ἄεθλον to propose a contest, Od.; κ. τι ἐς μέσον to put it down in the midst, i. e. for common use, Eur.; but, ἐς μέσον Πέρσῃσι κ. τὰ πρήγματα to communicate power to them, give them a common share of it, Hdt.
to put down as payment, pay down, Hdt., Ar., etc.:— to redeem a promise, ἃ δʼ ὑπέσχεο ποῖ καταθήσεις; Soph.
to lay up, lay by, Theogn., Hdt.; so in Mid., v. infr. II. 4.
Mid. to lay down from oneself, put off, lay aside, Lat. deponere, of arms or clothes, Hom., etc.
metaph. to put an end to, arrange, settle, τὸν πόλεμον Thuc.
to put aside, treat negligently, Xen.
to lay down in a place, Hes., etc.: of the dead, to bury, Od.

to deposit for oneself, lay up in store (v. supr. I. 4), Od., etc.: —metaph., κατατίθεσθαι κλέος to lay up store of glory, Hdt.; χάριτα or χάριν κατατίθεσθαί τινι or πρός τινα to lay up a store of gratitude or favour, Lat. collocare gratiam apud aliquem, Hdt., etc.; so, εὐεργεσίαν κ. Thuc., etc.
to deposit in a place of safety, Thuc., Xen.
to lay up in memory or as a memorial, Theogn., Plat.

div1.head: κατατιλάω
div1.sense: to make dirt over, c. gen., Ar.

div1.head: κατατιτρώσκω
div1.sense: to wound severely, Xen.

div1.head: κατατοκίζω
div1.sense: to beggar by usurious interest:—Pass. to be thus beggared, Arist.

div1.head: κατατομή
div1.sense: abscission, concision, as opp. to true circumcision, NTest.

div1.head: κατατοξεύω
div1.sense: to strike down with arrows, shoot dead, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: κατατραυματίζω
div1.sense: to cover with wounds, Hdt., Thuc.:—of ships, to disable utterly, cripple, Thuc.

div1.head: κατατρέχω
div1.sense: to run down, Hdt., Xen.
of seamen, to run to land, to disembark in haste, Xen.:—metaph., κ. ἄστυ to come to a haven in . . , Pind.
trans. to overrun, ravage, χώραν Thuc.

div1.head: κατατρίβω
div1.sense: to rub down or away; hence,
of clothes, to wear out, Theogn., Plat.
of persons, to wear out, exhaust, Thuc.: —Pass. to be quite worn out, Ar., Xen.
of Time, to wear it away, get rid of it, Lat. diem terere, Dem., Aeschin.: κ. τὸν βίον to employ it fully, Xen.; so in perf. pass. to pass oneʼs whole time, κατατέτριμμαι στρατευόμενος Xen.
of property, to squander, Xen.

div1.head: κατατρίζω
div1.sense: to squeak or scream loudly, Batr.

div1.head: κατατρύζω
div1.sense: to chatter against, τινός Anth.

div1.head: κατατρύχω
div1.sense: to wear out, exhaust, Hom., Theocr.:—Pass., κατατρυχόμενοι Eur.

div1.head: κατατρώγω
div1.sense: to gnaw in pieces, eat up, Ar.; c. gen., Plut.

div1.head: κατατυγχάνω
div1.sense: to hit oneʼs mark, to be successful, Dem.

div1.head: καταυγάζω
div1.sense: to shine upon: Mid. to gaze at, see, Anth.

div1.head: καταυγασμός
div1.sense: a shining brightly, Plut.

div1.head: καταυδάω
div1.sense: to speak out, speak plainly, Soph.

div1.head: καταυλέω
div1.sense: to play upon the flute to, τινός Plat.:—Pass., of persons, to have it played to one, Plat.:—Pass. to resound with flute-playing, Plut.
c. acc. pers. to overpower by flute-playing:—generally, to overpower, strike dumb, Eur.

div1.head: καταυλίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to be under shelter of a hall, house, tent, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: καταυχέω
div1.sense: to exult in a thing, c. dat., Aesch.

div1.head: καταφαγεῖν
div1.sense: to devour, eat up, Il., Hdt.
to spend in eating, waste, devour, Od., Aeschin.

div1.head: καταφαίνω
div1.sense: to declare, make known, Pind.
Pass., fut. -φανήσομαι, aor2 κατ-εφάνην [ᾰ], to become visible, appear, Hhymn., Hdt.
to be quite clear or plain, Hdt., Plat.; κατεφάνη τῷ Δαρείῳ τεχνάζειν it was apparent to Darius that he was playing tricks, Hdt.

div1.head: καταφανής
div1.sense: clearly seen, in sight, Xen.; ἐν καταφανεῖ in an open place, Xen.

manifest, evident, καταφανὲς ποιεῖν or ποιεῖσθαί τι Hdt., Xen.; καταφανέστερος εἶναι κακουργῶν Thuc.:—adv. -νῶς, evidently, plainly, Ar.; καταφανέστερον ἢ ὥστε λανθάνειν too manifestly to escape detection, Thuc.

div1.head: καταφαρμακεύω
div1.sense: to anoint with drugs or charms, to enchant, bewitch, Plat.

div1.head: καταφαρμάσσω
div1.sense: to bewitch with drugs, Hdt.

div1.head: καταφατίζω
div1.sense: to protest, promise, Plut.

div1.head: καταφαυλίζω
div1.sense: to depreciate, Plut.

div1.head: καταφερής
div1.sense: going down, εὖτε ἂν κ. γίνηται ὁ ἥλιος when the sun is near setting, Hdt.; of ground, sloping downwards, Lat. declivis, Xen.
inclined, Lat. proclivis, pronus, πρὸς οἶνον Plut.

div1.head: καταφέρω
div1.sense: to bring down, ἄχος με κατοίσεται Ἄϊδος εἴσω grief will bring me down to the grave, Il.; καταφέρω ποδὸς ἀκμάν I bring down my foot, Aesch.:—Pass. to be brought down by a river, of gold dust, Hdt.
of a storm, to drive ships to land, Thuc.
to pay down, Plut.
Pass. to be weighed down by sleep, NTest.
to carry home, Ar.:—Pass. to return, Ar.

div1.head: καταφεύγω
div1.sense: to flee for refuge, Hdt.; c. acc., κ. βωμόν to flee for refuge to the altar, Eur.; κ. ἐν τόπῳ to flee and take refuge in a place, Xen.; to flee for protection, ὃς ἂν καταφυγῇ ἐς τούτους Hdt.; so, κ. ἐπί τινα, πρός τινα Dem.
ἐκ τῆς μάχης κ. to escape from . . , Hdt.
to have recourse to, εἰς τοὺς λόγους Plat.; ἐπὶ τὸν δικαστήν Arist.
εἰς τὴν τοῦ βίου μετριότητα to fall back upon, appeal to, Dem.

div1.head: καταφευκτέος
div1.sense: one must have recourse to, Luc.

div1.head: κατάφευξις
div1.sense: flight for refuge, Thuc.
a place of refuge, Thuc.

div1.head: κατάφημι
div1.sense: to say yes, assent, Soph.

div1.head: καταφημίζω
div1.sense: to spread a report abroad, announce, Pind.

div1.head: καταφθατέομαι
div1.sense: to take first possession of, γῆν καταφθατουμένη Aesch.

div1.head: καταφθείρω
div1.sense: to destroy or spoil utterly, bring to naught, Aesch., Soph., etc.

div1.head: καταφθίνω
div1.sense: to waste away, decay, perish, Hdt., Trag.; κ. νόσῳ, γήρᾳ Soph., Eur.
Causal in fut. κατα-φθίσω [ῑ], aor1 κατ-έφθισα, to ruin, destroy, Od., Aesch.

Pass., Epic aor2 κατ-εφθίμην [ῐ], inf. καταφθίσθαι; poet. καπ-φθίμενος:— to be ruined, to waste away, perish, ἤϊα πάντα κατέφθιτο the provisions were all consumed, Od.; ὡς καὶ σὺ καταφθίσθαι ὤφελες oh that thou hadst perished, Od.; σεῖο καταφθιμένοιο if thou wert dead, Il.; ἐκεῖ κατέφθιτο there he died, Aesch.; φέγγος ἡλίου κατέφθιτο the sunʼs light was gone, Aesch.

div1.head: καταφθορά
div1.sense: destruction, death, Eur.
metaph. confusion, φρενῶν Aesch.

div1.head: καταφίημι
div1.sense: to let slip down, κατηφίει (imperf.) Plat.

div1.head: καταφιλέω
div1.sense: to kiss tenderly, to caress, Xen.

div1.head: καταφλέγω
div1.sense: to burn down, burn up, consume, πυρί Il., Hes., etc.:—Pass. to be burnt down, Thuc.

div1.head: καταφοβέω
div1.sense: to strike with fear, Thuc.:— Pass., c. fut. mid. to be greatly afraid of, τι Ar.; absol., καταφοβηθείς Thuc.

div1.head: καταφοιτάω
div1.sense: to come down constantly or regularly, as wild beasts from the mountains to prey, Hdt.

div1.head: καταφονεύω
div1.sense: to slaughter, Hdt., Eur., etc.

div1.head: καταφορέω
div1.sense: of a river, to carry down gold dust, Hdt.
to pour like a stream over, τί τινος Plat.

div1.head: καταφράζω
div1.sense: to declare, Pind.:—Mid., with aor1 pass. and mid., to consider, think upon, ponder, Hes.; καταφρασθείς observed, Hdt.

div1.head: κατάφρακτος
div1.sense: shut up, confined, Soph.; πλοῖα κ. decked vessels, Thuc.

div1.head: καταφρονέω
div1.sense: to think down upon, i. e. to look down upon, think slightly of, τινός Hdt., Eur., etc.
c. acc. to regard slightly, despise, Hdt., Attic:—Pass. to be thought little of, despised, Xen., etc.
absol. to be disdainful, deal contemptuously, Thuc.
c. inf. to think contemptuously that, to presume, καταφρονήσαντες κρέσσονες εἶναι Hdt.; καταφρονοῦντες κἂν προαισθέσθαι Thuc.
c. acc. rei, only in Ionic writers (cf. κατανοέω) , to fix oneʼs thoughts upon, aim at, Lat. affectare, τὴν τυραννίδα Hdt.: also to observe with contempt, τι Hdt.

div1.head: καταφρόνημα
div1.sense: contempt of others, μὴ φρόνημα μόνον, ἀλλὰ καταφρ. not only spirit, but a spirit of disdain, Thuc.

div1.head: καταφρόνησις
div1.sense: contempt, disdain, Thuc., Plat.
without any bad sense, opp. to αὔχημα, Thuc.

div1.head: καταφρονητής
div1.sense: a despiser, Plut.

div1.head: καταφρονητικός
div1.sense: contemptuous, Arist. adv. -κῶς, Xen.

div1.head: καταφροντίζω
div1.sense: τὸ ἱμάτιον οὐκ ἀπολώλεκʼ, ἀλλὰ καταπεφρόντικα I have not lost it, but Iʼve thought it away, lost it in the schools, Ar.

div1.head: καταφρύγω
div1.sense: to burn to ashes, Ar.

div1.head: καταφυγή
div1.sense: a refuge, place of refuge, Hdt., Eur.: c. gen., κ. κακῶν refuge from evils, Eur., Thuc.
a way of escape, excuse, Dem.

div1.head: καταφυλαδόν
div1.sense: in tribes, by clans, Il.

div1.head: καταφυλλοροέω
div1.sense: to shed the leaves: metaph. to lose its splendour, Pind.

div1.head: καταφυτεύω
div1.sense: to plant, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: καταφύομαι
div1.sense: to be produced, Plut.

div1.head: κατάφυτος
div1.sense: all planted with a thing, c. dat., Luc.

div1.head: καταφωράω
div1.sense: to catch in a theft: to catch in the act, detect, discover, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: κατάφωρος
div1.sense: detected: manifest, Plut.

div1.head: καταφωτίζω
div1.sense: to illuminate, light up, Anth.

div1.head: καταχαίρω
div1.sense: to exult over, c. dat., Hdt.; absol., καταχαίρων with malignant joy, Hdt.

div1.head: καταχαλαζάω
div1.sense: to shower down like hail upon, τί τινος Luc.

div1.head: κατάχαλκος
div1.sense: overlaid with brass or copper, Eur.; κατ. πεδίον ἀστράπτει the plain flashes with gleaming arms, Eur.; δράκων κ. a serpent lapt in mail, i. e. scales, Eur.

div1.head: καταχαλκόω
div1.sense: to cover with brass, Hdt.

div1.head: καταχαρίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to do or give up a thing out of courtesy, Aeschin.; κ. τὰ δίκαια to give judgment by private interest, Plat.
to shew favour to a person, c. dat., Dem.

div1.head: κατάχαρμα
div1.sense: a mockery, Theogn.

div1.head: καταχέζω
div1.sense: to befoul, τινός Ar.

div1.head: καταχειροτονέω
div1.sense: to vote against, to vote in condemnation of, τινός Dem.; c. inf., ἀδικεῖν Εὐάνδρου κατεχειροτόνησεν ὁ δῆμος Dem.:—Pass., καταχειροτονηθὲν αὐτοῦ καὶ ταῦτα ἀσεβεῖν a vote of condemnation having been passed against him, and that for sacrilege, Dem.

div1.head: καταχειροτονία
div1.sense: a vote of condemnation, Dem.

div1.head: καταχέω
div1.sense: to pour down upon, pour over, τί τινι Hom.; also, κατ. τί τινος Hdt., Attic:—Pass., κατὰ ταῖν κόραιν ὕπνου τι καταχεῖται a bit of sleep is poured over the eyes, Ar.
to pour or shower down, Hom.: to throw or cast down, Hom.; πέπλον κατέχευεν ἐπʼ οὔδει let the robe fall upon the pavement, Il.
Pass. to be poured over the ground, lie in heaps, ὁ χῶρος, ἐν ᾧ αἱ ἄκανθαι τῶν ὀφίων κατακεχύαται (Ionic 3rd pl. perf. pass.), Hdt.
to melt down, χρυσὸν ἐς πίθους Hdt.; and in Mid., χρυσὸν καταχέασθαι to have it melted down, Hdt.
Epic imperf. mid., τέττιξ καταχεύετʼ ἀοιδήν, Hes.

div1.head: καταχήνη
div1.sense: derision, mockery, Ar.

div1.head: καταχηρεύω
div1.sense: to pass in widowhood, Dem.

div1.head: καταχής
div1.sense: sounding, Theocr.

div1.head: καταχθόνιος
div1.sense: subterranean, Ζεὺς καταχθόνιος, i. e. Pluto, Il.; δαίμονες κ. Dii Manes, Anth.

div1.head: καταχορδεύω
div1.sense: to mince up as for a sausage, Hdt.

div1.head: καταχορηγέω
div1.sense: to lavish as χορηγός: generally, to spend lavishly, squander, Plut.

div1.head: καταχραίνω
div1.sense: Mid. to besprinkle, Anth.

div1.head: καταχράομαι
div1.etym: perf. -κέχρημαι both in act. and pass. senses
div1.sense: Dep.
to make full use of, apply, c. dat., Plat., Dem.
to use to the uttermost, use up, c. acc., Dem.
to misuse, abuse, c. dat., Plat.
of persons, to make away with, destroy, kill, c. acc., Hdt.;—so aor1 καταχρησθῆναι, in pass. sense, Hdt.
to pretend, allege, Dem.

Act. καταχράω only in Ionic writers in 3rd sg. ἀντὶ λόφου ἡ λοφιὴ κατέχρα the mane sufficed them for a crest, Hdt.:—impers., οὐδέ οἱ καταχρήσει ὑμέων ἀπέχεσθαι nor will it suffice him to keep his hands off you, Hdt.

div1.head: καταχρειόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be ill-treated, perf. part. κατηχρειωμένη Anth.

div1.head: καταχρέμπτομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to spit upon, τινος Ar.

div1.head: κατάχρυσος
div1.sense: overlaid with gold-leaf, gilded, Luc.

div1.head: καταχρυσόω
div1.sense: to cover with gold-leaf, gild, Hdt.
to make golden (i. e. splendid), Plut.

div1.head: καταχρώζω
div1.sense: to colour:— Pass. to be stained, Eur.

div1.head: κατάχυσμα
div1.sense: that which is poured over, sauce, Ar.
in pl. handfuls of nuts, figs, etc.; Lat. bellaria, which used to be showered over a bride or a new slave on entering the house (cf. Virg. sparge, marite, nuces), Ar., Dem.

div1.head: καταχωνεύω
div1.sense: to melt down, Dem.

div1.head: καταχώννυμι
div1.sense: to cover with a heap, ὁ νότος κατέχωσέ σφεας the South wind buried them in sand, Hdt.; κ. τινὰ λίθοις Ar.

div1.head: καταχωρίζω
div1.sense: to set in a place, place in position, Xen.:—Pass. to take up a position, Xen.

div1.head: καταψάλλω
div1.sense: Mid.-Pass. to resound with music, Plut.

div1.head: καταψάω
div1.sense: to stroke with the hand, to stroke, caress, καταψῶσα αὐτοῦ τὴν κεφαλήν Hdt.; καταψῶν αὐτὸν τὸν κάνθαρον, ὥσπερ πωλίον Ar.

div1.head: καταψεκάζω
div1.sense: to wet by continual dropping, Aesch., Plut.

div1.head: καταψεύδομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to tell lies against, speak falsely of, τινος Ar., Plat., etc.
to allege falsely against, τί τινος Plat., Dem.
to say falsely, pretend, Eur.: to feign, invent, τι Dem.
also as Pass. to be falsely reported: of writings, to be spurious, Plut.

div1.head: καταψευδομαρτυρέω
div1.sense: to bear false witness against, τινός Xen.; so in Mid., Dem.:—Pass. to be borne down by false evidence, Plat.

div1.head: καταψηφίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to vote against or in condemnation of, τινος Plat., Xen.; κ. τινος κλοπήν to find him guilty of theft, Plat.; so in perf. pass., κατεψηφισμένοι αὐτοῦ θάνατον Xen.
Pass., in perf. and aor1 pass., to be condemned, Plat., Dem.:—of the sentence, to be pronounced against, δίκη κατεψηφισμένη τινός Thuc.; κατεψηφισμένος ἦν μου ὁ θάνατος Xen.
to vote in affirmation, Arist.

div1.head: καταψηφιστέος
div1.sense: one must condemn, Xen.

div1.head: καταψήχω
div1.sense: to rub down, pound in a mortar: — Pass. to crumble away, perf. κατέψηκται Soph.
to stroke down, caress, Lat. mulceo, ἵππους Eur.

div1.head: καταψύχω
div1.sense: to cool, chill, Arist.:—Pass., perf. κατέψυγμαι, aor1 κατεψύχθην and 2 κατεψύγην [ῠ]:: — to be chilled, become cold, of persons, Arist., Plut.
Pass., of a country, to be dried or parched up, Plut.

div1.head: κατεβλακευμένως
div1.etym: adverb from perf. pass. part. of καταβλᾱκεύω
div1.sense: slothfully, tardily, Ar., Anth.

div1.head: κατεγγυάω
div1.sense: to pledge, betroth, παῖδά τινι Eur.
as Attic law-term, to make responsible, to compel to give security, Dem.: —Mid. or Pass. to give or find security, Dem.
to seize as a security, Dem.

div1.head: κατεγγύη
div1.sense: bail or security given, Dem.

div1.head: κατέδω
div1.sense: to eat up, devour, Il.; metaph., οἶκον, κτῆσιν κατέδειν to eat up house, goods, Od.; ὃν θυμὸν κατέδων eating oneʼs heart for grief, Il.

div1.head: κατείβω
div1.sense: to let flow down, shed, Od.:—Mid. to flow apace, Hom.; metaph., κατείβετο αἰών life ebbed, passed away, Od.

div1.head: κατεῖδον
div1.etym: aor2 with no pres. in use, καθοράω being used instead
div1.sense: to look down, Il., Hdt., etc.
c. acc. to look down upon, Ar.: simply to behold, regard, perceive, Theogn., Aesch.; κατιδεῖν βίον to live, Aesch.—Also in aor2 mid. κατειδόμην, inf. κατιδέσθαι, Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: κατείδωλος
div1.sense: full of idols, given to idolatry, NTest.

div1.head: κατεικάζω
div1.sense: to liken:—Pass., aor1 κατ-εικάσθην, to be or become like, Soph.
to guess, surmise, Hdt.: to suspect evil, Hdt.

div1.head: κατειλέω
div1.sense: to force into a narrow space, to coop up, ἐς τὸ τεῖχος, ἐς τὸ ἄστυ Hdt.:—Pass., κατειλήθησαν ἐς Διὸς ἱρόν Hdt.; έν ὀλίγῳ χώρῳ πολλαὶ μυριάδες κατειλημέναι Hdt.

div1.head: κατειλύω
div1.sense: to cover up, Il.: Pass., ὄρος ψάμμῳ κατειλῡμένον (perf. part.) Hdt.

div1.head: κάτειμι
div1.sense: to go or come down, Hom., etc.:—esp. to go down to the grave, Il.; of a ship, to sail down to land, Od.; of a wind, to come sweeping down, Thuc.
to come back, return, Od.; of exiles, to return home, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: κατεῖπον
div1.etym: used as aor2 to καταγορεύω. (κατερῶ being the fut.)
div1.sense: to speak against or to the prejudice of, accuse, denounce, τινος Hdt., Eur., etc.
c. acc. to speak out, tell plainly, declare, report, Eur., Ar.
absol. to tell, Hdt., etc.; κάτειπέ μοι tell me, Ar.

div1.head: κατείργω
div1.sense: to drive into, shut in, Hdt.:—generally, to press hard, reduce to straits, Hdt.:—Pass. to be hemmed in, kept down, Thuc.; τὸ κατειργόμενον what is done under necessity, Thuc.
to hinder, prevent, Eur.

div1.head: κατειρωνεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to use irony towards, to dissemble, Plut.

div1.head: κατεισάγω
div1.sense: to betray to oneʼs own loss, Anth.

div1.head: κατελαύνω
div1.sense: to draw down, Plut.

div1.head: κατελέγχω
div1.sense: to convict of falsehood, to belie, Hes.
to disgrace, Pind.

div1.head: κατελεέω
div1.sense: to have compassion upon, τινά Plat.

div1.head: κατελπίζω
div1.sense: to hope or expect confidently, Hdt.

div1.head: κατεμπίπρημι
div1.sense: to burn up, Eur.

div1.head: κατεναίρομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to kill, slay, murder, Od.:—an aor2 act. κατήναρον occurs in Soph., Anth.

div1.head: κατεναντίον
div1.sense: over against, opposite, before, τινί Il., Hes.; τινός Hdt., etc.

div1.head: κατεναρίζω
div1.sense: to kill outright: aor1 pass. κατηναρίσθην Aesch.; perf. part. κατηναρισμένος Soph.

div1.head: κατένωπα
div1.sense: right over against, right opposite, c. gen., Il.

div1.head: κατεξανίσταμαι
div1.sense: Pass. with aor2 act. κατ-εξανέστην, to rise up against, struggle against, τινός Plut.

div1.head: κατεξουσιάζω
div1.sense: to exercise lordship over, τινός NTest.

div1.head: κατεπαγγέλλομαι
div1.sense: to make promises or engagements, τινι with one, Dem.; πρός τινα Aeschin.

div1.head: κατεπάγω
div1.sense: to bring one thing quickly upon or after another, to repeat quickly, Ar.

div1.head: κατεπᾴδω
div1.sense: to subdue by charms, τινά Plat.

div1.head: κατεπείγω
div1.sense: to press down, depress, Il.
to press much, press hard, drive on, urge on, impel, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
intr. to hasten, make haste, Xen.

div1.head: κατέπεφνον
div1.etym: aor2 with no pres. in use
div1.sense: to kill, slay, Hom., Soph.

div1.head: κατεπιορκέω
div1.sense: Mid. to effect by perjury, Dem.

div1.head: κατεργάζομαι
div1.etym: perf. -είργασμαι both in act. and pass. sense
div1.sense: Dep.
to effect by labour, to achieve, accomplish, Hdt., Soph., etc.:—so perf. κατείργασμαι, Xen.; but in pass. sense, to be effected or achieved, Hdt., Eur.
to earn or gain by labour, to achieve, acquire, τὴν ἡγεμονίην Hdt.; σωτηρίαν Eur.; in pass. sense, ἀρετὴ ἀπὸ σοφίης κατεργασμένη Hdt.
absol. to be successful, Hdt.
c. acc. pers., like Lat. conficere, to make an end of, finish, kill, Hdt., Soph., Eur.
to overpower, subdue, conquer Hdt., Ar., Thuc.:—perf. pass. to be overcome, Thuc.; κατείργασται πέδον is subdued, brought under cultivation, Aesch.
to prevail upon, Hdt., Xen.: —aor1 pass., οὐκ ἐδύνατο κατεργασθῆναι could not be prevailed upon, Hdt.
to work up for use, Lat. concoquere, κ. μέλι to make honey, Hdt.

div1.head: κατερείκω
div1.sense: to grind down:—metaph., κ. θυμόν to fritter it away, smooth it down, Ar.:—Mid. to rend oneʼs garments, in token of sorrow, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: κατερείπω
div1.sense: to throw or cast down, Orac. ap. Hdt.:—Pass. to fall in ruins, of Troy, Eur.
intr. in aor2 κατ-ήριπον, to fall down, fall prostrate, Il., Theocr.; so in perf., τεῖχος κατ-ερήριπεν Il.

div1.head: κατερεύγομαι
div1.sense: to belch over, τινός Ar.

div1.head: κατερέφω
div1.sense: to cover over, roof, Plut.:—Mid. to roof over for oneself or what is oneʼs own, Ar.

div1.head: κατερέω
div1.etym: serving as fut. of the aor2 κατεῖπον
div1.sense: to speak against, accuse, τινός Xen., Plat.
c. acc. to denounce, Hdt.
to say or tell plainly, speak out, Hdt., Eur., etc.:— Pass., κατειρήσεται it shall be declared, Hdt.

div1.head: κατερητύω
div1.sense: to hold back, Hom., Soph.

div1.head: κατερικτός
div1.sense: bruised, ground, of pulse, Ar.

div1.head: κατερύκω
div1.sense: to hold back, detain, Hom., Theogn., Ar.:—Pass., κατερύκεται εὐρέϊ πόντῳ Od.

div1.head: κατερύω
div1.sense: to draw or haul down, of ships, Lat. deducere naves, Od., Hdt.:—Pass., νηῦς τε κατείρυσται Od.
κ. τόξα to draw a bow, Anth.

div1.head: κατέρχομαι
div1.etym: fut. κατελεύσομαι, but in good Attic κάτειμι
div1.sense: Dep.
to go down from a place, c. gen., Il.; to go down to the grave, κ. Ἄϊδος εἴσω, Ἄϊδόσδε Il.;—also from high land to the coast, Od.
of things, κατερχομένης ὑπὸ πέτρης by the descending rock, Od.; of a river, κατέρχεται ὁ Νεῖλος πληθύων comes down in flood, Hdt.
to come back, return, πόλινδε Od.: esp. to come back from exile, Hdt., Attic; in pass. sense, ὑπό τινος κατελθεῖν to be brought back by him, Thuc.

div1.head: κατεσθίω
div1.sense: to eat up, devour, of animals of prey, Hom.; of men, to eat up, Od., Hdt.
to eat up or devour oneʼs substance, Ar., Dem.
λίθοι κατεδηδεσμένοι ὑπὸ σηπεδόνος corroded, Plat.

div1.head: κάτευγμα
div1.sense: always in pl. vows, Aesch.:— votive offerings, Soph.
imprecations, curses, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: κατευημερέω
div1.sense: to be quite successful, carry oneʼs point, Aeschin.

div1.head: κατευθύ
div1.sense: straight forward, Xen.

div1.head: κατευθύνω
div1.sense: to make or keep straight, to set right, guide aright, Plat.
intr. to make straight towards a point, Plut.

div1.head: κατευνάζω
div1.sense: to put to bed, lull to sleep, Soph.; of death, Soph.; ἐκτὸς αὐτὸν τάξεων κατηύνασεν assigned him quarters outside the army, Eur.; κ. τινὰ μόχθων to give one rest from . . , Anth.:—Pass. to lie down to sleep, Il.

div1.head: κατευναστής
div1.sense: one who conducts to bed, a chamberlain, Plut.

div1.head: κατευνάω
div1.sense: to put to sleep, Il.: metaph. to lull pain to sleep, Soph.:—Pass. to be asleep, Od.

div1.head: κατευορκέω
div1.sense: to swear solemnly, Gorg. ap. Arist.

div1.head: κατευστοχέω
div1.sense: to be quite successful, Plut.

div1.head: κατευτρεπίζω
div1.sense: to put in order again, Xen.

div1.head: κατευτυχέω
div1.sense: to be quite successful, prosper, Plut.

div1.head: κατευφημέω
div1.sense: to applaud, extol, Plut.

div1.head: κατευχή
div1.sense: a prayer, vow, Aesch.

div1.head: κατεύχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to pray earnestly, Hdt., Trag.; κ. τινι to pray to one, Aesch., Eur.
absol. to make a prayer or vow, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
in bad sense,
c. gen. pers. to pray against one, imprecate curses on one, Lat. imprecari, Plat.; also, κατ. τί τινι Aesch.; c. acc. et inf., Soph.
absol., Eur.
to boast that . . , Theocr.

div1.head: κατευωχέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to feast and make merry, Hdt.

div1.head: κατεφάλλομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to spring down upon, rush upon, κατεπάλμενος (aor2 part. syncop.) Il., Anth.
for κατ-έπαλτο, v. καταπάλλω.

div1.head: κατεφίσταμαι
div1.sense: Pass., with aor2 act. to rise up against, NTest.

div1.head: κατέχω
div1.sense: trans. to hold fast, Hes.
to hold back, withhold, Hom.:— to check, restrain, control, bridle, Hdt., Attic: —Pass. to be held down, to be bound, kept under, Hdt.
to detain, Hdt., Xen.:—Pass. to be detained, to stay, stop, tarry, Hdt., Soph.
to have in possession, possess, occupy, Trag.
of sound, to fill, ἀλαλητῷ πεδίον κατέχουσι Il.; κ. στρατόπεδον δυσφημίαις to fill it with his grievous cries, Soph.
βιοτὰν κ. to continue a life, Soph.
to occupy, be spread over, cover, νὺξ κάτεχʼ οὐρανόν Od.; ἡμέρα κατέσχε γαῖαν Aesch.:—in Mid., κατέσχετο πρόσωπα covered her face, Od.
of the grave, to confine, cover, Hom.
of conditions and the like, to hold down, overpower, oppress, afflict, Od., Soph.: —of circumstances, to occupy or engage one, Hdt.
to occupy, in right of conquest, Hdt., Soph., etc.
to master, understand, Plat.
in Pass., of persons, to be possessed, inspired, Xen., Plat.
to follow close upon, press hard, Lat. urgere, Xen.
to bring a ship to land, bring it in or to, Hdt.
intr.:
(sub. ἑαυτόν) to control oneself, Soph., Plat.:— to hold, stop, cease, of the wind, Ar.
to come from the high sea to shore, put in, Hhymn., Hdt., Attic
to prevail, ὁ λόγος κατέχει the report prevails, is rife, Thuc.; σεισμοὶ κατ. earthquakes prevail, are frequent, Thuc.
to have the upper hand, Theogn., Arist.
Mid. to keep back for oneself, embezzle, Hdt.
to cover oneself, v. supr. A. II. 4.
to hold, contain, Polyb.
the aor. mid. is also used like a Pass., to be stopped, to stop, Od.:— κατασχόμενος subdued, Pind.

div1.head: κατηγορέω
div1.sense: to speak against, to accuse, τινός Hdt.; κατά τινος Xen.
κ. τί τινος, to state or bring as a charge against a person, accuse him of it, Hdt., Soph., etc.

c. acc. rei only, to allege in accusation, allege, Lat. objicere, Eur., Xen., etc.:—Pass. to be brought as an accusation against, Soph., Thuc., etc.:—impers., c. inf., σφέων κατηγόρητο μηδίζειν a charge had been brought against them that they favoured the Medes, Hdt.; so, κατηγορεῖταί τινος ὡς βαρβαρίζει Xen.
absol. to be an accuser, appear as prosecutor, Ar., Plat.
to signify, indicate, prove, Lat. arguo, c. acc. rei, τι Xen.:c. gen. to tell of, Aesch.

div1.head: κατηγόρημα
div1.sense: an accusation, charge, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: κατηγορία
div1.sense: an accusation, charge, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: κατήγορος
div1.sense: an accuser, Hdt., Soph.:— a betrayer, Aesch.

div1.head: κατήκοος
div1.sense: listening: as Subst. a listener, eaves-dropper, Hdt.
hearkening to, obeying, obedient, subject, Hdt., Soph.; τινός to another, Hdt.; also c. dat., Κύρῳ κ. Hdt.
giving ear to, εὐχωλῇσι Anth.

div1.head: κατῆλιψ
div1.sense: the upper story of a house, or a stair-case or ladder, Ar.

div1.head: κατηλογέω
div1.sense: to make of small account, take no account of, neglect, Hdt.

div1.head: κατήλυσις
div1.sense: a going down, descent, Anth.

div1.head: κατήορος
div1.sense: hanging down, hanging on their motherʼs neck, of children, Eur.

div1.head: κατηπιάω
div1.sense: to assuage, allay Epic 3rd pl. imperf. pass., κατηπιόωντο Il.

div1.head: κατηρεμίζω
div1.sense: to calm, appease, Xen.

div1.head: κατηρεφής
div1.sense: covered over, vaulted, overhanging, Hom., Hes.; κ. πέτρος, of a cave, Soph.:— of trees, thick-leaved, Theocr.:— κ. πόδα τιθέναι to keep the foot covered, of Pallas when seated, and the robe falls over her feet, opp. to ὀρθὸν πόδα τ., when she steps forward, Aesch.
covered by a thing, c. dat., σπέος δάφνῃσι κατηρεφές shaded by laurels, embowered in them, Od.; τύμβῳ κ., i. e. buried, Soph.: —also c. gen., covered with or by a thing, Eur.

div1.head: κατήρης
div1.sense: fitted out or furnished with a thing, c. dat., Eur.:—of ships, furnished with oars, πλοῖον κατῆρες a rowing boat, Hdt.; but, ταρσὸς κ. a well-fitted oar. Eur.

div1.head: κατήφεια
div1.sense: dejection, sorrow, shame, Il., Thuc.

div1.head: κατηφέω
div1.sense: to be downcast, to be mute with horror or grief, Hom., Eur.

div1.head: κατηφής
div1.sense: with downcast eyes, downcast, mute, Od., Eur.
metaph. dim, obscure, dusk, Anth.

div1.head: κατηφών
div1.sense: one who causes grief or shame, as Priam calls his sons κατηφόνες, dedecora, Il.

div1.head: κατηχέω
div1.sense: to sound a thing in oneʼs ears, to teach by word of mouth, to instruct, Luc.:—Pass. to be informed, NTest.
in Christian writers, to instruct in the elements of religion, NTest.

div1.head: κατιάπτω
div1.sense: to harm, hurt, Od., Mosch.

div1.head: κατιλύω
div1.sense: to fill with mud or dirt, Xen.

div1.head: κατισχναίνω
div1.sense: to make to pine or waste away, Aesch.:—fut. mid. κατισχνανεῖσθαι in pass. sense, Aesch.

div1.head: κατισχύω
div1.sense: to have power over, overpower, prevail against one, c. gen., NTest.
to come to oneʼs full strength, Soph.

div1.head: κατίσχω
div1.sense: to hold back, Lat. detinere, Il., Hdt.:—Mid. to keep by one, Il.
to occupy: Pass. to be occupied, Od.
to direct or steer to a place, Od., Hdt., etc.
intr., to come down, Hdt.

div1.head: κάτοιδα
div1.etym: perf.in pres. sense, plup. κατῄδη in imperf. sense
div1.sense: to know well, understand, Aesch., Soph.
c. acc. pers. to know by sight, recognise, Soph., Eur.
absol. οὐ κατειδώς unwittingly, Eur.
c. part. to know well that, Soph.; c. inf. to know how to do, Soph.

div1.head: κατοικέω
div1.sense: to dwell in as a κάτοικος, to settle in, colonise, Hdt., Eur.: generally, to inhabit, Soph., Eur., etc.
absol. to settle, dwell, Soph., Eur., etc.:—so in perf. and plup. pass. to have been settled, to dwell, Hdt.
in Pass., of a state, to be administered, governed, Soph., Plat.
intr. of cities, to lie, be situate, Plat.

div1.head: κατοίκησις
div1.sense: a settling in a place, Thuc.

div1.head: κατοικητήριον
div1.sense: a dwelling-place, abode, NTest.

div1.head: κατοικία
div1.sense: a settlement, colony: the foundation of a colony, Plut.

div1.head: κατοικίδιος
div1.sense: living in or about a house, domestic, οἱ κατοικίδιοι home birds, Luc.

div1.head: κατοικίζω
div1.sense: to remove to a place, plant, settle or establish there as colonists, κ. τινὰ εἰς τόπον Hdt., Ar.; γυναῖκας ἐς φῶς ἡλίου κατ. Eur.:—also, κ. τινὰ ἐν τόπῳ to settle or plant one in, Soph.; ἐλπίδας ἔν τινι κ. to plant them in his mind, Aesch.
c. acc. loci, to colonise, people a place, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
Pass.,
of persons, to be placed or settled, ἐν τόπῳ Hdt.; ἐς τόπον Thuc.
of places, to have colonies planted there, to be colonised, Thuc.
to bring home and re-establish there, to restore to oneʼs country, Aesch.

div1.head: κατοίκισις
div1.sense: a planting with inhabitants, foundation of a state, colonisation, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: κατοικοδομέω
div1.sense: to build upon or in a place, Xen.
to build away, i. e. to squander in building, Plut.

div1.head: κατοικονομέω
div1.sense: to manage well, Plut.

div1.head: κάτοικος
div1.sense: a settler, Aesch.

div1.head: κατοικοφθορέω
div1.sense: to ruin utterly, Plut.

div1.head: κατοικτείρω
div1.sense: to have mercy or compassion on, τινά Hdt., Soph., Eur., etc.
intr. to feel or shew compassion, Hdt.

div1.head: κατοικτίζω
div1.sense: Soph.:—Mid. to bewail oneself, utter lamentations, Hdt., Aesch.; so in aor1 pass. κατῳκτίσθην, Eur.;—c. acc. rei, as in Act., Aesch.
Causal, to excite pity, Soph.

div1.head: κατοίκτισις
div1.sense: compassion, Xen.

div1.head: κατοιμώζω
div1.sense: to bewail, lament, Eur.

div1.head: κατοίχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to have gone down, οἱ κατοιχόμενοι the departed, dead, Dem.

div1.head: κατοκνέω
div1.sense: to shrink from doing or undertaking, c. inf., Soph., Thuc.;—absol. to shrink back, Aesch., Thuc.

div1.head: κατοκωχή
div1.sense: a being possessed, possession (i. e. inspiration), Plat.

div1.head: κατοκώχιμος
div1.sense: capable of being possessed, Arist.

div1.head: κατολισθάνω
div1.sense: to slip or sink down, Luc.

div1.head: κατόλλυμι
div1.sense: to destroy utterly:—Pass., with perf. acc. to perish utterly, Aesch.

div1.head: κατολολύζω
div1.sense: to shriek over a thing, c. gen., Aesch.

div1.head: κατολοφύρομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to bewail, c. acc., Eur., Xen.

div1.head: κατομβρέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be rained on, drenched, Anth.

div1.head: κατόμνυμι
div1.sense: to confirm by oath, τί τινι Ar.; c. inf. to swear that . . , Dem.
c. acc. to call to witness, swear by, τὴν ἐμὴν ψυχήν Eur.:—so in Mid., Dem.
in Mid. also, c. gen. to take an oath against, accuse on oath, Hdt.

div1.head: κατόνομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to censure bitterly, depreciate, abuse, Hdt.

div1.head: κάτοξυς
div1.sense: very sharp, piercing, of sound, Ar.

div1.head: κατοπάζω
div1.sense: to follow hard upon, Hes.

div1.head: κατόπιν
div1.sense: by consequence, behind, after, Theogn., Attic:—c. gen., Ar., Plat.
of Time, after, Plat.

div1.head: κατόπισθεν
div1.sense: behind, after, in the rear, Hom.; c. gen., Od.
of Time, hereafter, afterwards, henceforth, Od.

div1.head: κατοπτεύω
div1.sense: to spy out, reconnoitre, Xen.:—Pass. to be observed, Soph.

div1.head: κατόπτης
div1.sense: a spy, scout, Hhymn., Hdt., Aesch., etc.
an overseer, τῶν πραγμάτων Aesch.

div1.head: κάτοπτος
div1.sense: to be seen, visible, Thuc.
c. gen. in view of or looking down over, Aesch.

div1.head: κατοπτρίζω
div1.sense: to shew as in a mirror:—Mid. κατοπτριζόμενοι τὴν δόξαν beholding as in a mirror, or rather reflecting as a mirror, NTest.

div1.head: κάτοπτρον
div1.sense: a mirror, Lat. speculum, Eur.
metaph. a mere reflexion (not a reality), Aesch.

div1.head: κατοργανίζω
div1.sense: to sound with music through, Anth.

div1.head: κατοργάς
div1.sense: celebrating orgies, Anth.

div1.head: κατοργιάζω
div1.sense: to initiate in orgies, Plut.

div1.head: κατορθόω
div1.sense: to set upright, erect, Eur.:—metaph. to keep straight, set right, Soph.
to accomplish successfully, bring to a successful issue, Plat., Dem.: —Pass. to succeed, prosper, Hdt., Eur.; δρᾶν κατώρθωσαι thou hast rightly purposed to do, Aesch.
intr. as in Pass. to go on prosperously, succeed, Thuc., Xen.; τὸ κατορθοῦν success, Dem.

div1.head: κατόρθωσις
div1.sense: a setting straight: successful accomplishment of a thing, success, Arist.

div1.head: κατορθωτικός
div1.sense: likely or able to succeed, Arist.

div1.head: κατορούω
div1.sense: to rush downwards, Hhymn.

div1.head: κατορρωδέω
div1.sense: to be dismayed at, dread greatly, c. acc., Hdt.
absol. to be afraid, be in fear, Hdt.

div1.head: κατορύσσω
div1.sense: to bury in the earth, Hdt.; ἐπὶ κεφαλὴν κατώρυξε buried head downwards, Hdt.; ἐν τῇ κεφαλῇ Ar.

div1.head: κατορχέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to dance in triumph over, treat despitefully, Lat. insultare, Hdt.

div1.head: κατόσσομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to contemplate, behold, Anth.

div1.head: κατότι
div1.etym: Ionic for καθότι or καθʼ ὅ τι.

div1.head: κατουδαῖος
div1.sense: under the earth, Hhymn.

div1.head: κατουλόω
div1.sense: Mid.-Pass. to cicatrise, heal over, Anth.

div1.head: κατουρίζω
div1.sense: to bring into port with a fair wind: metaph., τάδʼ ὀρθῶς ἔμπεδα κατουρίζει the oracle brings these things safe to port or to fulfilment, or intr. these things come to fulfilment, Soph.

div1.head: κατοχή
div1.sense: a holding fast, detention, Hdt.
possession by a spirit, inspiration, Plut.

div1.head: κάτοχος
div1.sense: holding down, holding fast, tenacious, Plut.
pass. kept down, held fast, overpowered, overcome, Aesch., Soph.; κάτοχος subject to him, Eur.

div1.head: κατόψιος
div1.sense: in sight of, opposite, τινος Eur.

div1.head: κατοψοφαγέω
div1.sense: to spend in eating, Aeschin.

div1.head: κάτωθεν
div1.sense: from below, up from below, Aesch., Plat.:—also, from the low country, from the coast, Hdt.
below, beneath, where κάτω would be required by our idiom, Soph., Plat., etc.

div1.head: κατωθέω
div1.sense: to push down, Il.

div1.head: κατωκάρα
div1.sense: head downwards, Ar.

div1.head: κατωμάδιος
div1.sense: from the shoulder, δίσκος κ. a quoit thrown from the shoulder, i. e. from the upturned hand held above the shoulder, Il.; cf. κατ-ωμαδόν
worn or borne on the shoulder, Anth.

div1.head: κατωμαδόν
div1.sense: from the shoulders, with the arm drawn back to the shoulder, Il.

div1.head: κατωμοσία
div1.sense: an accusation on oath, Hdt.

div1.head: κάτω
div1.sense: with verbs of Motion, down, downwards, Hom., Hdt., Attic
with Verbs of Rest, beneath, below, underneath, opp. to ἄνω, Hes.: —esp. in the world below, Soph., Plat.
geographically below, southward, Hdt.; but also, on the coast, Thuc.
as a prep. c. gen. under, below, Trag.
comp. κατωτέρω, lower, further, downwards, Ar.; c. gen. lower than, below, Hdt.
Sup. κατωτάτω, at the lowest part, Hdt.

div1.head: κατῶρυξ
div1.sense: sunk or imbedded in the earth, ἀγορὴ λάεσσι κατωρυχέεσσʼ ἀραρυῖα (as if from κατωρυχής), Od.
underground, in caves, Aesch.; ἐκ κατώρυχος στέγης, i. e. from the grave, Soph.
as Subst., κατῶρυξ, a pit, cavern, Soph.
a buried treasure, Eur.

div1.head: κατώτατος
div1.sense: lowest, Xen.: neut. pl. as adv., Hdt.

div1.head: κατωφαγᾶς
div1.sense: eating with the head down to the ground, gluttonous, Ar.

div1.head: κατωφερής
div1.sense: sunken, Xen.

div1.head: Καύκασος
div1.sense: Mt. Caucasus between the Euxine and Caspian, Hdt.; a gen. Καυκάσιος (as if from Καύκασις) Hdt.; τὸ Καυκάσιον ὄρος Hdt.

div1.head: καύλινος
div1.sense: made of a stalk or stick, Luc.

div1.head: καυλομύκητες
div1.sense: stalk-fungi, Luc.

div1.head: καυλός
div1.sense: the shaft of a spear, Il.: the hilt of a sword, Il.
the stalk of a plat, Ar., etc.

div1.head: καῦμα
div1.sense: burning heat, esp. of the sun, καύματος in the sun-heat, Il.; καῦμʼ ἔθαλπε Soph.
fever-heat, Thuc.:—metaph. of love, Anth.

div1.head: καυματίζω
div1.sense: to burn or scorch up, NTest.:—Pass. to be burnt up, NTest.

div1.head: καυνάκης
div1.sense: a thick cloak, Ar.

div1.head: καύσιμος
div1.sense: fit for burning, combustible, Xen.

div1.head: καῦσις
div1.sense: a burning, Hdt.:—in surgery, cautery, Plat.

div1.head: καυσόω
div1.sense: Pass. to burn with intense heat, NTest.

div1.head: καύστειρα
div1.sense: fem. adj. burning hot, raging, in gen. καυστείρης κάχης Il.

div1.head: καυστός
div1.sense: burnt, red-hot, Eur.

div1.head: Καΰστριος
div1.sense: of or from the river Cayster (in Lydia), Ar.

div1.head: καύσων
div1.sense: burning heat, NTest.

div1.head: καυτηριάζω
div1.sense: to cauterise, brand: metaph. in Pass., NTest.

div1.head: καυτήριον
div1.sense: a branding iron, Luc., NTest.

div1.head: καυτήρ
div1.sense: a burner, Pind.

div1.head: καυχάομαι
div1.sense: to speak loud, be loud-tongued, Pind.: to boast or vaunt oneself, c. inf., to boast that, Hdt.:— c. acc. to boast of a thing, c. acc., NTest.

div1.head: καύχημα
div1.sense: a boast, vaunt, Pind.
a subject of boasting, NTest.

div1.head: καυχήμων
div1.sense: boastful, Babr.

div1.head: καύχησις
div1.sense: reason to boast, NTest.

div1.head: καχάζω
div1.sense: to laugh aloud, Soph., Theocr. (Formed from the sound, cf. Lat. cachinnari.)

div1.head: καχεξία
div1.sense: a bad habit of body, opp. to εὐεξία, Plat., etc.

div1.head: καχήμερος
div1.sense: living bad days, wretched, Anth.

div1.head: καχλάζω
div1.etym: redupl. form of χλάζω, only used in pres. and imperf.,
div1.sense: to plash, of wine poured into a cup, Pind.; of the sea, Aesch., Theocr.:—c. acc. cogn., κῦμα ἀφρὸν καχλάζον a wave frothing with foam, Eur.

div1.head: κάχληξ
div1.sense: a pebble in the beds of rivers:—collectively, gravel, shingle, Thuc.
div1.etym: Prob. akin to χάλιξ, Lat. calx, calculus.

div1.head: καχορμισία
div1.sense: unlucky harbourage, Anth.

div1.head: κάχρυς
div1.sense: parched barley, from which pearl-barley (ἄλφιτα) was made, Ar.

div1.head: καχύποπτος
div1.sense: suspecting evil, suspicious, Plat.

div1.head: κεάζω
div1.sense: to split, cleave wood, Od.; of lightning, to shiver, shatter, Od.; of a spear, κέασσε δὲ ὀστέα λευκά Il.; [κεφαλὴ ἄνδιχα κεάσθη was cloven in twain, Il.

div1.head: κεβλήπυρις
div1.sense: the redcap, redpoll, Ar.

div1.head: κεγχριαῖος
div1.sense: of the size of a grain of millet, Luc.

div1.head: κεγχροβόλοι
div1.sense: millet-throwers, Luc.

div1.head: κέγχρος
div1.sense: millet, Hes., Hdt., etc.; of a single grain, Hdt.
anything in small grains, as the spawn of fish, Hdt.

div1.head: κεγχρώματα
div1.sense: things of the size of millet-grains:—in Eur., eyelet-holes in the rim of the shield, through which a soldier could view his enemy without exposing his person.

div1.head: κεδάννυμι
div1.sense: to break asunder, break up, scatter, Hom.:—Pass., κεδασθείσης ὑσμίνης when the battle was broken up, i. e. when the combatants were no longer in masses, Il.

div1.head: κεδνός
div1.sense: careful, diligent, sage, trusty, Hom., Aesch., Eur.
pass. cared for, cherished, dear, Hom.
of things, κέδνʼ εἰδυῖα knowing her duties, Od.; κ. φροντίς, βουλεύματα sage, wise, Aesch.; of news, good, joyful, Aesch.

div1.head: κεδρία
div1.sense: cedar resin or oil, Hdt.

div1.head: κέδρινος
div1.sense: of cedar, Il., Eur.

div1.head: κέδρος
div1.sense: the cedar-tree, Lat. cedrus, Od., Hdt.
anything made of cedar-wood; a cedar-coffin, Eur.; a cedar-box, for a bee-hive, Theocr.
cedar-oil, Luc.

div1.head: κεδρωτός
div1.sense: made of or inlaid with cedar-wood, Eur.

div1.head: κεῖμαι
div1.sense: to be laid (used as a Pass. to τίθημι), and so to lie, lie outstretched, Hom., etc.; ὁ δʼ ἐπʼ ἐννέα κεῖτο πέλεθρα lay stretched over nine plethra, Od.; κειμένωι ἐπεμπηδᾶν to kick him when heʼs down, Ar.
to lie asleep, repose, Hom., etc.:—also, to lie idle, lie still, Hom.; ὑπὸ γαστέρʼ ἐλυσθεὶς κείμην of Ulysses under the ramʼs belly, Od.; κακὸν κείμενον a sleeping evil, Soph.
to lie sick or wounded, lie in misery, Hom., Soph., etc.; to lie at the mercy of the conqueror, Aesch.
to lie dead, like Lat. jacere, Hom., Hdt., Trag.
to lie neglected or uncared for, of an unburied corpse, Il.;—so also of places, to lie in ruins, Aesch.
of wrestlers, to have a fall, Aesch., Ar.
of places, to lie, be situated, Od., Hdt., Attic
to be laid up, be in store, of goods, property, Hom.;—also of things dedicated to a god, Hdt.; of money, κείμενα deposits, Hdt.
to be set up, proposed, κεῖται ἄεθλον Il.; ὅπλων ἔκειτʼ ἀγὼν πέρι Soph.
of laws, κεῖται νόμος the law is laid down, Eur., Thuc.; οἱ νόμοι οἱ κείμενοι the established laws, Ar.; κεῖται ζημία the penalty is fixed by law, Thuc.
of names, κεῖται ὄνομα the name is given, Hdt., Xen.
metaph., πένθος ἐνὶ φρεσὶ κεῖται grief lies heavy on my heart, Od.; ταῦτα θεῶν ἐν γούνασι κεῖται, i. e. these things are yet in the power of the gods, to give or not, Il.
κεῖσθαι ἔν τινι to rest entirely or be dependent on him, Pind.; θεῶι κείμεθα Soph.
to be so and so, Hdt., Aesch.:—simply, to be, νεῖκος κ. τισι there is strife between them, Soph.

div1.head: κειμήλιον
div1.sense: anything stored up as valuable, a treasure, heirloom, Hom., Hdt., Soph., Eur.

div1.head: κειμήλιον
div1.sense: anything stored up as valuable, a treasure, heirloom, Hom., Hdt., Soph., Eur., etc.

div1.head: κειρία
div1.sense: the cord or girth of a bedstead, Lat. instita, Ar.
in pl. swathings, grave-clothes, NTest.

div1.head: κείρω
div1.sense: to cut the hair short, shear, clip, Il., Hdt., Eur.:— Mid. to cut off oneʼs hair or have it cut off, as in deep mourning, Hom., Eur., etc.:—Pass., βοστρύχους κεκαρμένος having oneʼs locks cut off, Eur.; κεκάρθαι τὰς κεφαλάς to have their heads shorn, in sign of mourning, Hdt.: of the hair, to be cut off, Pind.
to cut or hew out, Il.; ὕλην Soph.

to ravage a country, by cutting down the crops and fruit-trees, Hdt., Thuc.:—Pass., of a country, to be ravaged, Thuc.:—Mid., Ἄρης πλάκα κερσάμενος having had the plain swept clean (by destroying the men), Aesch.
generally, to destroy, and so,
to tear, eat greedily, Lat. depasci, of beasts, Hom.; ἔκειρε πολύκερων φόνον, i. e. he slaughtered many a horned beast, Soph.
of the suitors, to consume, waste oneʼs substance, Od.

div1.head: κείω
div1.sense: βῆ δʼ ἰμέναι κείων he went to lie down, went to bed, Od.; ἴομεν κείοντες Il.

div1.head: κείω
div1.sense: to cleave, Od.

div1.head: κείω
div1.sense: to cleave, radic. form of κεάζω, Od.

div1.head: κεκαφηώς
div1.etym: an Epic perf. part. with no pres. in use
div1.sense: only found in phrase κεκαφηὼς θυμόν breathing forth oneʼs life, Lat. animam agens, Hom.—Commonly referred to κάπτω.

div1.head: κέκραγμα
div1.sense: a scream, cry, Ar.

div1.head: κεκράκτης
div1.sense: a bawler, Ar.

div1.head: κεκραξιδάμας
div1.sense: he who conquers all in bawling, the blusterer, Ar.

div1.head: Κέκροψ
div1.sense: a mythical king of Athens, Hdt.: hence
adj. Κεκρόπιος, η, ον Cecropian, Athenian, πέτρα K. the Acropolis, Eur.; (also simply Κεκροπία, ἡ, used for Athens itself, Eur.); K. χθών Attica, Eur.; Κεκρόπιοι, οἱ, the Athenians, Anth.
fem. Κεκροπίς, name of a tribe, Ar.
Κεκροπίδαι, οἱ, the Athenians, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: κεκρύφαλος
div1.sense: a womanʼs head-dress of net, to confine the hair, Lat. reticulum, Il., Anth.
part of the headstall of a bridle, Xen.
the pouch or belly of a hunting-net, Xen., Plut.

div1.head: κελαδεινός
div1.sense: sounding, noisy, Il.; epith. of Artemis, from the noise of the chase, Hom.:—Doric κελαδεννός, Pind.

div1.head: κελαδέω
div1.sense: to sound as rushing water, Orac. ap. Aeschin.:— to shout aloud, in applause, Il.; κ. παιᾶνα to sound the loud paean, Eur.
of various sounds, to utter a cry, cry aloud, Aesch., Ar., etc.; of bells, to ring, tinkle, Eur.; of the flute, κ. φθόγγον κάλλιστον Eur.
trans. to sing of, celebrate loudly, τινά Pind., Eur., etc.

div1.head: κελάδημα
div1.sense: a rushing sound, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: κελαδῆτις
div1.sense: loud-sounding, Pind.

div1.head: κέλαδος
div1.sense: a noise as of rushing waters: a loud noise, din, clamour, Il.
a loud clear voice, a shout, cry, Aesch., Soph., etc.
the sound of music, Eur.

div1.head: κελάδω
div1.sense: sounding, roaring, Hom., Theocr.

div1.head: κελαινεγχής
div1.sense: with black (i. e. bloody) spear, Pind.

div1.head: κελαινεφής
div1.sense: black with clouds, of Zeus, shrouded in dark clouds, cloudwrapt, Hom.:—generally, dark-coloured, αἷμα Hom.; πεδίον κ. black, rich soil, Pind.

div1.head: κελαινόβρωτος
div1.sense: black and bloody with gnawing, Aesch.

div1.head: κελαινόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to grow black or dark, Aesch.

div1.head: κελαινός
div1.sense: black, swart, dark, murky, Hom., etc.

div1.head: κελαινοφαής
div1.sense: black-gleaming, ὄρφνα κ. murky twilight, Ar.

div1.head: κελαινόφρων
div1.sense: black-hearted, Aesch.

div1.head: κελαινόχρως
div1.sense: black-coloured, Anth.

div1.head: κελαινώπας
div1.sense: black-faced, swarthy, gloomy, Soph.: fem., κελαινῶπις Pind.

div1.head: κελαρύζω
div1.sense: to murmur, of running water, Hom.; Doric 3rd sg. imperf. κελάρυσδε Theocr.

div1.head: κελέβη
div1.sense: a cup, jar, pan, Theocr.

div1.head: κελέοντες
div1.sense: the beams in the upright loom of the ancients, between which the web was stretched, Theocr.

div1.head: κελευθήτης
div1.sense: a wayfarer, Anth.

div1.head: κελευθοποιός
div1.sense: road-making, Aesch.

div1.head: κελευθοπόρος
div1.sense: a wayfarer, Anth.

div1.head: κέλευθος
div1.sense: a road, way, path, track, Hom., etc.; ὑγρὰ κέλευθα, ἰχθυόεντα κέλευθα, of the sea, Od.; ἀνέμων κέλευθα or κέλευθοι Hom.; ἐγγὺς γὰρ νυκτός τε καὶ ἤματός εἰσι κέλευθοι i. e. night and day follow closely, Od.; ἄρκτου στροφάδες κ. their paths or orbits, Soph.
a journey, voyage, Hom.; πολλὴ κ., i. e. a great distance, Soph.
an expedition, Aesch.
a way of going, walk, gait, Eur.:—metaph. a way of life, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: κέλευσμα
div1.sense: an order, command, behest, Aesch., Soph., etc.; a call, summons, Aesch.:— the word of command in battle, Hdt.; also the call of the κελευστής (q. v.), which gave the time to the rowers, ἀπὸ ἑνὸς κελεύσματος all at once, Thuc.; ἐκ κελεύσματος at the word of command, Aesch.

div1.head: κελευσμός
div1.sense: an order, command, Eur.

div1.head: κελευστής
div1.sense: the signalman on board ship, who gave the time to the rowers, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: κελευστός
div1.sense: ordered, commanded, Luc.

div1.head: κελευτιάω
div1.etym: Frequentat. of κελεύω, as πνευστιάω from πνέω
only used in Epic part. (dual), κελευτιόωντε
div1.sense: continually urging on [the men], Il.

div1.head: κελεύω
div1.sense: to urge or drive on, urge, exhort, bid, command, order, Hom., etc.: c. acc. pers. et inf. to order one to do, Il.; (also c. dat. pers., Hom.):—c. acc. pers. et rei, τί με ταῦτα κελεύεις (sc. ποιεῖν); also c. acc. pers. only, θυμός με κελεύει (sc. φείδεσθαι) Od.; ἐκέλευσε τοὺς ἕνδεκα ἐπὶ τὸν Θηραμένην ordered them [to go] against him, ordered them to seize him, Xen.; c. acc. rei only, to command a thing, Aesch.:—Pass., τὸ κελευόμενον, τὰ -να, commands, orders, Xen.

div1.head: κέλης
div1.sense: a courser, riding-horse, Od., Hdt., etc.
a fast-sailing yacht with one bank of oars, a light vessel, Lat. celox, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: κελητίζω
div1.sense: to ride, of one who rides one or more horses, leaping from one to the other, Il.

div1.head: κέλλω
div1.sense: to drive on, νῆα κέλσαι to run a ship to land, put her to shore, Lat. appellere, Od.:—metaph., Ἄργει κ. πόδα Eur.
intr., of ships or seamen, to put to shore or into harbour, Od., Aesch., etc.:—metaph., πᾶ ποτε κέλσαντʼ having reached what port? Aesch.; πᾶ κέλσω; where shall I find a haven? Eur.

div1.head: κέλομαι
div1.sense: to urge on, exhort, command, in Hom.; constructed like κελεύω.
much like καλέω, to call, call to, Il.: also, to call on for aid, Soph.
to call by name, call, Pind.

div1.head: Κελτικός
div1.sense: Celtic, Gallic, fem. Κελτίς, ίδος, Anth.

div1.head: Κελτιστί
div1.sense: in the language of the Celts, Luc.

div1.head: Κελτοί
div1.sense: the Kelts or Celts, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: κέλυφος
div1.sense: a sheath, case, pod, shell, Arist.: the hollow of the eye, Anth.
metaph. of old dicasts, ἀντωμοσιῶν κελύφη mere affidavit- husks, Ar.;—of an old manʼs boat, which served as his coffin, Anth.

div1.head: κέλωρ
div1.sense: son, Eur.

div1.head: κεμάς
div1.sense: a young deer, a pricket, Il.:—also κεμμάς, Anth.

div1.head: κεναγγής
div1.sense: emptying vessels: breeding famine, Aesch.

div1.head: κενανδρία
div1.sense: lack of men, dispeopled state, Aesch.

div1.head: κένανδρος
div1.sense: empty of men, dispeopled, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: κενεαυχής
div1.sense: vain-glorious, Il.

div1.head: κενέβρειος
div1.sense: dead: κενέβρεια, τά, carrion, dogʼs-meat, Ar.

div1.head: κενεμβατέω
div1.sense: to step on emptiness, step into a hole, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: κενεόφρων
div1.sense: empty-minded, Theogn., Pind.

div1.head: κενεών
div1.sense: the hollow below the ribs, the flank, Hom., Xen.
any hollow, a glen, Anth.

div1.head: κενοδοντίς
div1.sense: toothless, Anth.

div1.head: κενολογέω
div1.sense: to talk emptily, Arist.

div1.head: κενός
div1.sense: of things, empty, opp. to πλέως or πλήρης, Hom., Hdt., Attic
metaph. empty, vain, κενὰ εὔγματα Od.; κ. ἐλπίς Aesch., etc.:—in adverbial usages, neut. pl., κενεὰ πνεύσας Pind.; διὰ κενῆς to no purpose, in vain, Ar., Thuc.
of persons,
c. gen. void, destitute, bereft, τοῦ νοῦ, φρενῶν Soph.; συμμάζων Eur.
empty-handed, Hom., Hdt., Attic:— bereft of her mate, λέαινα Soph.: — empty of wit, empty-headed, Soph., Ar.
comp. and Sup. κενώτερος, -ώτατος, Plat., etc.

div1.head: κενοταφέω
div1.sense: to honour with an empty tomb, Eur.

div1.head: κενοτάφιον
div1.sense: an empty tomb, cenotaph, Xen.

div1.head: κενότης
div1.sense: emptiness, vanity, Plat.

div1.head: κενοφροσύνη
div1.sense: emptiness of mind, Plut.

div1.head: κενόφρων
div1.sense: empty-minded, Aesch.

div1.head: κενοφωνία
div1.sense: vain talking, babbling, NTest.

div1.head: κενόω
div1.sense: to empty out, drain, opp. to πληρόω, Aesch., Eur., etc.; c. gen. to empty of a thing:— Pass. to be emptied, made or left empty, Soph.; ἐς τὸ κενούμενον into the space continually left empty, Thuc.; c. gen., κεκεινωμένος πάντων stripped of all things, Hdt.
to make a place empty by leaving it, desert it, Eur.
metaph. to make empty, to make of no account or of no effect, NTest.:—Pass. to be or become so, NTest.

div1.head: Κενταύρειος
div1.sense: Centaurian, of Centaurs, Eur.

div1.head: Κενταυρίδης
div1.sense: of or from Centaurs, ἵππος K. a Thessalian horse, Luc.

div1.head: Κενταυρικός
div1.sense: like a Centaur, i. e. savage, brutal: adv. -κῶς, Ar.

div1.head: κενταυρομαχία
div1.sense: a battle of Centaurs, Plut.

div1.head: κενταυροπληθής
div1.sense: full of Centaurs, Eur.

div1.head: Κένταυρος
div1.sense: a Centaur: the Centaurs were a savage Thessalian race, between Pelion and Ossa, extirpated in a war with their neighbours the Lapithae, Hom.
in later Poets they are monsters of double shape, half-man and half-horse, Pind., etc.

div1.head: κεντέω
div1.etym: Epic inf. κένσαι as if from κέντω
div1.sense: to prick, goad, spur on, Il., Ar.
of bees and wasps, to sting, Ar., Theocr.
generally, to prick, stab, Pind., Soph., etc.: to torture, Xen.: metaph., σὺν δόλωι κ. to stab in the dark, Soph.

div1.head: κεντρηνεκής
div1.sense: spurred or goaded on, Il.

div1.head: κεντρίζω
div1.sense: to prick, goad or spur on, Xen.; metaph., ἔρως κ. Xen.

div1.head: κεντρομανής
div1.sense: madly spurring, or spurring to madness, Anth.

div1.head: κέντρον
div1.sense: any sharp point:
a horsegoad, Lat. stimulus, Il., etc.: also an ox-goad, Plat.; —proverb., πρὸς κέντρα λακτίζειν, v. λακτίζω 2.
metaph. a goad, spur, incentive, Aesch., Eur.
an instrument of torture, Hdt.:—metaph. in pl. tortures, pangs, Soph.
the sting of bees and wasps, Ar.; of a scorpion, Dem.; metaph. of the impression produced by Socrates, ὥσπερ μέλιττα τὸ κ. ἐγκαταλιπών Plat.
the stationary point of a pair of compasses, the centre of a circle, Plat.

div1.head: κεντροτυπής
div1.sense: struck by the goad, Anth.

div1.head: κεντρόω
div1.sense: to furnish with a sting:— Pass. to be so furnished, to sting, Plat.
to strike with a goad, Hdt.

div1.head: κέντρων
div1.sense: one that bears the marks of the κέντρον, a rogue that has been put to the torture, Ar.

div1.head: κεντυρίων
div1.sense: the Lat. Centurio, NTest.

div1.head: κέντωρ
div1.sense: a goader, driver, Il.

div1.head: κένωσις
div1.sense: an emptying, Plat.

div1.head: κέπφος
div1.sense: a sea-bird:—metaph. a booby, Ar.

div1.head: κεραία
div1.sense: any thing projecting like a horn; a yard-arm, (as Lat. cornua antennarum), Aesch., Thuc., etc.
the projecting beam of a crane, Thuc.
a branching stake of wood, Plut.:— of the forked ends of the ancilia, Plut.
the apex of a letter, a dot, tittle, NTest.
the projecting spur of a mountain, Anth.
a bow of horn, Anth.

div1.head: κεραΐζω
div1.sense: to ravage, despoil, plunder, Hom., Hdt.
of ships, to sink or disable them, Hdt.
of living beings, to assail fiercely, to slaughter, Il., Hdt.
to carry off as plunder, Hdt.

div1.head: κεραϊστής
div1.sense: a ravager, robber, Hhymn.

div1.head: κεραίω
div1.sense: ζωρότερον κέραιε, mix the wine stronger, Il.

div1.head: κεραμεία
div1.sense: the potterʼs art or craft, Plat.

div1.head: Κεραμεικός
div1.sense: the potterʼs quarter: in Athens two places were called Cerameicus, one within and the other without the Dipylon or Thriasian Gate, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: κεραμεῖον
div1.sense: a potterʼs work-shop, Aeschin.

div1.head: Κεραμεῖς
div1.sense: name of an Attic deme, Ar., etc.

div1.head: κεραμεοῦς
div1.sense: of clay, earthen, Plat.

div1.head: κεραμεύς
div1.sense: a potter, Lat. figulus, Il.: —proverb., κεραμεὺς κεραμεῖ κοτέει "two of a trade never agree, " Hes.

div1.head: κεραμεύω
div1.sense: to be a potter, work in earthenware, Plat., etc.
c. acc., κ. τὸν κεραμέα to make a pot of the potter, Plat.

div1.head: κεραμικός
div1.sense: of or for pottery, Xen., etc.

div1.head: κεράμιον
div1.sense: an earthenware vessel, a jar, Lat. testa, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: κεραμίς
div1.sense: a roof-tile or coping tile, Ar., Thuc.

div1.head: κέραμος
div1.sense: potterʼs earth, potterʼs clay, Plat.
anything made of this earth, as,
an earthen vessel, wine-jar, Il., Hdt.: also in collective sense, pottery, Ar.; κ. ἐσάγεται πλήρης οἴνου jars full of wine, Hdt.
a tile, and in collective sense, the tiles, tiling, Ar., Thuc.
a jar, used to confine a person in, Il.

div1.head: κεράννυμι
div1.sense: to mix, mingle, (cf. κρᾶσις):

mostly of diluting wine with water, Od., Attic;—so in Mid., ὅτε περ οἶνον κέρωνται when they mix their wine, Il.; κρητῆρα κεράσσατο he mixed him a bowl, Od.:—Pass., κύλιξ ἴσον ἴσωι κεκραμένη a cup mixed half and half, Ar.
to temper or cool by mixing, θυμῆρες κεράσασα having mixed (the water) to an agreeable temperature, Od.

generally, to mix, blend, temper, regulate, Lat. tempero, of climates, ὧραι μάλιστα κεκραμέναι most temperate seasons, Hdt.; οὐ γῆρας κέκραται γενεᾶι no old age is mingled with the race, i. e. it knows no old age, Pind.:—of tempers of mind, Plat.
generally, to mix, compound, Lat. attempero, ἔκ τινος of a thing, Plat.; φωνὴ μεταξὺ τῆς τε Χαλκιδέων καὶ Δωρίδος ἐκράθη Thuc.

div1.head: κεραοξόος
div1.sense: polishing or working horn, esp. for bows, Il.

div1.head: κεραός
div1.sense: horned, Hom., Theocr.
of horn, made of horn, Anth.

div1.head: κέρας
div1.sense: the horn of an animal, as of oxen, Il.; ὀφθαλμοὶ δʼ ὡσεὶ κέρα ἔστασαν his eyes stood fixed and stiff like horns, Od.
horn, as a material, αἱ μὲν γὰρ αἱ πύλαι κεράεσσι τετεύχαται, of the horn doors, through which the true dreams came, Od.
anything made of horn,
a bow, Il., Hom., Theocr.
of musical instruments, a horn for blowing, Xen.: a flute, Luc.
a drinking-horn, Xen.
βοὸς κ. a horn guard or pipe to which the leadweight (μολύβδαινα) of a fishing-line was attached, Hom.
κέρατα the horn points with which the writing-reed was tipped, Anth.
an arm or branch of a river, Hes., Thuc.

the wing of an army or fleet, Hdt., Attic; κατὰ κέρας προσβάλλειν, ἐπιπίπτειν to attack in flank, Thuc., Xen.; ἐπὶ κέρας ἄγειν to lead towards the wing, i. e. in column, not with a broad front, Lat. agmine longo, Hdt., Attic
any projection, e. g. a mountain-peak, Xen.

div1.head: κεράστης
div1.sense: horned, ἔλαφος Soph., Eur.:—fem. κεραστίς, ίδος, of Io, Aesch.

div1.head: κεραστός
div1.sense: mixed, mingled, Anth.

div1.head: κερασφόρος
div1.sense: horn-bearing, horned, Eur.

div1.head: κερατέα
div1.sense: the carob or locust-tree (Arab. kharoob):—its fruit

div1.head: κεράτια
div1.sense: is called St. Johnʼs bread, from a notion that it was the fruit he ate in the wilderness, NTest.

div1.head: κεράτινος
div1.sense: of horn, Xen.

div1.head: κεράτιον
div1.etym: Dim. of κέρας, v. sub κερατέα.

div1.head: κερατών
div1.sense: made of horns, Plut.

div1.head: κεραύνειος
div1.sense: wielding the thunder, Anth.

div1.head: κεραύνιος
div1.sense: of a thunderbolt, Aesch., Eur.
thunder-smitten, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: κεραυνοβολέω
div1.sense: to hurl the thunderbolt, Anth.
trans. to strike therewith, Il.

div1.head: κεραυνοβόλος
div1.sense: hurling the thunder, Anth.

div1.head: κεραυνόβολος
div1.sense: pass. thunder-stricken, Eur.

div1.head: κεραυνοβρόντης
div1.sense: the lightener and thunderer, Ar.

div1.head: κεραυνομάχης
div1.sense: fighting with thunder, Anth.

div1.head: κεραυνός
div1.sense: a thunderbolt, Lat. fulmen, Hom., etc.: generally, thunder:—but thunder properly was βροντή, Lat. tonitru; lightning was στεροπή, Lat. fulgur.
metaph., κεραυνὸν ἐν γλώσσῃ φέρειν, of Pericles, Plut.

div1.head: κεραυνοφαής
div1.sense: flashing like thunder, Eur.

div1.head: κεραυνοφόρος
div1.sense: wielding the thunderbolt, Plut.

div1.head: κεραυνόω
div1.sense: to strike with thunderbolts, Hdt.:— Pass., κεραυνωθείς Hes., Plat., etc.

div1.head: κεράω
div1.etym: Epic radic. form of κεράννυμι, part. κερῶν Od.; Mid., in imperat. κεράασθε, Od.; 3rd pl. imperf. κερόωντο Il.

div1.head: Κέρβερος
div1.sense: Cerberus, the fifty-headed dog of Hades, which guarded the gate of the nether world, Hes.; later, with three heads or bodies, Eur.

div1.head: κερδαίνω
div1.sense: to gain, derive profit or advantage, κακὰ κ. to make unfair gains, Hes.; κ. ἔκ or ἀπό τινος Hdt., Attic; πρός τινος Soph.; τί κερδανῶ; what shall I gain by it? Ar.:—c. part. to gain by doing, οὐδὲν ἐκμαθοῦσα κερδανεῖς Aesch., etc.
absol. to make profit, gain advantage, Hdt., Attic:— to traffic, make merchandise, Soph.; κ. ἔπη to receive fair words, Soph.
like ἀπολαύω, to gain a loss, reap disadvantage from a thing, as, δάκρυα κ., Eur.; κ. ζημίαν NTest.

div1.head: κερδαλέος
div1.sense: having an eye to gain, wily, crafty, cunning, Hom.:—of the fox, Archil. ap. Plat.
of things, gainful, profitable, κερδαλεώτερον Hdt.:— τὸ κ. κέρδος, Aesch., Thuc.: adv. -λέως, to oneʼs advantage, Thuc.

div1.head: κερδαλεόφρων
div1.sense: crafty-minded, Il.

div1.head: κερδίων
div1.etym: comp. with no Posit. in use, formed from κέρδος
div1.sense: more profitable, Hom., etc.
κέρδιστος, η, ον, Sup. most cunning or crafty, Il.
of things, most profitable, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: κέρδος
div1.sense: gain, profit, advantage, Lat. lucrum, Od.; ποιεῖσθαί τι ἐν κέρδει, Horaceʼs lucro apponere, Hdt.; so, κέρδος ἡγεῖσθαι or νομίζειν τι Eur., Thuc.
desire of gain, love of gain, Find., Trag.
in pl. cunning arts, wiles, tricks, Hom.

div1.head: κερδοσύνη
div1.sense: like κερδαλεότης, cunning, craft: dat. κερδοσύνῃ as adv., by craft, cunningly, Hom.

div1.head: κερδῷος
div1.etym: κερδῷος I from κέρδος, κερδῳος II from κερδώ
div1.sense: bringing gain, of Hermes, Luc., etc.
foxlike, wily, Babr.

div1.head: κερδώ
div1.sense: the wily one, i. e. the fox, Pind., Ar.

div1.head: κερκιδοποιική
div1.sense: (sc. τέχνη) the art of the shuttle-maker, Arist.

div1.head: κερκίζω
div1.sense: to make the web close with the κερκίς, Plat.

div1.head: κερκίς
div1.sense: in the loom, the rod or comb by which the threads of the woof were driven home, so as to make the web even and close, Hom., Soph., etc.
any rod, a measuring-rod, Anth.
the great bone of the leg, the tibia, Plut.

div1.head: κέρκος
div1.sense: the tail of a beast, Ar., Plat., etc.

div1.head: κέρκουρος
div1.sense: a light vessel, boat, esp. of the Cyprians, Hdt.

div1.head: Κέρκυρα
div1.sense: the island Corcyra, now Corfu, Hdt., etc.: —adj. Κερκυραῖος, η, ον Corcyraean, Hdt., etc.:— τὰ Κερκυραϊκά, the affairs of Corcyra, Thuc.

div1.head: Κέρκωψ
div1.sense: the Cercopes were a kind of men-monkeys, Hdt.
metaph. a mischievous fellow, knave, Aeschin.

div1.head: κέρμα
div1.sense: a slice: hence, a small coin, mite, in pl. small coin, small change, Ar.
generally, small wares, Anth.

div1.head: κερματίζω
div1.sense: to cut small, mince, chop up, Plat.
to coin into small money, Anth.

div1.head: κερματιστής
div1.sense: a money-changer, NTest.

div1.head: κέρνος
div1.sense: κέρνος, a large earthen dish, in which fruits were offered to the Corybantes, borne by a priest or priestess called κερνᾶς, Anth.

div1.head: κεροβάτης
div1.sense: horn-footed, hoofed, Ar.

div1.head: κεροβόας
div1.sense: horn-sounding, of a horn flute, Anth.

div1.head: κερόδετος
div1.sense: bound with or made of horn, Eur.

div1.head: κερόεις
div1.sense: horned, Eur.
of horn, of a flute, Anth.

div1.head: κεροίαξ
div1.sense: a rope belonging to the sailyards, Luc.

div1.head: κεροτυπέω
div1.sense: to butt with the horns:—Pass., of ships in a storm, buffeted, Aesch.

div1.head: κερουλκός
div1.sense: drawn by the horns, pass. of a bow, because tipped with horn, Eur.

div1.head: κερουτιάω
div1.sense: to toss the horns, Lat. cornua tollere: metaph. of persons, to toss the head, give oneself airs, Ar.

div1.head: κεροῦχος
div1.sense: having horns, horned, Babr.

div1.head: κεροφόρος
div1.sense: = κερασφόρος, horned, Eur.

div1.head: κερτομέω
div1.sense: to taunt or sneer at, c. acc. pers., Od., Aesch., Eur.: absol. to sneer, Od.:— Pass. to be scoffed at, Eur.

div1.head: κερτόμησις
div1.sense: jeering, mockery, Soph.

div1.head: κερτομία
div1.sense: = κερτόμησις, jeering, mockery, in pl., κερτομίας ἤδʼ αἴσυλα μυθήσασθαι Il.; κερτομίας καὶ χεῖρας ἀφέξω Od.

div1.head: κερτόμιος
div1.sense: heart-cutting, stinging, reproachful, Od.; Δία κερτομίοις ἐπέεσσι Hom.; also, κερτομίοισι (without ἐπέεσσι) Hom.; κέρτομα βάζειν Hes.; χοροὶ κέρτομοι abusive, Hdt.
mocking, delusive, κέρτομος χαρά Eur.

div1.head: κέρχνη
div1.sense: a kind of hawk, the kestrel; also

div1.head: κεστός
div1.sense: stitched, embroidered, κεστὸς ἱμάς of Aphroditeʼs charmed girdle, Il.
later, κεστός, οῦ, as Subst., Lat. cestus, Anth., Luc.

div1.head: κέστρα
div1.sense: a fish held in esteem among the Greeks, Ar.

div1.head: κευθμών
div1.sense: a hiding place, hole, corner, Od.; κευθμῶνες ὀρέων the hollows of the mountains, Pind., Eur.
of the nether world, the abyss, Hes., Aesch.
in Aesch. Eum. 805 = ἄδυτον, a sanctuary.

div1.head: κεῦθος
div1.sense: ὑπὸ κεύθεσι γαίης in the depths of the earth, Hom.; in sg., κ. νεκύων Soph.; κ. οἴκων the innermost chambers, like μυχός, Eur.

div1.head: κεύθω
div1.sense: to cover quite up, to cover, hide, of the grave, ὅπου κύθε γαῖα where earth covered him, Od.; so, ὃν οὐδὲ κατθανόντα γαῖα κ. Aesch.; also, ὁπότʼ ἄν σε δόμοι κεκύθωσι, i. e. when thou hast entered the house, Od.: Soph.:—perf. to contain, Hom., Soph.
to conceal, and in perf. to keep concealed, Hom.; οὐκέτι κεύθετε βρωτὺν οὐδὲ ποτῆτα no more can ye disguise your eating and drinking, Od.; κ. τι ἔνδον καρδίας Aesch.; κ. μῆνιν to cherish anger, Eur.
c. dupl. acc., οὐδέ σε κεύσω ταῦτα nor will I keep them secret from thee, Od.
in Trag. sometimes intr. to be concealed, lie hidden, esp. in perf., Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: κεφάλαιος
div1.sense: of the head: metaph., like Lat. capitalis, principal, Ar.
as Subst., κεφάλαιον, ου, τό, the head, Ar.
the chief or main point, the sum of the matter, Pind., Thuc., etc.; ἐν κεφαλαίῳ, or ὡς ἐν κ., εἰπεῖν to speak summarily, Xen., etc.; ἐν κεφαλαίοις ὑπομνῆσαι, ἀποδεῖξαι, περιλαβεῖν τι Thuc.
of persons, the head or chief, Luc.
of money, the capital, Lat. caput, Opp. to interest, Plat., etc.: the sum total, Dem.
the crown, completion of a thing, a crowning act of wrong, Dem.; κ. ἐπιτιθέναι ἐπί τινι, Lat. corollam imponere rei, Plat.

div1.head: κεφαλαιόω
div1.sense: to bring under heads, sum up, state summarily, Thuc.
to smite on the head, NTest.

div1.head: κεφαλαιώδης
div1.sense: capital, principal, chief, Luc.:—adv. -δῶς, summarily, Arist.

div1.head: κεφαλαίωμα
div1.sense: the sum total, Hdt.

div1.head: κεφαλαλγής
div1.sense: causing headache, Xen.

div1.head: κεφαλαλγία
div1.sense: head-ache: later κεφαλαλγίη, Luc.

div1.head: κεφαλή
div1.sense: the head of man or beast, Hom., etc.; κατὰ κεφαλῆς, Epic κὰκ κεφαλῆς, over the head, Hom.; κὰκ κεφαλήν on the head, Il.:— ἐς πόδας ἐκ κεφαλῆς from head to foot, Il.:— ἐπὶ κεφαλήν head foremost, head downwards, headlong, Hdt., Plat., etc.
the head, put for the whole person, Hom.; ἶσον ἐμῇ κεφαλῇ like myself, Il.; φίλη κ., Lat. carum caput, Il.: in bad sense, ὦ κακαὶ κεφαλαί Hdt.; ὦ μιαρὰ κ. Ar.
the head, i. e. the life, παρθέμενοι κεφαλάς setting their heads on the cast, Od.:—in imprecations, ἐς κεφαλὴν τρέποιτʼ ἐμοί on my head be it! Ar., etc.
generally, κ. σκορόδου a head of garlic, Ar.: the top or brim of a vessel, Theocr.: the coping of a wall, Xen.:—in pl. the head or source of a river, Hdt.
metaph., like κεφάλαιον, the crown, completion of a thing, Plat.

div1.head: κεφαλῖνος
div1.sense: a sea-fish, = βλεψίας, Dorio ap. Ath.

div1.head: κεφαλίς
div1.sense: Dim. of κεφαλή.
part of a shoe, Arist.
a head, chapter, NTest.

div1.head: Κεχηναῖοι
div1.sense: Comic word for Ἀθηναῖοι, Gapenians for Athenians, Ar.

div1.head: κεχωρισμένως
div1.sense: separately, Arist.

div1.head: Κέως
div1.sense: Ceos, one of the Cyclades, Hdt., etc.: —hence, Κεῖος, Ionic Κήϊος, ὁ, a Ceian, Hdt., etc.; οὐ Χῖος, ἀλλὰ Κεῖος not a (roguish) Chian, but an (honest) Ceian, proverb in Ar.

div1.head: κηδεία
div1.sense: connexion by marriage, alliance, Lat. affinitas, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: κήδειος
div1.sense: cared for, dear, beloved, Il.
careful of, or caring for, c. gen., Eur.
of a funeral or tomb, mourning, sepulchral, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: κηδεμονία
div1.sense: care, solicitude, Plat.

div1.head: κηδεμονικός
div1.sense: provident, careful: adv. -κῶς, Luc.

div1.head: κηδεμών
div1.sense: one who is in charge, esp. for burial, Il.
generally, a protector, guardian, Theogn., Soph., etc.:—also of a female, Soph.
= κηδεστής, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: κήδεος
div1.sense: given in charge for burial, Il.

div1.head: κηδεστής
div1.sense: a connexion by marriage, Lat. affinis, Xen., etc.: esp. a son-in-law, father-in-law, a step-father, Dem.:— a brother-in-law, Eur.

div1.head: κηδεστία
div1.sense: connexion by marriage, Xen.

div1.head: κήδευμα
div1.sense: connexion or alliance by marriage, Lat. affinitas, Eur.
poet. for κηδεστής, one who is so connected, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: κηδεύω
div1.sense: to take charge of, attend to, tend, Soph., Eur.
esp. to attend to a corpse, close the eyes, bury, mourn, Eur., etc.
to contract a marriage, ally oneself in marriage, Aesch., Eur.; κ. λέχος to marry, Soph.:—Pass. to be so allied, Eur.
c. acc. pers. to make oneʼs kinsman by marriage, Eur.
absol., οἱ κηδεύσαντες those who formed the marriage, Eur.

div1.head: κήδιστος
div1.sense: most worthy of our care, most cared for, Hom.
nearest allied by marriage, Od.

div1.head: κῆδος
div1.sense: care for others, c. gen., Od.
trouble, sorrow; mostly in pl. troubles, Hom.
esp. cares for the dead, mourning, Hom., Aesch., etc.; also in sg., κᾶδος φθιμένου Pind.; ἅμα κήδεϊ when there is a death in the family, Hdt.; ἐς τὸ κ. ἰέναι to attend the funeral, Hdt.
an object of care, a care, Aesch.
connexion by marriage, Lat. affinitas, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: κηδόσυνος
div1.sense: anxious, Eur.

div1.head: κήδω
div1.etym: κεκαδήσομαι from κήδω, for κεκαδήσω, κέκαδον, v. χάζω II
div1.sense: Act. to trouble, distress, vex, Hom.
Mid. and Pass. to be troubled or distressed for others, c. gen. pers., Il., etc.: also c. gen. rei, τῶν ἀλφίτων Ar.:—absol. in part. κηδόμενος, η, ον, caring for a person, anxious, Il.

div1.head: κηθάριον
div1.sense: a vessel into which the ψῆφοι were cast in voting, Ar.

div1.head: κηκίς
div1.sense: anything oozing forth, ooze, Aesch.; κ. φόνου oozing blood, Aesch.; μυδῶσα κ., of the juices drawn by fire from a sacrificial victim, Soph.
the dye made from sap oozing from the gall-nut, Dem.; κ. πορφύρας the dye of the purple-fish, Aesch.

div1.head: κηκίω
div1.sense: to gush or ooze, Od., Soph.:—Pass., αἱμάς κηκιομένα ἑλκέων Soph. [ι Epic; ῑ Attic]

div1.head: κήλεος
div1.sense: burning, Il.:—so κήλειος, Il.

div1.head: κηλέω
div1.sense: to charm, bewitch, enchant, beguile, fascinate, esp. by music, Lat. mulcere, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: κηληθμός
div1.sense: enchantment, fascination, Od.

div1.head: κήλημα
div1.sense: a magic charm, spell, Eur.

div1.head: κήλη
div1.sense: a tumor, esp. a rupture, Lat. hernia, Anth.

div1.head: κήλησις
div1.sense: an enchanting, fascination, Plat.

div1.head: κηλητήριος
div1.sense: charming, appeasing, Eur.; τὸ κ. κήλημα, Soph.

div1.head: κηλήτης
div1.sense: one who is ruptured, Anth.

div1.head: κηλιδόω
div1.sense: to stain, sully, soil, Eur.

div1.head: κηλίς
div1.sense: a stain, spot, defilement, esp. of blood, Trag.
metaph. a stain, blemish, dishonour, Soph., Xen.

div1.head: κῆλον
div1.sense: a shaft, an arrow, Il., Hes.

div1.head: κήλων
div1.sense: a swipe or swing-beam, for drawing water, Lat. tolleno:—so, κηλώνειον, Ionic κηλωνήιον.

div1.head: κημός
div1.sense: a muzzle, put on a led horse, Xen., Anth.
the funnel-shaped top to the voting urn (κάδος, καδίσκος) in the Athen. law-courts, through which the ballots (ψῆφοι) were dropt, Ar.

div1.head: κημόω
div1.sense: to muzzle a horse, Xen.

div1.head: κῆνσος
div1.sense: Lat. census, registration of taxation, NTest.: — the tax itself, NTest.

div1.head: κήξ
div1.sense: a sea-bird that dashes into the sea to seize its prey, perh. the tern or gannet, Od.

div1.head: κήπευμα
div1.sense: a garden-flower, Ar.

div1.head: κηπεύς
div1.sense: a gardener, Anth.

div1.head: κηπεύω
div1.sense: to rear in a garden, Luc.: metaph. to tend, cherish, freshen, Eur.

div1.head: κηπίον
div1.sense: Dim. of κῆπος: a parterre: metaph. a decoration, appendage, Thuc.

div1.head: κηπολόγος
div1.sense: teaching in a garden, Anth.

div1.head: κῆπος
div1.sense: a garden, orchard, plantation, Od.:—of any fertile region, Ἀφροδίτης κᾶπος, i. e. Cyrene, Pind.; Διὸς κ., i. e. Libya, Pind., etc.:— οἱ Ἀδώνιδος κῆποι, v. Ἄδωνις 2.

div1.head: κηπουρικός
div1.sense: of or for gardening, Plat.

trans.i: keeper of a garden, a gardener.

div1.head: κηραίνω
div1.sense: to be sick at heart, to be disquieted, anxious, Eur.

div1.head: κηρεσσιφόρητος
div1.sense: urged on by the Κῆρες, Il.

div1.head: κήρινος
div1.sense: of wax, waxen, Plat.: metaph. pliable as wax (Hor., cereus in vitium flecti), Plat.

div1.head: κηριοκλέπτης
div1.sense: stealer of honeycombs, Theocr.

div1.head: κηρίον
div1.sense: a honeycomb, Lat. favus, Hes., Hdt., etc.; also, κηρίον σφηκῶν Hdt.
a wax tablet, Anth.

div1.head: κηριτρεφής
div1.sense: born to misery, Hes.

div1.head: κηρόδετος
div1.sense: wax-bound, μέλι Anth.

div1.head: κηρόθι
div1.sense: in the heart, with all the heart, heartily, Hom., Hes.

div1.head: κηρόω
div1.sense: Mid. to form for oneself of wax, Anth.

div1.head: κηροπαγής
div1.sense: fastened with wax, Anth.

div1.head: κηρόπλαστος
div1.sense: moulded of wax, waxen, Anth.
= κηρόδετος, Aesch.

div1.head: κηρός
div1.sense: bees-wax, Lat. cera, Od., Plat.

div1.head: κηροτέχνης
div1.sense: a modeller in wax, Anacreont.

div1.head: κηρότροφος
div1.sense: waxen, Anth.

div1.head: κηροχίτων
div1.sense: clad in wax, Anth.

div1.head: κηροχυτέω
div1.sense: to make waxen cells, Anth.

div1.head: κήρ
div1.sense: the goddess of death, hence doom, fate, Hom.; in full, Κὴρ Θανάτοιο Od.; Κῆρες Θανάτοιο Il.: generally, bane, ruin, βαρεῖα μὲν κὴρ τὸ μὴ πιθέσθαι grievous ruin it were not to obey, Aesch.; κὴρ οὐ καλή an unseemly calamity, Soph.

div1.head: κῆρ
div1.etym: contr. from κέαρ, as ἦρ from ἔαρ
div1.sense: the heart, Lat. cor, Hom.; dat. κῆρι as adv., with all the heart, heartily, Hom.:—in Trag. always κέαρ.

div1.head: κήρυγμα
div1.sense: that which is cried by a herald, a proclamation, public notice, Hdt., Attic
a reward offered by proclamation, Xen., Aeschin.

div1.head: κηρυκεία
div1.sense: the office of herald or crier, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: κηρύκειον
div1.sense: a heraldʼs wand, Lat. caduceus, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: κηρύκευμα
div1.sense: a proclamation, message, Aesch.

div1.head: κηρυκεύω
div1.sense: to be a herald or crier, fulfil the office of one, Plat.
trans. to proclaim, notify, τί τινι Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: κηρυκικός
div1.sense: of heralds, Plat.

div1.head: κηρύλος
div1.sense: the halcyon. The form κείρυλος, is a joke in Ar., the barber Sporgilos being called (from κείρω), rasor-bird.

div1.head: κῆρυξ
div1.sense: a herald, pursuivant, marshal, public messenger, Hom., etc. In Hom. they summon the assembly, separate combatants, have charge of sacrifices, act as envoys, and their persons were sacred. After Hom., Hermes is called the κῆρυξ of the gods, Hes., etc.
at Athens, a crier, who made proclamation in the public assemblies, Ar., etc.

div1.head: κηρύσσω
