c. gen., ὄχλου κ. χθόνα, to lighten, earth of a multitude, Eur.: —absol. to lighten ships of their cargo, Thuc.: to relieve persons from burthens, Xen.:—Pass. to be relieved, νόσου from disease, Eur.; κουφισθήσομαι ψυχήν Eur.; metaph. to feel oneʼs burthens lightened, Thuc.
c. acc. rei, to lighten, assuage, συμφοράς Dem.; ἔρωτα, Theocr.

div1.head: κούφισις
div1.sense: a lightening, alleviation, relief, Thuc.

div1.head: κουφολογία
div1.sense: light talking, Thuc.

div1.head: κουφόνοος
div1.sense: light-minded, thoughtless, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: κοῦφος
div1.sense: light, nimble, Trag.; used by Hom. only in neut. pl. as. adv. κοῦφα προβιβάς stepping lightly on, Il.:—metaph., κουφότεραι φρένες too buoyant, Pind.
metaph. also light, easy, Aesch., Xen.
empty, unsubstantial, vain, Soph., Thuc.
light in point of weight, opp. to βαρύς, Plat., etc.; κούφα σοι χθὼν ἐπάνωθε πέσοι may earth lie lightly on thee, sit tibi terra levis, Eur.; of soldiers, ὡπλισμένοι κουφοτέροις ὅπλοις Xen.
adv. -φως, lightly, nimbly, Aesch.; κ. ἐσκευασμένοι, of soldiers, Thuc., Xen.
metaph. lightly, with light heart, κουφότερόν μετεφώνεε Od.; κούφως φέρειν to bear lightly, Eur.; ὡς κουφότατα φέρειν Hdt.
lightly, with ease, Aesch.

div1.head: κόφινος
div1.sense: a basket, Ar., Xen.; in later times used specially by Jews, NTest.; being apparently smaller than the σπυρίς.

div1.head: κοχλίας
div1.sense: a snail with a spiral shell, Lat. cochlea, Theocr.

div1.head: κοχλίον
div1.sense: a small snail, Batr.

div1.head: κόχλος
div1.sense: a shell-fish with a spiral shell, used for dying purple, Lat. murex, Arist., Anth.; used as a trumpet, like Lat. concha, Eur., Theocr., etc.

div1.head: κοχυδέω
div1.sense: to stream forth copiously, Theocr.

div1.head: κοχώνη
div1.sense: the posteriors, dual τὰ κοχώνᾱ Ar.

div1.head: κόψιχος
div1.sense: a blackbird, Ar.

div1.head: κράββατος
div1.sense: a couch, bed, Lat. grabatus, NTest.

div1.head: κραδαίνω
div1.sense: to swing, wave, brandish, Eur., Ar.: to shake, agitate, Aesch.:—Pass., αἰχμὴ κραδαινομένη κατὰ γαίης quivering in the ground, Il.
metaph. to agitate, Plut.

div1.head: κραδάω
div1.sense: to shake, brandish, only in part., κραδάων δολιχόσκιον ἔγχος Hom.

div1.head: κράδη
div1.sense: the quivering spray at the end of a branch, Hes., Ar.:—generally, a fig-tree, Ar.

div1.head: κράζω
div1.sense: to croak, of frogs, Ar.: generally, to scream, shriek, cry aloud, Aesch., Ar.; κέκραχθι Ar.; κραγὸν κεκράξεται will bawl aloud, Ar. (κραγόν being aor2 part. used adverbially).
c. acc. rei, to clamour for a thing, Ar.

div1.head: κραίνω
div1.sense: to accomplish, fulfil, bring to pass, Hom., Trag.:—Pass., with fut. mid., to be accomplished or brought to pass, Il., Eur.; v. ἐπικραίνω.
to finish the tale of . . , c. acc., Hhymn.
absol. to exercise sway, to reign, c. acc. cogn. κρ. σκῆπτρα to sway the staff of rule, Soph.
c. gen. to reign over, govern, τοῦ στρατοῦ, τῆς χώρας Soph.
intr. to fulfil oneʼs course, Aesch.

div1.head: κραιπαλάω
div1.sense: only in pres., to have a sick head-ache, consequent upon a debauch, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: κραιπάλη
div1.sense: a drunken head-ache, Lat. crapula, ἐκ κραιπάλης after a drunken bout, Ar.

div1.head: κραιπαλόκωμος
div1.sense: rambling in drunken revelry, Ar.

div1.head: κραιπνός
div1.sense: rapid, rushing, of strong winds, Hom.; of swift feet, Hom.:—metaph. hasty, rash, Il.
adv., quickly, hastily, Hom.; also neut. pl. as adv., Hom.

div1.head: κραιπνόσυτος
div1.sense: swift-rushing, Aesch.

div1.head: κραιπνοφόρος
div1.sense: swift-bearing, αὖραι Aesch.

div1.head: κράμβη
div1.sense: cabbage, kail, Eupol., etc.

div1.head: κράμβος
div1.sense: loud, ringing, Ar.

div1.head: κραμβοφάγος
div1.sense: cabbage-eater, Batr.

div1.head: κραναήπεδος
div1.sense: with hard rocky soil, Hhymn.

div1.head: κραναός
div1.sense: rocky, rugged, of Ithaca, Hom.; of Athens, Pind.; hence Athens was called Κραναὰ πόλις or αἱ Κρανααί Pind.; Κραναοί the people of Attica, Hdt.; and Κραναός a mythical king of Athens, Aesch.

div1.head: κράνεια
div1.sense: the cornel-tree, dog-wood, Lat. cornus, its wood was used for shafts and bows, Hom.

div1.head: κρανέϊνος
div1.sense: made of cornel-wood, Lat. corneus, τόξα Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: κρανίον
div1.sense: the upper part of the head, the skull, Il., Pind., Eur.

div1.head: κράνον
div1.sense: Lat. cornus, Theophr.

div1.head: κρανοποιέω
div1.sense: to make helmets: in Ar. of one who talks big and warlike.

div1.head: κρανοποιός
div1.sense: a helmet-maker, Ar.

div1.head: κράνος
div1.sense: a helmet, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: κραντήρ
div1.sense: one that accomplishes: a ruler, sovereign, fem. κράντειρα, Anth.

div1.head: κρᾶ
div1.etym: shortened for κράνος as δῶ, for δῶμα, Anth.

div1.head: κρᾶσις
div1.sense: a mixing, blending, compounding, Aesch., Plat.
the temperature of the air, Lat. temperies, Plat.
metaph. combination, union, Plat.
in Gramm., crasis i. e. the combination of two syllables into one long vowel or diphthong, e. g. τοὔνομα for τὸ ὄνομα, ἁνήρ for ὁ ἀνήρ.

div1.head: κράσπεδον
div1.sense: the edge, border, skirt or hem of a thing, esp. of cloth, Theocr.; mostly in pl., Eur., Ar.: —metaph., also in pl., the skirts of a mountain, Xen.; πρὸς κρασπέδοισι στρατοπέδου on the skirts of the army, Eur.

div1.head: κρασπεδόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be bordered, or edged, Eur.

div1.head: κράς
div1.etym: κρᾶτα, as nom. and acc., Soph.
In Hom. also we have a lengthd. gen. and dat., κράατος, κράατι, pl. nom. κράατα
div1.sense: the head, Hom., Trag.; ἐπὶ κρατὸς λιμένος at the head or far end of the bay, Od.
an old gen. κρῆθεν is used in the phrase κατὰ κρῆθεν, down from the head, from the top, Od., Hes.: hence, like penitus, from head to foot, entirely, Τρῶας κατὰ κρῆθεν λάβε πένθος Il.

div1.head: κραταιβόλος
div1.sense: hurled with violence, Eur.

div1.head: κραταιγύαλος
div1.sense: with strong plates, Il.

div1.head: κραταιίς
div1.sense: mighty force, Od.

div1.head: κραταίλεως
div1.sense: of hard stones, rocky, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: κραταιός
div1.sense: strong, mighty, resistless, Hom., Trag.

div1.head: κραταίπεδος
div1.sense: with hard ground or soil, Od.

div1.head: κραταίπους
div1.sense: stout-footed, Epic:— καρταίπους is used absol. for ταῦρος in Pind.

div1.head: κραταίρινος
div1.sense: hard-shelled, Orac. ap. Hdt.

div1.head: κρατεραίχμης
div1.sense: mighty with the spear, poet. καρτ-, Pind.

div1.head: κρατεραύχην
div1.sense: strong-necked, Plat.

div1.head: κρατερός
div1.sense: strong, stout, mighty, Hom.
of things, conditions, etc., strong, mighty, cruel, Hom., Hes.
of passions, strong, vehement, mighty, Hom.; κρ. μῦθος a harsh, rough speech, Hom.
adv. -ρῶς, strongly, stoutly, roughly, Hom.

div1.head: κρατερόφρων
div1.sense: stout-hearted, dauntless, Hom., Hes.

div1.head: κρατερόχειρ
div1.sense: stout of hand, Anth.

div1.head: κρατερῶνυξ
div1.sense: strong-hoofed, solid-hoofed, Hom.:— strong-clawed, of wolves, Od.

div1.head: κρατευταί
div1.sense: the forked stand or frame on which a spit turns, Il.

div1.head: κρατέω
div1.sense: to be strong, mighty, powerful: hence,
absol. to rule, hold sway, be sovereign, Hom., Trag.; ἡ κρατοῦσα the lady of the house, Aesch.
c. dat. to rule among, κρατέεις νεκύεσσιν Od.
c. gen. to be lord or master of, ruler over, πάντων Hom.; δωμάτων Aesch., etc.

to conquer, prevail, get the upper hand, Hdt., Attic; κρ. γνώμηι to prevail in opinion, Hdt.; τῆι μάχηι Eur., etc.;—also c. acc. cogn., κρ. τὸν ἀγῶνα Dem.:— οἱ κρατοῦντες the conquerors, Xen.:—of reports, etc., to prevail, become current, Soph., Thuc.
impers., κατθανεῖν κρατεῖ ʼtis better to die, Aesch.; κρατεῖ ἀπολέσθαι Eur.
c. gen. to prevail over, Aesch.; ὁ λόγος τοῦ ἔργου ἐκράτει surpassed, went beyond it, Thuc.
c. acc. to conquer, master, outdo, surpass, Pind., Attic:—Pass. to be conquered, Hdt., Attic
to become master of, get possession of τῆς ἀρχῆς Hdt.; τῆς γῆς Thuc.
to lay hold of, τῆς χειρός NTest.
c. acc. rei, to seize, hold fast, θρόνους Soph., Xen.
to control, command, Aesch.

div1.head: κρατηρίζω
div1.sense: to drink from a bowl of wine, Dem.

div1.head: κρατήρ
div1.sense: a mixing vessel, esp. a large bowl, in which the wine was mixed with water, and from which the cups were filled, Hom., etc.; οἶνον δʼ ἐκ κρητῆρος ἀφυσσάμενοι δεπάεσσιν ἔκχεον Il.; πίνοντες κρητῆρας drinking bowls of wine, Il.; κρητῆρα στήσασθαι ἐλεύθερον to give a bowl of wine to be drunk in honour of the deliverance, Il.; ἐπιστέψασθαι ποτοῖο, v. ἐπιστέφω.
metaph., κρατῆρα πλήσας κακῶν having filled a bowl full of woes, Aesch.
any cup-shaped hollow, a basin in a rock, Soph., Plat.

div1.head: κρατησίμαχος
div1.sense: conquering in the fight, Pind.

div1.head: κρατησίπους
div1.sense: victorious in the foot-race, Pind.

div1.head: κρατήσιππος
div1.sense: victorious in the race, Pind.

div1.head: κρατιστεύω
div1.sense: to be mightiest, best, most excellent, Soph.
to gain the upper hand, τινί or ἔν τινι in a thing, Xen.

div1.head: κράτιστος
div1.sense: strongest, mightiest, Il., etc.; Λημνίων τὸ κρ. the best of their men, Thuc.:—of things, καρτίστη μάχη the fiercest fight, Il.
generally, best, most excellent, as Sup. of ἀγαθός, Pind., Soph., etc.
οἱ κράτιστοι, like οἱ βέλτιστοι, of the aristocracy, Xen.
neut. pl. κράτιστα as adv., best, Xen. —The comp. in use is κρείσσων, q. v.

div1.head: κράτος
div1.sense: strength, might, Hom., Attic; κατὰ κράτος with all oneʼs might or strength, by open force, by storm, Thuc., Xen., etc.
personified, Strength, Might, Aesch.
generally, might, power, Hom.: rule, sway, sovereignty, Hdt., Attic
c. gen. power over, Hdt., Attic; in pl., ἀστραπᾶν κράτη νέμων Soph.
of persons, a power, an authority, Aesch.
mastery, victory, Hom., Attic; κρ. ἀριστείας the meed of highest valour, Soph.

div1.head: κρατύνω
div1.sense: to strengthen, Hdt., Thuc.:—Mid., ἐκαρτύναντο φάλαγγας they strengthened their ranks, Il., so in Thuc.:—Pass. to wax strong, Hdt.
to harden, τοὺς πόδας Xen.
= κρατέω, to rule, govern, c. gen., Soph., Eur.; also c. acc., Aesch.; absol., Aesch., Soph., etc.
to become master, get possession of, c. gen., Soph.:— c. acc., βασιληίδα τιμὰν κρ. to hold, exercise, Eur.
καρτύνειν βέλεα to ply or throw them stoutly, Pind.

div1.head: κρατύς
div1.sense: strong, mighty, Hom.

div1.head: κραυγάζω
div1.sense: to bay, of dogs, Poeta ap. Plat.; of men, to cry aloud, scream, Dem., NTest.

div1.head: Κραυγασίδης
div1.sense: as a Patronym. son of a croaker, Batr.

div1.head: κραυγή
div1.sense: a crying, screaming, shrieking, shouting, Lat. clamor, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: κρεάγρα
div1.sense: a flesh-hook, to take meat out of the pot, Ar.

div1.head: κρεάδιον
div1.sense: a morsel of meat, slice of meat, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: κρεανομέω
div1.sense: to distribute flesh, to divide the flesh of a victim among the guests, Luc.:—Mid. to divide among themselves, Theocr.

div1.head: κρεανομία
div1.sense: a distribution of flesh, Luc., etc.

div1.head: κρεανόμος
div1.sense: one who distributes the flesh of victims, a carver, Eur.

div1.head: κρέας
div1.sense: flesh, meat, a piece of meat, Od., etc.; τρία κρέα ἢ καὶ πλέα Xen.; also in collective sense, dressed meat, meat, flesh, Hom., etc.
a body, person, ὦ δεξιώτατον κρέας Ar.

div1.head: κρεηδόκος
div1.sense: containing flesh, Anth.

div1.head: κρεῖον
div1.sense: a meat-tray, dresser, Il.

div1.head: κρεισσότεκνος
div1.sense: dearer than children, Aesch.

div1.head: κρείσσων
div1.sense: stronger, mightier, more powerful, Il., etc.
in sense often as comp. of ἀγαθός, better, οἱ κρέσσονες oneʼs betters, Pind.; so, τὰ κρείσσω Eur.: —τὰ κρείσσονα oneʼs advantages, Thuc.

c. inf., οὔτις κρείσσων δόμεναι no one has a better right to give, Od.: —κρεῖσσόν ἐστι, c. inf., ʼtis better to . . , κρεῖσσόν ἐστι θανεῖν ἢ πάσχειν κακῶς Aesch.:—also κρείσσων εἰμί, c. part., κρείσσων ἦσθα μηκέτʼ ὢν ἢ ζῶν τυφλός thou wert better not alive, than living blind, Soph.
too great for, ὕψος κρεῖσσον ἐκπηδήματος too great for leaping out of, Aesch.; κρείσσονʼ ἀγχόνης too bad for hanging, Soph.; ἐλπίδος κρ. worse than one expected, Thuc.
having power over, master of, γαστρός Xen.; κρ. χρημάτων superior to bribes, Thuc.
in Attic Prose in moral sense, better, more excellent, Ar.

div1.head: κρείων
div1.sense: a ruler, lord, master, Hom.; ὕπατε κρειόντων, of Zeus, Il.; as a general title of honour, Od.:—fem. κρείουσα, lady, mistress, Il., Hes.:—after Hom. in the form κρέων, Pind.

div1.head: κρεκάδια
div1.sense: a kind of tapestry, Ar.

div1.head: κρεκτός
div1.sense: struck so as to sound, of stringed instruments: generally, played, sung, Aesch.

div1.head: κρέκω
div1.sense: to strike the web with the κερκίς, to weave, Eur.
to strike the lyre with the plectron, Anth.:—generally, to play on an instrument, Ar.
of any sharp noise, βοὴν πτεροῖς κρ. Ar.

div1.head: κρεμάθρα
div1.sense: a net or basket to hang things up in, Ar.

div1.head: κρεμάννυμι
div1.sense: to hang, hang up, Il.; κρεμόω ποτὶ ναόν will bring them to the temple and hang them up there, Il.; κρ. τινά τινος to hang one up by a thing, Ar.; κρεμάσας τὰ νόημα, in allusion to Socrates in his basket, Ar.; —κρεμάσαι τὴν ἀσπίδα to hang up oneʼs shield, i. e. have done with war, Ar.:—so in Mid., πηδάλιον κρεμάσασθαι to hang up oneʼs rudder, i. e. give up the sea, Hes.

Pass. to be hung up, suspended, ὅτε τ’ ἐκρέμω (2 imperf.) when thou wert hanging, Il.: to be hung up as a votive offering, Pind., Hdt.; εἴπερ ἐκ ποδῶν κρέμαιτο Ar.:—metaph., μῶμος κρέματαί τινι censure hangs over him, Pind.; ὁ ἐκ τοῦ σώματος κρεμάμενος depending on the body, Xen.
to be hung, of persons, Eur.
metaph. to be in suspense, Arist.

div1.head: κρεμαστός
div1.sense: hung, hung up, hanging, κρ. αὐχένος hung by the neck, Soph.; c. gen., also, hung from or on a thing, Eur.: —κρεμαστὴ ἀρτάνη, i. e. a halter, Soph.; so, βρόχοι κρ. Eur.

div1.head: κρέμβαλα
div1.sense: rattling instruments, like our castanets.

div1.head: κρεμβαλιαστύς
div1.sense: a rattling as with castanets, Hhymn.

div1.head: κρέξ
div1.sense: Lat. crex, the corn-crake, land-rail, Ar.

div1.head: κρεοδαίτης
div1.sense: a distributor of flesh, carver at a public meal, Lat. dispensator, Plut.

div1.head: κρεοκοπέω
div1.sense: to cut in pieces, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: κρεουργέω
div1.sense: to cut up meat like a butcher (κρεουργός) , to butcher, Luc.

div1.head: κρεουργηδόν
div1.sense: like a butcher, in pieces, Hdt.

div1.head: κρεουργός
div1.sense: working, i. e. cutting up meat, κρεουργὸν ἦμαρ a day of feasting, Aesch.

div1.head: κρεοφάγος
div1.sense: eating flesh, carnivorous, Hdt.

div1.head: κρήγυος
div1.sense: good, agreeable, Il.: of persons, good, serviceable, Plat.
true, real, εἴπατέ μοι τὸ κρήγυον, Theocr.: adv. in good earnest, Anth.

div1.head: κρήδεμνον
div1.sense: a veil or mantilla with lappets, passing over the head and hanging down on each side, Hom.
metaph. in pl. the battlements which crown a cityʼs walls, Hom., Eur.
the cover of a wine-jar, Od.

div1.head: κρήμνημι
div1.sense: Pass. κρήμναμαι, to hang, be suspended, Eur.: to float in air, Aesch.

div1.head: κρημνοβάτης
div1.sense: a haunter of steeps, Anth.

div1.head: κρημνοποιός
div1.sense: speaking crags, i. e. using big, rugged words, Ar.

div1.head: κρημνός
div1.sense: an overhanging bank, as the steep bank of a river, edge of a trench, Il.: later, a beetling cliff, crag, Hdt., Ar.; κατὰ τῶν κρημνῶν down from the cliffs of Epipolae, Thuc.

div1.head: κρημνώδης
div1.sense: precipitous, Thuc.

div1.head: κρηναῖος
div1.sense: of, from a spring or fountain, Νύμφαι κρηναῖαι Κρηνιάδες, Od.; κρ. ὕδωρ spring water, Hdt.; κρ. ποτόν Soph., etc.

div1.head: κρήνηθεν
div1.sense: from a well or spring, Anth.

div1.head: κρήνηνδε
div1.sense: to a well or spring, Od.

div1.head: κρήνη
div1.sense: a well, spring, fountain, Lat. fons, Hom., etc.; opp. to φρέαρ (a tank), Hdt., Thuc.: —Poets use it in pl. for water, Soph.

div1.head: κρηνιάς
div1.sense: spring-nymphs, Theocr.; so Κρᾱνίδες Mosch.

div1.head: κρηπίς
div1.sense: a half-boot, Xen.:— κρηπῖδες soldiersʼ boots, i. e. soldiers themselves, Theocr.

generally, a groundwork, foundation, basement of a temple or altar, Hdt., Soph., etc.:—metaph., κρηπὶς σοφῶν ἐπέων Pind.; οὐδέπω κρηπὶς κακῶν ὕπεστι we have not yet got to the bottom of misery, Aesch.; ἡ ἐγκράτεια ἀρετῆς κρηπίς self-control is the foundation of virtue, Xen.
the walled edge of a river, a quay, Lat. crepido, Hdt.

div1.head: Κρής
div1.sense: a Cretan, Hom., etc.; fem. Κρῆσσα, ης, Aesch.
as adj. Cretan, Soph.; also Κρήσιος, η, ον, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: κρησφύγετον
div1.sense: a place of refuge, retreat, resort, Hdt.
div1.etym: The first part of the word, κρησ-, is uncertain.

div1.head: Κρήτηθεν
div1.sense: from Crete, Il.

div1.head: Κρήτηνδε
div1.sense: to Crete, Od.

div1.head: Κρήτη
div1.sense: Crete, now Candia, Hom.; Epic gen. pl. Κρητάων εὐρειάων Od.

div1.head: Κρητίζω
div1.sense: to play the Cretan, NTest., Plut.

div1.head: Κρητικός
div1.sense: of or from the island of Crete, Cretan, Aesch., Thuc.
Κρητικόν (sc. ἱμάτιον), a short garment, used at sacred rites, Ar.
Κρητικός (sc. ποῦς) , a Cretic, a metrical foot _ v _, e.g. Ἀντιφῶν, called also amphimacer (ἀμφίμακρος) .

div1.head: Κρητισμός
div1.sense: Cretan behaviour, i. e. lying, Plut.

div1.head: κριβανίτης
div1.sense: baked in a pan (κρίβανος) , ὁ κρ. (sc. ἄρτος) , a loaf so baked, Ar.; hence, comically, βοῦς κρ. Ar.

div1.head: κρίβανος
div1.sense: an earthen vessel, a pan, wider at bottom than at top, wherein bread was baked by putting hot embers round it, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: κρίζω
div1.sense: to creak, Lat. stridere, Il.
of persons, to screech, Ar.

div1.head: κριθάω
div1.sense: of a horse, to be barley-fed, to wax wanton, Aesch.

div1.head: κριθή
div1.sense: barley-corns, barley (cf. κρῖ) , the meal being ἄλφιτα, Hom., Ar., etc.; οἶνος ἐκ κριθέων πεποιημένος a kind of beer (cf. κρίθινος) , Hdt.

div1.head: κριθίασις
div1.sense: a disease of horses, a kind of surfeit caused by over-feeding with barley, Xen.

div1.head: κριθίζω
div1.sense: to feed with barley, Babr.

div1.head: κρίθινος
div1.sense: made of or from barley, Xen., etc.

div1.head: κριθοτράγος
div1.sense: barley-eating, Ar.

div1.head: κρίκος
div1.sense: a ring on a horseʼs breast-band, to fasten it to the peg (ἕστωρ) at the end of the carriage-pole, Il.
an eyelet-hole in sails, through which the reefing-ropes were drawn, Hdt.

div1.head: κρῖμα
div1.sense: a decision, judgment, NTest.: sentence, condemnation, NTest.
a matter for judgment, law-suit, NTest.

div1.head: κρίμνον
div1.sense: coarse meal or a coarse loaf, Anth.

div1.head: κρίνον
div1.sense: a lily, Hdt., Ar., etc.

div1.head: κρίνω
div1.sense: Lat. cerno, to separate, part, put asunder, distinguish, Il., Xen.
to pick out, choose, Hom., Hdt., Attic:—Mid. to pick out for oneself, choose, Hom., etc.: —Pass. to be chosen, Il.; perf. and aor1 part. κεκριμένος, κρινθείς picked out, chosen, Hom.

to decide disputes, Hom., Hdt., etc.; σκολιὰς κρίνειν θέμιστας to judge crooked judgments, i. e. to judge unjustly, Il.; κρίνουσι βόηι καὶ οὐ ψήφωι they decide the question by shouting, not by voting, Thuc.; to decide a contest for a prize, Soph., etc.; κρ. τὰς θεάς to decide their contest, i. e. judge them, Eur.:—Pass. and Mid., of persons, to have a contest decided, come to issue, Hom., etc.
to adjudge, κράτος τινί Soph.
to judge of, estimate, πρὸς ἐμαυτὸν κρίνων αὐτόν judging of him by myself, Dem.:—Pass., ἴσον παρʼ ἐμοὶ κέκριται Hdt.
to expound, interpret dreams, Hdt., Aesch., etc.: so in Mid., Il.
c. acc. et inf. to decide or judge that, Hdt., Attic
c. inf. only, to determine to do a thing, NTest.
to question, Soph.
to bring to trial, accuse, Xen., etc.:—Pass. to be brought to trial, Thuc., etc.
to pass sentence upon, to condemn, Soph., Dem.

div1.head: κριοπρόσωπος
div1.sense: ram-faced, Hdt.

div1.head: κριός
div1.sense: a ram, Lat. aries, Hom., Hdt., etc.
a battering-ram, Lat. aries, Xen.

div1.head: κρῖ
div1.sense: barley, Hom.

div1.head: Κρῖσα
div1.sense: Crisa, a city in Phocis, near Delphi, Il.:—adj. Κρισαῖος, η, ον Crisaean, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: κρίσιμος
div1.sense: decisive, critical, Anth.

div1.head: κρίσις
div1.sense: a separating, power of distinguishing, Arist.: choice, selection, Arist.
a decision, judgment, Hdt., Aesch.; κρ. οὐκ ἀληθής no certain means of judging, Soph.
in legal sense, a trial, Ar., Thuc., etc.:— the result of a trial, condemnation, Xen.
a trial of skill, τόξου in archery, Soph.
a dispute, περί τινος Hdt.
the event or issue of a thing, κρίσιν ἔχειν to be decided, of a war, Thuc.

div1.head: κριτέος
div1.sense: to be decided or judged: —κριτέον one must decide or judge, Plat.

div1.head: κριτήριον
div1.sense: a means for judging or trying, a criterion, standard, test, Plat.
a court of judgment, tribunal, Plat.

div1.head: κριτής
div1.sense: a decider, judge, umpire, Hdt., Thuc.:—at Athens, of the judges in the poetic contests, Ar.
κρ. ἐνυπνίων an interpreter of dreams, Aesch.

div1.head: κριτικός
div1.sense: able to discern, critical, Arist.
of or for judging, Arist.

div1.head: κριτός
div1.sense: picked out, chosen, Hom.
choice, excellent, Pind., Soph.

div1.head: κροαίνω
div1.sense: of a horse, to stamp, strike with the hoof, Il.

div1.head: κροκάλη
div1.sense: a pebble, shingle, Anth.

div1.head: κρόκεος
div1.sense: saffron-coloured, Pind., Eur.

div1.head: κρόκη
div1.etym: also (as if from a nom. *κρόξ) heterocl. acc. κρόκα, nom. pl. κρόκες Anth.:
div1.sense: the thread which is passed between the threads of the warp (στήμων, tela), the woof or weft, Lat. subtemen, Hes., Hdt., etc.
κροκύς, the flock or nap of woollen cloth, cloth with curly nap, Ar.: in pl., μαλακαῖς κρόκαις with cloths of soft wool, Pind.; κρόκαισι with flocks of wool, Soph.

div1.head: κρόκινος
div1.sense: of saffron, Anth.

div1.head: κροκόβαπτος
div1.sense: saffron-dyed, Aesch.

div1.head: κροκοβαφής
div1.sense: metaph., ἐπὶ δὲ καρδίαν ἔδραμε κρ. σταγών to my heart ran the sallow, sickly blood-drop (that precedes death), Aesch.

div1.head: κροκόδιλος
div1.sense: a lizard, properly an Ionic word, Hdt.
the Nile-lizard, crocodile, Hdt.

div1.head: κροκόεις
div1.sense: saffron-coloured, Eur., etc.

div1.head: κροκόπεπλος
div1.sense: with yellow veil, Il., Hes.

div1.head: κρόκος
div1.sense: the crocus, Il., Soph.
saffron (which is made from its stigmas), Aesch., etc.

div1.head: κροκόω
div1.sense: to crown with yellow ivy, Anth.

div1.head: κροκύς
div1.sense: the flock or nap on woollen cloth, Hdt., Luc., etc.

div1.head: κροκωτός
div1.sense: saffron-dyed, saffron-coloured, Pind.
as Subst., κροκωτός (sc. χιτών) , a saffron-coloured frock, worn by Bacchus, Ar.

div1.head: κρομμυοξυρεγμία
div1.sense: a belch of onions and vinegar, Ar.

div1.head: κρόμυον
div1.sense: an onion, Hom.:—later κρόμμυον, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: Κρονίδης
div1.sense: patronym., son of Cronus, i. e. Zeus, Hom.

div1.head: Κρονικός
div1.sense: = Κρόνιος, Κρ. ἀστήρ the planet Saturn, Anth.
in contemptuous sense, old-fashioned, out of date, Ar.

div1.head: Κρόνιος
div1.sense: Saturnian, of Cronus or Saturn, Aesch., etc.
Κρόνια (sc. ἱερά) , τά, his festival celebrated on the twelfth of Hecatombaeon, Dem.:—later, τὰ Κρόνια were the Roman Saturnalia; hence, αἱ Κρονιάδες ἡμέραι the time of the Saturnalia, Plut.
Κρόνιον (sc. ὄρος) , the hill of Cronus or Saturn, Pind.
like Κρονικός, in contemptuous sense, Κρονίων ὄζειν to smell of the dark ages, Ar.

div1.head: Κρόνιππος
div1.sense: an old dotard, Ar.

div1.head: Κρονίων
div1.sense: patronym., son of Cronus, i. e. Zeus, Hom.

div1.head: Κρόνος
div1.sense: Cronus, identified with the Lat. Saturnus, son of Uranos and Gaia, husband of Rhea, father of Zeus, Poseidon, Hades, Hera, Demeter and Hestia, Hes.: he reigned in heaven until his sons banished him to Tartarus, Il., Aesch.; his time was the golden age, Hes.
a name at Athens, a superannuated old dotard, old fool, Ar.

div1.head: κρόσσαι
div1.sense: battlements on walls, Il.; of the steps by which the Pyramids rose to a point, Hdt.

div1.head: κροταλίζω
div1.sense: to use rattles or castanets, Hdt.:—generally, ἵπποι ὄχεα κροτάλιζον were rattling them along, Il.

div1.head: κρόταλον
div1.sense: a rattle, castanet, used in the worship of Cybele, or Dionysus, Hdt., Eur.
metaph. a rattling fellow, a rattle, Ar.

div1.head: κρόταφος
div1.sense: the side of the forehead (v. κόρση), in pl. the temples, Lat. tempora, Il., etc.
of a mountain, its side, Aesch., Anth.

div1.head: κροτέω
div1.sense: to make to rattle, of horses, ὄχεα κροτέοντες rattling them along, Il.
to knock, strike, smite, Hdt., Eur.; κροτεῖν τὰς χεῖρας or τὼ χεῖρε to clap the hands, Hdt., Xen.: absol. to clap, applaud, Xen., etc.
of a smith, to hammer or weld together, Plat.:—Pass. to be wrought by the hammer; metaph., ἐξ ἀπάτας κεκροταμένος one mass of trickery, Theocr.
intr. to make a rattling noise, Arist., Luc.

div1.head: κρότημα
div1.sense: work wrought by the hammer:— metaph. of Ulysses, a hardened knave, Eur.

div1.head: κρότησις
div1.sense: a clapping, τινὶ χειρῶν Plat.

div1.head: κροτητός
div1.sense: stricken, sounding with blows, Aesch.: rattling, Soph.

div1.head: κρότος
div1.sense: a striking, the sound made by striking, κρ. ποδῶν the beat of the feet in dancing, Eur.; κρ. χειρῶν a clapping of hands, applause, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: κροῦμα
div1.sense: a stroke: a sound made by striking stringed instruments with the plectron, a note, Plat.

div1.head: κρουματικός
div1.sense: of or for playing on a stringed instrument, Anth.

div1.head: κρουνίζω
div1.sense: to send forth a stream,

div1.head: κρούνισμα
div1.sense: a gush or stream, Anth.

div1.head: κρουνός
div1.sense: a spring, well-head, whence the streams (πηγαί) issue, Il., Soph.; so, κρουνοὶ Ἡφαίστου streams of lava from Etna, Pind.: metaph. a torrent of words, Ar.

div1.head: κρουνοχυτρολήραιος
div1.sense: a pourer forth of washy twaddle, Ar.

div1.head: κροῦσις
div1.sense: a striking, smiting, Plut.
a tapping of earthen vessels, to see whether they ring sound: metaph. deception, cheatery, Ar.
a playing on a stringed instrument, Plut.

div1.head: κρουστικός
div1.sense: fit for striking the ears, impressive, Arist.:—metaph. of a speaker, Ar.

div1.head: κρούω
div1.sense: to strike, smite: to strike one against another, κρ. χεῖρας to clap hands, Eur.; κρ. τὰ ὅπλα πρὸς ἄλληλα Thuc., etc.:— κρ. τὸν πόδα (i. e. κρ. τὴν γῆν τῶι ποδί) in dancing, Eur.
κέραμον κρούειν to tap an earthen vessel, to try whether it rings sound: hence to examine, prove, Plat.
to strike a lyre with the plectron, Plat.
κρούειν τὴν θύραν to knock at the door on the outside, Xen., etc.
as a nautical term, in Mid., κρούεσθαι πρύμναν, like ἀνακρούεσθαι, to back a ship, Thuc.

div1.head: κρύβδα
div1.sense: without the knowledge of, κρύβδα Διός, Lat. clam Jove, Il.
absol., like κρύβδην, secretly, Pind.

div1.head: κρύβδην
div1.sense: secretly, Od., Ar.
c. gen., like κρύβδα, κρύβδαν πατρός Pind.

div1.head: κρυερός
div1.sense: icy, chilling, in Hom. only metaph., κρυεροῖο γόοιο, κρυεροῖο φόβοιο; so κρυερὰ πάθεα Ar.
icy-cold, Ar.

div1.head: κρυμός
div1.sense: icy cold, frost, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: κρυμώδης
div1.sense: icy-cold, frozen, icy, Anth.

div1.head: κρυόεις
div1.sense: chilling, Il., Hes.
icy-cold, Anth.

div1.head: κρύος
div1.sense: icy cold, chill, frost, Hes.: metaph., καρδίαν περιπίτνει κρύος Aesch.

div1.head: κρυπτάδιος
div1.sense: secret, clandestine, Il., Aesch.: neut. pl. as adv., Il.

div1.head: κρυπτεία
div1.sense: a secret commission on which young Spartans were obliged to serve, watching the country and enduring hardships, Plat.

div1.head: κρυπτέος
div1.etym: verb. adj. of κρύπτω, Soph., Anth.

div1.head: κρυπτεύω
div1.sense: to conceal, hide, Eur.
intrans, to hide oneself, lie concealed, Xen.
Pass. to be ensnared, Eur.

div1.head: κρυπτός
div1.sense: hidden, secret, Il., Hdt., etc.; κρυπτὴ τάφρος a trench covered and concealed by planks and earth, Hdt.; τὸ κρ. τῆς πολιτείας the secret character of [the Spartan] institutions, Thuc.

div1.head: κρύπτω
div1.sense: to hide, cover, cloak, Hom., Attic:—Mid., κάρα κρυψάμενος having cloaked his head, Soph., etc.:—Pass. to hide oneself, lie hidden, of setting stars, Hes., Eur.
to cover in the earth, bury, Hes., Hdt., Attic
to hide, conceal, keep secret, Od., Soph.: —Pass., perf. part. κεκρυμμένος secret, Od., Soph.
c. dupl. acc. to conceal something from one, μή με κρύψηις τοῦτο Aesch., etc.
intr. (sub. ἑαυτόν) to hide oneself, lie hidden, Soph.

div1.head: κρυσταλλίζω
div1.sense: to be clear as crystal, NTest.

div1.head: κρυστάλλινος
div1.sense: of crystal, crystalline, Anth.

div1.head: κρυσταλλόπηκτος
div1.sense: congealed to ice, frozen, Eur.

div1.head: κρύσταλλος
div1.sense: clear ice, ice, Lat. glacies, Hom., Hdt., Attic
crystal, rock-crystal, Anth.

div1.head: κρυφαῖος
div1.sense: hidden, Pind., Trag.
secret, clandestine, Aesch.:—adv. -ως, Aesch.

div1.head: κρύφα
div1.sense: without the knowledge of, c. gen., Thuc.: absol. secretly, Thuc.

div1.head: κρύφιος
div1.sense: hidden, concealed, Soph., etc.
secret, clandestine, Hes., Soph., etc.

div1.head: κρυφός
div1.sense: κρυφὸν θέμεν to throw a cloud over, Pind.

div1.head: κρυψίνοος
div1.sense: hiding oneʼs thoughts, dissembling, Xen.

div1.head: κρύψις
div1.sense: a hiding, concealment, Eur.: — the art of concealing, Arist.

div1.head: κρωβύλος
div1.sense: a roll or knot of hair on the crown of the head, Thuc., Anth.:—also a tuft of hair on a helmet, Xen.
a nickname of the orator Hegesippus, Aeschin.

div1.head: κρωγμός
div1.sense: the cawing of a crow, Anth.

div1.head: κρώζω
div1.sense: to cry like a crow, caw, Lat. crocitare, Hes., Ar.:—also of other birds, as cranes, Ar.; of young halcyons, Luc.:—of a wagon, to creak, groan, Babr.

div1.head: κρωσσός
div1.sense: a water-pail, pitcher, jar, Eur.
a cinerary urn, Mosch., Anth.

div1.head: κτάντης
div1.sense: a murderer, Anth.

div1.head: κτάομαι
div1.sense: in pres., imperf., fut. and aor1:
to procure for oneself, to get, gain, acquire, Hom.; κτήσασθαι βίον ἀπό τινος to get oneʼs living from a thing, Hdt.; κ. χάριν to win favour, Soph.; κ. φίλους, ἑταίρους Soph.
of evils, to bring upon oneself, incur, Soph., Eur., etc.: —κ. τινὰ πολέμιον to make him so, Xen.
to procure or get for another, ἐμοὶ ἐκτήσατο κεῖνος Od.

in perf. and plup. with fut. κεκτήσομαι, to have acquired, i. e. to possess, have, hold, Il., Hdt., etc.; κεκτ. τινὰ σύμμαχον Eur.; of evils, κεκτ. κακά Soph., Eur.; ὁ κεκτημένος an owner, master, as a Subst., ὁ ἐμοῦ κ. Soph.; of a womanʼs lord and master, Eur.
aor1 pass. ἐκτήθην in pass. sense, to be gotten, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: κτέανον
div1.sense: = κτῆμα, Pind.
mostly in pl. κτέανα, possessions, property, Hes., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: κτεάτειρα
div1.sense: κόσμων κτ. thou that hast put us in possession of honours, Aesch.

div1.head: κτεατίζω
div1.sense: to get, gain, win, Hom.:—Mid., with perf. pass., to get for oneself, acquire, Hhymn., Theocr.

div1.head: κτεατιστός
div1.sense: gotten, acquired, Anth.

div1.head: κτείνω
div1.sense: to kill, slay, Hom., etc.; of animals, to slaughter, Hom.; Οὖτις με κτείνει δόλωι seeks to kill me (the force of the pres. tense), Od.; ὁ κτανών the slayer, murderer, Aesch.; οἱ κτανόντες Aesch.:— to put to death by law, Thuc., Plat.—In Attic θνῄσκω or ἀποθνῄσκω is used for the Pass.

div1.head: κτείς
div1.sense: a comb, Lat. pecten: esp.,
the comb in the loom, which separates the threads of the warp, Anth.
a rake, Anth.
in pl. the fingers, which branch like the teeth of a comb, Aesch.

div1.head: κτενίζω
div1.sense: to comb, curry horses, Eur.:— Mid., κτενίζεσθαι τὰς κόμας to comb oneʼs hair, Hdt.

div1.head: κτενίον
div1.sense: a small comb, Luc.

div1.head: κτενισμός
div1.sense: a combing, Eur.

div1.head: κτέρας
div1.sense: a possession, Il.

div1.head: κτέρεα
div1.sense: funeral gifts, burnt with the dead, funeral honours, Hom.

div1.head: κτερεΐζω
div1.sense: c. acc. pers. to bury with due honours, Il.
c. acc. cogn., κτέρεα κτερεΐξαι to pay funeral honours, Od.

div1.head: κτερίζω
div1.sense: = κτερεΐζω 1, Il., Soph.
c. acc. cogn., κτέρεα κτ., like κτερεΐζω 2, Hom.

div1.head: κτῆμα
div1.sense: anything gotten, a piece of property, a possession, Od., Attic:—of a slave, παλαιὸν οἴκων κτ. Eur.
in pl. possessions, property, wealth, Hom.; ἔρως, ὃς ἐν κτήμασι πίπτεις who fallest on wealth, i. e. on the wealthy, Soph.

div1.head: κτηνηδόν
div1.sense: like beasts, Hdt.

div1.head: κτῆνος
div1.sense: flocks and herds, which in ancient times constituted wealth, Hhymn., Hdt.
in sg. a single beast, as an ox or sheep, Hdt., Xen.: a beast for riding, Lat. jumentum, NTest.

div1.head: κτηνοτροφία
div1.sense: cattle-keeping, Plut.

div1.head: κτήσιος
div1.sense: belonging to property, χρήματα κτ. property, Aesch.; κτ. βοτόν a sheep of oneʼs own flock, Soph.
belonging to oneʼs house, Ζεὺς κτήσιος the protector of property, Aesch.; κτ. βωμός the altar of Ζεὺς κτήσιος, Aesch.

div1.head: κτῆσις
div1.sense: acquisition, Thuc., Plat.; κατʼ ἔργου κτῆσιν according to success in the work, Soph.
(from perf.) possession, Soph., Thuc., etc.
as collective, = κτήματα, possessions, property, Hom.; in pl., Hdt., Plat., etc.

div1.head: κτητέος
div1.sense: to be gotten, Plat.
neut. one must get, Plat.

div1.head: κτητικός
div1.sense: acquisitive: —ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) the art of getting property, Plat.

div1.head: κτητός
div1.sense: that may be gotten, Il., Eur.
worth getting, desirable, Plat.
acquired: κτητή a female slave, Hes.

div1.head: κτήτωρ
div1.sense: a possessor, owner, NTest., Anth.

div1.head: κτίδεος
div1.sense: of a marten-cat, κτιδέη κυνέη a marten-skin helmet, Il.

div1.head: κτίζω
div1.sense: to people a country, build houses and cities in it, colonise, Il., Hdt., etc.
of a city, to found, plant, build, Od., Hdt., etc.:—Pass. to be founded, Σμύρνην τὴν ἀπὸ Κολοφῶνος κτισθεῖσαν founded by emigrants from Colophon, Hdt.
κτ. ἄλσος to plant a grove, Pind.; κτ. βωμόν to set up an altar, Pind.; τὸν Κύρνον κτίσαι to establish his worship, Hdt.
to create, bring into being, bring about, Aesch.; τὸν χαλινὸν κτίσας having invented it, Soph.
to make so and so, ἐλεύθερον κτ. τινά Aesch., etc.
to perpetrate a deed, Soph.

div1.head: κτίλος
div1.sense: tame, docile, gentle, Pind.
as Subst., κτίλος, ὁ, a ram, Il.

div1.head: κτιλόω
div1.sense: to tame:—Mid., ἐκτιλώσαντο τὰς λοιπὰς τῶν Ἀμαζόνων got them tamed, Hdt.

div1.head: κτίσις
div1.sense: a founding, foundation, ἀποικιῶν Isocr., etc.
loosely, = πρᾶξις, a doing, an act, Pind.
a creating, the creation of the universe, NTest.
that which was created, the creation, NTest.
an authority created or ordained, NTest.

div1.head: κτίσμα
div1.sense: anything created, a creature, NTest.

div1.head: κτίστης
div1.sense: a founder, Lat. conditor, Luc.: a restorer, Plut.

div1.head: κτίτης
div1.sense: generally, an inhabitant, Eur.

div1.head: κτυπέω
div1.sense: to crash, of trees falling, Il.; of thunder, Hom., Soph.
to ring, resound, echo, Il., etc.
Causal, to make to ring or resound, χθόνα; c. dupl. acc., κτύπησε κρᾶτα πλαγάν made the head ring with a blow, Eur.: —hence again in Pass. to ring, resound, Ar.

div1.head: κτύπος
div1.sense: any loud noise, a crash of thunder, Il., Aesch.; of the trampling of feet, Hom.; of a storm, Aesch.; battle- din, clash of arms, Aesch.

div1.head: κύαθος
div1.sense: a cup, for drawing wine out of the κρατήρ or bowl, Xen., etc.
a cupping-glass, Ar.

div1.head: κυαμευτός
div1.sense: chosen by beans, i. e. by lot, Xen.

div1.head: κυαμεύω
div1.sense: Pass. to be so elected, Dem.

div1.head: κύαμος
div1.sense: a bean, Lat. faba, Il.

the lot by which public officers were elected at Athens (because those who drew white beans were chosen), ὁ τῷ κυάμῳ λαχών an officer chosen by lot, Hdt.; βουλὴ ἡ ἀπὸ τοῦ κυάμου Thuc.; ἄρχοντας ἀπὸ κυάμου καθιστάναι Xen.

div1.head: κυαμοτρώξ
div1.sense: bean-eater, Ar.

div1.head: κυαμοφαγία
div1.sense: the eating of beans, bean-diet, Luc.

div1.head: κυαναιγίς
div1.sense: she of the dark Aegis, Pind.

div1.head: κυανάμπυξ
div1.sense: with dark edge, Theocr.

div1.head: κυαναυγής
div1.sense: dark-gleaming, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: Κυάνεαι
div1.sense: Κ. νῆσοι or πέτραι, αἱ, dark rocks, two islands at the entrance of the Euxine, Hdt.; —mythically supposed to close and crush passing ships, hence called Συμπληγάδες; the sea near being Κυάνεα πελάγη, Soph.

div1.head: κυάνεος
div1.sense: properly, dark-blue, glossy-blue, of a serpentʼs iridescent hues, Il., Hes.; of the swallow, Simon.; of the deep sea, Eur.
generally, dark, black, of the mourning veil of Thetis, Il.; of clouds, Hom.; of hair, Il.; κυανέη κάπετος a deep dark trench, Il.; κυάνεαι φάλαγγες dark masses of warriors, Il., etc.

div1.head: κυανοβλέφαρος
div1.sense: dark-eyed, Anth.

div1.head: κυανοειδής
div1.sense: dark-blue, deep-blue, Eur.

div1.head: κυανόθριξ
div1.sense: dark-haired, Anth.

div1.head: κυανόπεζα
div1.sense: with feet of κύανος, Il.

div1.head: κυανόπεπλος
div1.sense: dark-veiled, Hhymn.

div1.head: κυανόπρῳρος
div1.sense: with dark-blue prow, dark-prowed, of ships, Hom.

div1.head: κυανόπτερος
div1.sense: with blue-black feathers, dark-winged, Hes., Eur.

div1.head: κύανος
div1.sense: cyanus, a dark-blue substance, used in the Heroic Age to adorn works in metal, perh. blue steel, Hom.
as fem. the blue corn-flower, Anth.
as adj. = κυάνεος, with comp. and Sup. κυανώτερος, -ώτατος, Anacreont.

div1.head: κυανόστολος
div1.sense: dark-robed, Bion.

div1.head: κυάνοφρυς
div1.sense: dark-browed, Theocr.

div1.head: κυανοχαίτης
div1.sense: dark-haired, of Poseidon, perh. in reference to the dark blue of the sea, Hom.; of a horse, dark-maned, Il., Hes.:—Epic nom. κυανοχαῖτα (like ἱππότα for ἱππότης) , Il.; so in voc., Hhymn.

div1.head: κυανόχροος
div1.sense: dark-coloured, dark-looking, Eur.; so κυανό-χρως, ωτος, ὁ, ἡ, Eur.

div1.head: κυανώπης
div1.sense: dark-eyed, fem.

div1.head: κυανῶπις
div1.sense: Od.: generally, dark-looking, νῆες κυανώπιδες Aesch.

div1.head: κυανωπός
div1.sense: dark-looking, Anth.

div1.head: κυβεία
div1.sense: dice-playing, dicing, Xen., etc.: metaph. sleight of hand, trickery, NTest.

div1.head: κυβεῖον
div1.sense: a gaming-house, Aeschin.

div1.head: Κυβέλη
div1.sense: Cybele, a Phrygian goddess, Eur., Ar.; cf. Κυβήβη.

div1.head: κυβερνάω
div1.sense: Lat. gubernare, to steer, Od., etc.: absol. to act as pilot or helmsman, Ar.
metaph. to guide, govern, Pind., Soph.

div1.head: κυβερνήσια
div1.sense: sc. ἱερά a festival at Athens in memory of the steersman of Theseus, Plut.

div1.head: κυβέρνησις
div1.sense: steering, pilotage, Plat.
metaph. government, Pind.

div1.head: κυβερνήτης
div1.sense: a steersman, helmsman, pilot, Lat. gubernator, Hom., etc.: Ionic acc. κυβερνήτεα Hdt.
metaph. a guide, governor, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: κυβερνητικός
div1.sense: good at steering, Plat.; comp. -ώτερος, Plat.; Sup. -ώτατος, Xen.:— ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) the pilotʼs art, Plat.

div1.head: κυβευτής
div1.sense: a dicer, gambler, Xen.

div1.head: κυβευτικός
div1.sense: of or for dice-playing, Aeschin.
skilled in dice-playing, Plat.

div1.head: κυβεύω
div1.sense: to play at dice, Ar., etc.
metaph. to run a risk or hazard, Xen., etc.; c. acc. to hazard, venture on, Eur.:—Pass. to be set upon a stake, Anth.

div1.head: κυβιστάω
div1.sense: to tumble head foremost, tumble, Il., Xen., etc.

div1.head: κυβίστημα
div1.sense: a summerset, Luc.

div1.head: κυβίστησις
div1.sense: a summerset, Luc.

div1.head: κυβιστητήρ
div1.sense: a tumbler, Hom.
a diver, Il. 3. one who pitches headlong, Eur.

div1.head: κύβος
div1.sense: Lat. cubus, a cube: a cubical die, marked on all 6 sides (whereas the ἀστράγαλος was marked only on four sides), in pl., dice, Hdt., etc.; the Greeks threw with three dice, so that τρὶς ἕξ, three sixes, was the highest throw, Aesch., Plat.; κρίνειν τι ἐν κύβοις to decide it by the dice, by chance, Aesch.
also of the single pips on the dice, βέβληκʼ Ἀχιλλεὺς δύο κύβω καὶ τέσσαρα he has thrown two aces and a four, Aesch. ap. Ar.
a cubic number, i. e. a number multiplied twice into itself, as 27 is the cube of 3, Plat.

div1.head: κυδάζω
div1.sense: to revile:—Pass. to be reviled, Soph.

div1.head: κυδαίνω
div1.sense: to give or do honour to, glorify, Hom.
to gladden by marks of honour, Hom.
in bad sense, to flatter, fawn upon, Hes.

div1.head: κυδάλιμος
div1.sense: glorious, renowned, famous, Hom.

div1.head: κυδάνω
div1.sense: to hold in honour, Il.
to vaunt, boast, Il.

div1.head: κυδήεις
div1.sense: glorious, Anth.

div1.head: κυδιάνειρα
div1.sense: glorifying or ennobling men, bringing them glory or renown, Il.
pass. famous for men, Anth.

div1.head: κυδιάω
div1.sense: to bear oneself proudly, go proudly along, exult, Il.

div1.head: κύδιστος
div1.etym: Sup. of κυδρός, formed from κῦδος, as αἴσχιστος, sup. of αἰσχρός, from αἶσχος
div1.sense: most glorious, most honoured, noblest, Hom.
comp. κυδίων nobler: τί μοι ζῆν δῆτα κύδιον; what boots it me to live? Eur.

div1.head: κυδοιδοπάω
div1.sense: to make a hubbub, Ar.

div1.head: κυδοιμέω
div1.sense: to make an uproar, spread alarm, Il.
trans. to drive in confusion, Il.

div1.head: κυδοιμός
div1.sense: the din of battle, uproar, hubbub, Il., Ar.

div1.head: κῦδος
div1.sense: glory, renown, esp. in war, Il.: of a single person, κῦδος Ἀχαιῶν glory of the Achaians, like Lat. decus, Hom.

div1.head: κυδρός
div1.sense: glorious, illustrious, noble, Hom., Hes.; of a horse, proud, stately, Xen. (For the irreg. comp. and Sup., v. κύδιστος)

div1.head: Κυδώνιος
div1.sense: Cydonian: μῆλον Κ. a quince, Stesich., etc.
metaph. swelling like a quince, round and plump, Ar.

div1.head: κυέω
div1.sense: like κύω, to bear in the womb, to be pregnant with a child, Lat. gestare, Il., Plat.
absol. to be pregnant, be with child, Hdt.

div1.head: Κύζικος
div1.sense: an island and town on the coast of Mysia, Hdt.:—hence Κυζικηνός, ή, όν of or from Cyzicus: ὁ Κυζικηνός (with or without στατήρ) , a gold coin, Xen.

div1.head: κύημα
div1.sense: that which is conceived, an embryo, foetus, Plat.

div1.head: κυηρός
div1.sense: pregnant, Hesych.

div1.head: κύησις
div1.sense: conception, Plat.

div1.head: Κυθέρεια
div1.sense: Cythereia, surname of Aphrodite, Od.:— also Κυθέρη, and Κυθηριάς, άδος, Anth.

div1.head: Κύθηρα
div1.sense: an island, now Cerigo, to the south of Laconia, Hom.

div1.head: Κυθήριος
div1.sense: Cytherean, Il., etc.; ἡ Κυθηρία (sc. γῆ) Xen.

div1.head: Κυθηροδίκης
div1.sense: a Spartan magistrate sent annually to govern the island of Cythera, Thuc.

div1.head: Κυθηρόθεν
div1.sense: from Cythera, Il.

div1.head: κυΐσκομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to conceive, become pregnant, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: κυκάω
div1.sense: to stir up and mix, beat up, Hom., Ar.: Mid. in Act. sense, Ar.

like ταράσσω, to stir up, to throw into confusion or disorder, confound, Aesch., Ar., Plat., etc.:—Pass. to be confounded, panic-stricken, Il.; of waves, Hom.; ὑπʼ ἀνδρὸς τοξότου κυκώμενος hustled by him, Ar.

div1.head: κυκεών
div1.sense: mixed drink, a potion, tankard, made of barley-meal, grated cheese and wine, Hom.
metaph. of any mixture, medley, Luc.

div1.head: κύκηθρον
div1.sense: a ladle for stirring: metaph. an agitator, Ar.

div1.head: κύκησις
div1.sense: a stirring up, mixing up, Plat.

div1.head: κυκησίτεφρος
div1.sense: mixed with ashes, Ar.

div1.head: κυκλάς
div1.sense: round, circular; and of Time, revolving, Eur.; αἱ Κυκλάδες (sc. νῆσοι) , the Cyclades, islands in the Aegaean sea, which encircle Delos, Attic

div1.head: κυκλέω
div1.sense: to move round and round, wheel along, c. acc., Il.
to move round or in a circle, Soph.; βάσιν κυκλεῖν, metaph. from dogs questing about for the scent, Soph.; κ. πρόσωπον to turn the face round, look round, Eur.
Mid. and Pass. to form a circle round, to surround, encompass, encircle, Hdt., Soph.
to go round and round, revolve, Plat.

div1.head: κυκλιάς
div1.sense: round, Anth.

div1.head: κυκλικός
div1.sense: circular: οἱ κυκλικοί, Epic poets whose writings formed a cycle or series of legends down to the death of Ulysses, Anth.

div1.head: κυκλιοδιδάσκαλος
div1.sense: a teacher of the dithyrambic chorus (v. κύκλιος II), Ar.

div1.head: κύκλιος
div1.sense: round, circular, ὕδωρ κύκλιον, of the Delian lake (cf. τροχοειδής) , Eur.
κύκλιος χορός, οῦ, a chorus danced in a ring round an altar, a dithyrambic chorus, Ar., etc.:— κύκλια μέλη dithyrambic songs, Ar.

div1.head: Κυκλοβορέω
div1.sense: to brawl like the torrent Cycloborus, Ar.

div1.head: Κυκλοβόρος
div1.sense: Cycloborus, a torrent in Attica, Ar.

div1.head: κυκλοδίωκτος
div1.sense: driven in a circle, Anth.

div1.head: κυκλόθεν
div1.sense: from all around, NTest.

div1.head: κυκλομόλιβδος
div1.sense: a round lead-pencil, Anth.

div1.head: κυκλόσε
div1.sense: in or into a circle or round, Il.

div1.head: κυκλοσοβέω
div1.sense: to drive round in a circle, whirl round, Ar.

div1.head: κύκλος
div1.sense: a ring, circle, round, Hom.; ἀσπίδος κύκλος the round shield, Aesch.
Adverbial usages, κύκλῳ in a circle or ring, round about, Od., Hdt., Attic; c. gen., κ. τοῦ στρατοπέδου Xen., etc.
any circular body:
a wheel, Il.
a place of assembly, the ἀγορά, Il., Attic:—then, like Lat. corona, a ring or circle of people, Soph., Xen.
the vault of the sky, Hdt., Soph., etc.
the orb or disk of the sun and moon, Hdt., Trag.
the wall round a city, esp. round Athens, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
a round shield, v. supr. 1. 1.
in pl. the eye-balls, eyes, Soph.:—rarely in sg., the eye, Soph.
any circular motion, an orbit of the heavenly bodies, revolution of the seasons, cycle of events, Hdt., Eur.
a circular dance, Ar.

div1.head: κυκλοτερής
div1.sense: made round by turning (as in a lathe), Hdt.: then, generally, round, circular, Hom., etc.; κυκλοτερὲς τόξον ἔτεινεν stretched it into a circle, Il.

div1.head: κυκλόω
div1.sense: to encircle, surround, Eur.:—so in Mid., Hdt., Aesch., etc.:—Pass. to be surrounded, Aesch., Thuc.
to move in a circle, whirl round, Pind., Eur.:—Pass. or Mid. to go in a circle, go round, Xen.; metaph., Aesch.
to form into a circle, τόξα Anth.:— Pass., of a bow, to form a circle, Eur.; cf. κυκλοτερής.

div1.head: Κυκλώπειος
div1.sense: Cyclopean, commonly used of the architecture attributed to the Cyclopes, (also called Πελασγικός) , Eur.

div1.head: Κυκλωπικῶς
div1.sense: like the Cyclopes, Κ. ζῆν to live a savage unsocial life, Arist.

div1.head: Κυκλώπιον
div1.sense: little Cyclops, Eur.

div1.head: Κυκλώπιος
div1.sense: ἡ K. γῆ, i. e. Mycenae, Eur.:—fem. Κυκλωπίς, ίδος, Eur.

div1.head: κύκλωσις
div1.sense: a surrounding, in a battle, Xen.; τὴν πλέονα κύκλωσιν σφῶν the larger body that was endeavouring to surround them, Thuc.

div1.head: κυκλωτός
div1.sense: rounded, round, Aesch.

div1.head: Κύκλωψ
div1.sense: a Cyclops, properly Round-eye.— The Cyclopes appear in Od. as savage giants, dwelling in Sicily; in sg. of Polyphemus:— they were builders of the walls of Mycenae, etc., τὰ Κυκλώπων βάθρα, i. e. Mycenae, Eur.

div1.head: κύκνειος
div1.sense: of a swan, Anth.

div1.head: κυκνόμορφος
div1.sense: swan-shaped, Aesch.

div1.head: κυκνόπτερος
div1.sense: swan-plumed, Eur.

div1.head: κύκνος
div1.sense: a swan, Il., etc.:—metaph., from the legends of the swanʼs dying song (Aesch., Plat.), a minstrel, Anth.

div1.head: κύκνοψις
div1.sense: swan-like, Anth.

div1.head: κυλίνδησις
div1.sense: a rolling, wallowing, Plut.

div1.head: κύλινδρος
div1.sense: a roller, cylinder, Plut.

div1.head: κυλίνδω
div1.sense: to roll, roll along or down, Od., Soph., etc.: metaph., πῆμα θεὸς Δαναοῖσι κυλίνδει rolls down calamity upon one, Il.
to roll away, Anth.
Pass. to be rolled, roll along, roll, Hom.: to toss about like a ship at sea, Pind.: to be whirled round on a wheel, of Ixion, Pind.
of persons, κυλίνδεσθαι κατὰ κόπρον to roll or wallow in the dirt (in sign of grief), Hom.: to roam to and fro, wander about, Xen.
of Time, to roll by, Pind.
of words, to be tost from man to man, i. e. be much talked of, Lat. jactari, Ar.

div1.head: κύλιξ
div1.sense: a cup, drinking-cup, wine-cup, Lat. calix, Hdt., Pind., etc.; περιελαύνειν τὰς κ. to push round the cup, Xen.

div1.head: κύλισμα
div1.sense: a rolling, wallowing, or a wallowing place, NTest.

div1.head: κυλίστρα
div1.sense: a place for horses to roll in, Xen.

div1.head: κυλίω
div1.sense: later form of κυλίνδω, to roll along, Theocr., Luc.

div1.head: κυλλᾶστις
div1.sense: Aegyptian bread, Hdt.

div1.head: Κυλλήνη
div1.sense: Cyllene, a mountain in Arcadia, Il.; whence Hermes was called Κυλλήνιος, Hom.

div1.head: Κυλλοποδίων
div1.sense: crook-footed, halting, of Vulcan, Il.; voc. Κυλλοπόδῑον Il.

div1.head: κυλλός
div1.sense: crooked, crippled, properly of legs bent outwards by disease, Ar.:— ἔμβαλε κυλλῇ (sc. χειρί) put into a crooked hand, i. e. with the fingers crooked like a beggarʼs, Ar.

div1.head: κυλοιδιάω
div1.sense: to have a swelling below the eye, from a blow or from sleepless nights, Ar., Theocr.

div1.head: κυμαίνω
div1.sense: to rise in waves or billows, to swell, Hom., Plat.
metaph. of passion, to swell, seethe, Pind., Aesch.
trans. to agitate, Luc., Anth.:—Pass., Plut.

div1.head: κῦμα
div1.sense: anything swollen (as if pregnant):—hence,
the swell of the sea, a wave, billow, Hom., etc.; collectively, ὡς τὸ κῦμα ἔστρωτο when the swell abated, Hdt.
metaph. of a flood of men, Aesch.:—metaph., κ. ἄτης, κακῶν, συμφορᾶς Aesch., Eur.
the foetus in the womb, embryo, Aesch.; of the earth, Aesch.

div1.head: κυματίας
div1.sense: surging, billowy, κ. ὁ ποταμὸς ἐγένετο Hdt.
act. causing waves, stormy, ἄνεμος Hdt.

div1.head: κυματοαγής
div1.sense: breaking like waves, Soph.

div1.head: Κυματολήγη
div1.sense: wave-stiller, a Nereid, Hes.

div1.head: κυματοπλήξ
div1.sense: wave-beaten, Soph.

div1.head: κυματόω
div1.sense: to cover with waves, Plut.
Pass. to be raised or to rise in waves, of the sea, Thuc.

div1.head: κυματωγή
div1.sense: a place where the waves break, the beach, Hdt.

div1.head: κυματώδης
div1.sense: on which the waves break, Plut.

div1.head: κύμβαλον
div1.sense: a cymbal, Xen.

div1.head: κύμβαχος
div1.sense: head-foremost, Lat. pronus, Il.
as Subst. the crown of a helmet, Il.

div1.head: κύμινδις
div1.sense: a bird, perh. the night-jar, Il.

div1.head: κυμινεύω
div1.sense: to strew with cummin, Luc.

div1.head: κύμινον
div1.sense: cummin, Attic, NTest.

div1.head: κυμινοπρίστης
div1.sense: a cummin-splitter, i. e. a skinflint, niggard, Arist.

div1.head: κυμινοπριστοκαρδαμογλύφος
div1.sense: a cummin-splitting-cress-scraper, Ar.

div1.head: κυμοδέγμων
div1.sense: meeting the waves, Eur.

div1.head: Κυμοδόκη
div1.sense: wave-receiver, a Nereid, Il.

div1.head: κυμοθόη
div1.sense: wave-swift, a Nereid, Il., Hes.

div1.head: Κυμοπόλεια
div1.sense: wave-walker, Hes.

div1.head: Κυμώ
div1.sense: wavy, a Nereid, Hes.

div1.head: κυνάγκη
div1.sense: a dogʼs collar, Anth.

div1.head: κυναγός
div1.sense: a hound-leader, i. e. a huntsman, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: κυναγωγός
div1.sense: a leader of hounds, huntsman, Xen.

div1.head: κυναλώπηξ
div1.sense: a fox-dog, mongrel between dog and fox, nickname of Cleon, Ar.

div1.head: κυνάμυια
div1.sense: dog-fly, i. e. shameless fly, abusive epithet of impudent women, Il.

div1.head: κυνάριον
div1.sense: a little dog, whelp, Xen., etc.

div1.head: κυνάς
div1.sense: fem. adj. of a dog: as Subst. (sub. θρίξ) , dogʼs hair, of a bad fleece, Theocr.

div1.head: κυνάω
div1.sense: to play the Cynic, Luc.

div1.head: κυνέη
div1.etym: properly fem. of κύνεος, sub. δορά
div1.sense: a dogʼs skin: then, a leathern cap, not necessarily of dogʼs skin, for we find κ. ταυρείη, κτιδέη, etc., Hom.

div1.head: κύνειος
div1.sense: of, belonging to a dog, Ar.; κ. θάνατος a dogʼs death, Ar.; τὰ κύνεια (sub. κρέα) dogʼs flesh, Ar.

div1.head: κύνεος
div1.sense: metaph. shameless, unabashed, Il., Hes.

div1.head: κυνέω
div1.sense: to kiss, Hom., Eur., etc.
= προσκυνέω, Eur.

div1.head: κυνηγεσία
div1.etym: later form for κυνηγέσιον (signf. II), Plut.

div1.head: κυνηγέσιον
div1.sense: a hunting-establishment, huntsmen and hounds, a pack of hounds, Hdt., Xen.
a hunt, chase, pursuit, Xen.; so in pl., Eur.
that which is taken in hunting, the game, Xen.

div1.head: κυνηγετέω
div1.sense: to hunt, Ar., Xen., etc.:—metaph. to persecute, harass, Aesch.
to quest about, like a hound, Soph.

div1.head: κυνηγέτης
div1.sense: a hunter, huntsman, Od., Eur., etc.; κυναγέτας ἀμφὶ πάλᾳ one who seeks the prize in wrestling, Pind.:—fem. κυνηγέτις, Doric κυναγέτις, ιδος a huntress, Anth.

div1.head: κυνηγετικός
div1.sense: of or for hunting, fond of the chase, Plat.:— ὁ κυνηγετικός λόγος name of Xenophonʼs work on Hunting.

div1.head: κυνηγέω
div1.sense: to hunt, chase, later form of κυνηγετέω, Plut.

div1.head: κυνηγία
div1.sense: hunt, chase, hunting, Trag.

div1.head: κυνήγιον
div1.sense: the hunt, chase, Plut.

div1.head: κυνηδόν
div1.sense: like a dog, Ar.

div1.head: Κύνθος
div1.sense: Cynthus, a mountain in Delos, birth-place of Apollo and Artemis, Hhymn.:—hence Apollo is called Κύνθιος, and Κυνθο-γενής, born on Cynthus, Ar., Anth.

div1.head: κυνιδεύς
div1.sense: a puppy (cf. λαγιδεύς, λυκιδεύς) , Theocr.

div1.head: κυνίδιον
div1.sense: a little dog, whelp, puppy, Ar., Plat., etc.

div1.head: κυνίζω
div1.sense: to play the dog: metaph. to live like a Cynic, belong to their sect, Luc.

div1.head: κυνικός
div1.sense: dog-like, Lat. caninus, Xen.
Κυνικός, οῦ, a Cynic, as the followers of the philosopher Antisthenes were called, Plut.

div1.head: κυνίσκη
div1.sense: a bitch-puppy, Ar.

div1.head: κυνίσκος
div1.sense: a young dog, puppy, Hdt.
metaph. a little Cynic, Luc.

div1.head: κυνισμός
div1.sense: Cynical philosophy or conduct, Luc.

div1.head: κυνόδους
div1.sense: a canine tooth, Xen., etc.

div1.head: κυνοδρομέω
div1.sense: to run with dogs, Xen.

div1.head: κυνοθαρσής
div1.sense: impudent as a dog, Theocr.

div1.head: κυνοκέφαλος
div1.sense: dog-headed; οἱ Κυνοκέφαλοι, dog-heads, the name of a people, Hdt.
the dogfaced baboon, Plat., Luc. κυνοκεφάλλῳ in Ar.]

div1.head: κυνοκλόπος
div1.sense: dog-stealing, Ar.

div1.head: κυνοκοπέω
div1.sense: to beat like a dog, Ar.

div1.head: κυνοπρόσωπος
div1.sense: dog-faced, Luc.

div1.head: Κυνόσαργες
div1.sense: Cynosarges, a gymnasium outside Athens, for the use of those who were not pure Athenians, Hdt., Dem., etc.

div1.head: κυνόσβατος
div1.sense: dog-thorn or dog-rose, Theocr.

div1.head: κυνόσουρα
div1.sense: dogʼs-tail, the Cynosure, a name for the constellation Ursa Minor, Arat.

div1.head: κυνοσπάρακτος
div1.sense: torn by dogs, Soph.

div1.head: κυνοῦχος
div1.sense: a dog-holder, dog-leash, Anth.
a dog-skin sack, used in hunting, Xen.

div1.head: κυνόφρων
div1.sense: dog-minded, shameless, Aesch.

div1.head: κύντερος
div1.sense: more dog-like, i. e. more shameless, more audacious, Hom.; more horrible, κύντερον ἄλλο ποτʼ ἔτλης Od.
Sup. κύντατος, η, ον most audacious, Il., Hhymn.

div1.head: κυνώ
div1.sense: a she-dog:—as prop. n. Κυνώ, Hdt.

div1.head: κυνώπης
div1.sense: the dog-eyed, i. e. shameless one, Il.:—so fem.κυνῶπις, ιδος, Hom.

div1.head: κυοφορέω
div1.sense: to be pregnant, Luc.

div1.head: κυπαρίσσινος
div1.sense: of cypress-wood, Od., Thuc.

div1.head: κυπάρισσος
div1.sense: a cypress, Od., Hdt., etc.

div1.head: κυπασσίς
div1.sense: a short frock, Anth.

div1.head: κύπειρον
div1.sense: a sweet-smelling marsh-plant, perh. galingale, used to feed horses, Hom.

div1.head: κυπελλομάχος
div1.sense: at which they fight with cups (cf. Horace pugnare scyphis), Anth.

div1.head: κύπελλον
div1.sense: a big-bellied drinking vessel, a beaker, goblet, cup, Hom.

div1.head: κυπελλοφόρος
div1.sense: carrying cups, Anth.

div1.head: Κυπρίδιος
div1.sense: like Cypris, i. e. lovely, tender, Anth.

div1.head: Κύπριος
div1.sense: of Cyprus, Cyprian, Hdt., etc.
Κύπρια, τά, an Epic poem introductory to the Il., Hdt.

div1.head: Κύπρις
div1.sense: Cypris, a name of Aphrodite, from the island of Cyprus, where she was most worshipped, Il., Trag., etc.
as appellat. love, passion, Eur., etc.

div1.head: Κυπρογενής
div1.sense: Cyprus-born, of Aphrodite, Hhymn., etc.:—fem. Κυπρο-γένεια, ἡ, Pind.

div1.head: Κυπρόθεν
div1.sense: from Cyprus, Anth.

div1.head: Κύπρονδε
div1.sense: to Cyprus, Il.

div1.head: Κύπρος
div1.sense: Cyprus, a Greek island on the S. coast of Asia Minor, Hom., etc.:—the Romans got from it the best copper, Lat. cyprium.

div1.head: κυπτάζω
div1.sense: to keep stooping, to go poking about, potter about a thing, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: κύπτω
div1.sense: to bend forward, stoop down, Hom., Hdt., etc.; θέει κύψας runs with the head down, i. e. at full speed, Ar.; κύψας ἐσθίει eats stooping, i. e. greedily, Ar.; κέρεα κεκυφότα ἐς τὸ ἔμπροσθεν horns bent forward, of certain African oxen, Hdt.
to hang the head from shame, Ar.
to bow down under a burden, Dem.

div1.head: κυρβασία
div1.sense: a Persian bonnet or hat, with a peaked crown, prob. much like the τιάρα, Hdt.: the King alone wore it upright, Ar.

div1.head: Κύρβας
div1.etym: shortd. form of Κορύβας, q. v.

div1.head: κύρβεις
div1.sense: triangular tablets, fitted at the angles so as to form a pyramid of three sides, and having the earliest laws written on the sides, Ar., Plat.
in sg. metaph. of a pettifogging lawyer, Ar.

div1.head: Κύρειος
div1.sense: of Cyrus, Xen.

div1.head: κυρέω
div1.sense: followed by a case, to hit, light upon:
c. dat. to light upon, meet with, fall in with, strike against, Il., Hes.:—of things, κυρεῖν τινι to befall or be granted to him, Soph., Eur.
c. gen. to hit the mark, like τυγχάνω, Aesch.:— to reach to or as far as, Hhymn.: to meet with, find, Aesch., Soph.
to attain to, be master of, obtain, Lat. potiri, Hdt., Trag.
c. acc., like Lat. potiri, to obtain, reach, find, Aesch., Eur.
without a case, to happen, come to pass, Trag.
to be right, hit the exact truth, Soph.

as auxil. Verb, like τυγχάνω with partic., to turn out, prove to be so and so, σεσωσμένος κυρεῖ Aesch.; ζῶν κυρεῖ Soph.; ἐχθρὸς ὢν κυρεῖ Eur.; with partic. omitted, it acts merely as the copula, to be, Trag.

div1.head: κυρηβάζω
div1.sense: to butt with the horns: metaph., τὸ σκέλος κυρηβάσει he shall come butt against my leg, or my leg shall butt him, kick him, Ar.

div1.head: κυρήβια
div1.sense: husks, bran:—a bran-shop, Ar.

div1.head: Κυρήνη
div1.sense: Cyrene, a Greek colony in Africa, Hdt.: —the people were called Κυρηναῖοι, and the country ἡ Κυρηναία, Hdt.

div1.head: κυριακός
div1.sense: of or for a lord or master: esp. belonging to the Lord (Christ); Κ. δεῖπνον the Lordʼs Supper, ἡ κυριακὴ ἡμέρα the LORDʼS day, dies Dominica, NTest. (Assumed to be original of the Teutonic kirk, kirche, church; but how this Greek name came to be adopted by the Northern nations, rather than the Roman name ecclesia, has not been satisfactorily explained.)

div1.head: κυριεύω
div1.sense: to be lord or master of people orof a country, c. gen., Xen.
to have legal power to do, c. inf., ap. Aeschin.

div1.head: κύριος
div1.sense: of persons, having power or authority over, lord or master of, c. gen., Pind., Attic:— κύριός εἰμι, c. inf., I have authority to do, am entitled to do, Aesch., etc.; κυριώτεροι δοῦναι better able to give, Thuc.
absol. having authority, authoritative, supreme, κ. εἶναι to have authority, Plat.; τὸ κύριον the ruling power in a state, τὰ κύρια the authorities, Soph., Dem.
not of persons, authoritative, decisive, dominant, supreme, δίκαι Eur.; μῦθος κυριώτερος of more authority, Eur., etc.
opp. to ἄκυρος, authorised, ratified, valid, νόμοι, δόγματα Dem.; κ. θέσθαι or ποιεῖσθαί τι to appoint by authority, Soph., Dem.

of times, etc., fixed, ordained, appointed, Hdt., Eur., etc.;—so, τὸ κύριον the appointed time, Aesch.:—at Athens, κυρία ἐκκλησία a regular or ordinary assembly, opp. to σύγκλητος ἐκκλησία (one specially summoned), Ar.
legitimate, regular, proper, Aesch.
of words, authorised, vernacular, Lat. proprius, Arist.
as Subst.,

div1.head: κύριος
div1.sense: a lord, master, Lat. dominus, of gods, Pind., Soph., etc.: the head of a family, master of a house, Aesch., etc.:—later, κύριε was a form of respectful address, like our sir, NTest.
κυρία, ἡ, mistress or lady of the house, Lat. domina, Menand., etc.
ὁ Κύριος, the Lord, = Hebr. Jehovah, Lxx.; in NTest. esp. of Christ.

div1.head: κυριότης
div1.sense: dominion, NTest.

div1.head: κυρίσσω
div1.sense: to butt with the horns, Plat.:—metaph. of floating corpses knocking against the shore, Aesch.

div1.head: κυρίως
div1.sense: like a lord or master, authoritatively, Aesch.
regularly, legitimately, properly, κ. ἔχειν to be fixed, hold good, Aesch.; κ. αἰτεῖσθαι, suo jure, Soph., etc.
of words, in their proper sense, Arist.

div1.head: κύρμα
div1.sense: that which one meets with or finds, i. e. booty, prey, spoil, Hom.
of a person, one who gets booty, a swindler, Ar.

div1.head: Κύρνος
div1.sense: Cyrnus, old name of Corsica, Hdt.: οἱ Κύρνιοι Hdt.

div1.head: κῦρος
div1.sense: supreme power, authority, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
confirmation, validity, certainty, Soph.

div1.head: Κῦρος
div1.sense: Cyrus:
ὁ πρότερος, the elder Cyrus, Hdt.
ὁ νεώτερος, the brother of Artaxerxes, Xen.

div1.head: κυρόω
div1.sense: to make valid, confirm, ratify, determine, Lat. ratum facere, Hdt., Aesch., etc.:—Mid. to accomplish oneʼs end, Plat.:—Pass. to be ratified, Hdt., Attic:—generally, κεκύρωται τέλος the end hath been fixed or determined, Aesch.; πρὶν κεκυρῶσθαι σφαγάς before it has been accomplished, Eur.:—impers. c. inf., ἐκεκύρωτο συμβάλλειν it had been decided to fight, Hdt.; ἐκυρώθη ναυμαχέειν Hdt.
κ. δίκην to decide it, Aesch.

div1.head: κυρτευτής
div1.sense: one that fishes with the κύρτη, Anth.

div1.head: κύρτη
div1.sense: a fishing-basket, Lat. nassa, Hdt.; κυρτός, ὁ, κυρτευτής, Plat.
a bird-cage, Lat. cavea, Anth.

div1.head: κυρτός
div1.sense: curved, arched, of a wave breaking, Il.; ὤμω κυρτώ round, humped, Il.; κ. τροχός Eur.

div1.head: κυρτόω
div1.sense: to curve or bend into an arch, κυρτῶν νῶτα, of a bull preparing to charge, Eur.; κ. λαίφεα Anth.:—Pass. to form a curve or arch, of a wave breaking, Od., Xen.

div1.head: κύρωσις
div1.sense: a ratification, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: κύστις
div1.sense: the bladder, Il., Ar.

div1.head: κύτισος
div1.sense: cytisus, a kind of clover, Theocr.

div1.head: κυτμίς
div1.sense: a kind of plaster, Luc.

div1.head: κυτογάστωρ
div1.sense: with capacious belly, Anth.

div1.head: κύτος
div1.sense: the hollow of a shield or breastplate, Aesch., Ar.
any vessel, a vase, jar, urn, Aesch., Soph., etc.; πλεκτὸν κ. a basket, Eur.
anything that contains the body, Soph.

div1.head: κύτταρος
div1.sense: the cell of a comb of bees or wasps, Ar.
metaph., τοὐρανοῦ τὸν κ. the concave vault of heaven, Ar.

div1.head: κυφαγωγός
div1.sense: with neck arched and head low, of a horse, Xen.

div1.head: κυφός
div1.sense: bent forwards, bent, stooping, hump-backed, Od., Ar.

div1.head: κύφων
div1.sense: the bent yoke of the plough, Theogn.
a sort of pillory in which criminals were fastened by the neck, Ar.
one who has had his neck in the pillory, a knave, Lat. furcifer, Luc.

div1.head: κυψέλη
div1.sense: any hollow vessel: a chest, box, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: Κυψελίδαι
div1.sense: descendants of Cypselus, Theogn.

div1.head: κύων
div1.sense: a dog or bitch, Hom., etc.; most commonly of hounds, Hom., etc.; the Laconian breed was famous, Soph.;— νή or μὰ τὸν κύνα was the favourite oath of Socrates, Plat.: cf. τραπεζεύς.
as a word of reproach, to denote shamelessness or audacity in women, rashness, recklessness in men, Hom.
at Athens a nickname of the Cynics, Arist., Anth.
the Trag. apply the term to the ministers of the gods; the eagle is Διὸς πτηνὸς κύων Aesch.; the griffins Ζηνὸς ἀκραγεῖς κύνες Aesch.; the Bacchantes Λύσσης κ. Eur., etc.
a sea-dog, mentioned as a fish in Od.
the dog-star, i. e. the dog of Orion, placed among the stars with its master, Il.

div1.head: κύω
div1.sense: in pres. and imperf., of females, to conceive, Orac. ap. Hdt., Theogn., etc.
rarely c. acc. to be pregnant with a child, Xen.
in aor1 ἔκῡσα, Causal, of the male, to impregnate, and mid. ἐκῡσάμην, of the female, to conceive, Hes.

div1.head: κῶας
div1.sense: a fleece, used as bedding, Hom., Hdt.

div1.head: κωβιός
div1.sense: a fish of the gudgeon kind, Plat., etc.

div1.head: κώδεια
div1.sense: the head, Il.

div1.head: κῴδιον
div1.sense: a sheepskin, fleece, used for bedding, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: κωδωνίζω
div1.sense: to prove by ringing, of money, Ar.

div1.head: κωδωνόκροτος
div1.sense: ringing, jingling, as with bells, Eur.

div1.head: κωδωνοφαλαρόπωλος
div1.sense: with bells on his horsesʼ trappings, Ar.

div1.head: κωδωνοφορέω
div1.sense: to carry the bell round, to visit the sentinels, Ar.:—Pass., ἅπαντα κωδωνοφορεῖται everywhere the bell goes round, i. e. the sentinels are being visited, Ar.

div1.head: κώδων
div1.sense: a bell, Aesch., Eur.:—in fortified towns an officer went round at night with a bell to challenge the sentries, and see that they were awake, Thuc.; ὡς κώδωνα ἐξαψάμενος like one with an alarm-bell in his hand, Dem.

div1.head: κώθων
div1.sense: a Laconian drinking-vessel, Ar.

div1.head: κώκυμα
div1.sense: a shriek, wail, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: κωκυτός
div1.sense: a shrieking, wailing, Il., Trag.
Κωκῡτός, οῦ, ὁ, Cocytus, river of wailing (cf. Ἀχέρων) , one of the rivers of hell, Od., etc.

div1.head: κωκύω
div1.sense: to shriek, cry, wail, mostly of women, Hom.
to wail over one dead, Od., Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: κωλακρέτης
div1.sense: collector of the pieces at a sacrifice, name of a magistrate at Athens, who had charge of the public table in the Prytaneion, and paid the dicasts, Ar.; κωλαγρέτου γάλα, comically for the μισθὸς δικαστικός, Ar.

div1.head: κωλῆ
div1.sense: the thigh-bone with the flesh on it, the ham, esp. of a swine, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: κώληψ
div1.sense: the hollow of the knees, Lat. poples, Il.

div1.head: Κωλιάς
div1.sense: Colias, a promontory of Attica, with a temple of Aphrodite there, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: κῶλον
div1.sense: a limb, esp. the leg, Trag.
of plants, a limb or arm, Anth.
a member of anything, as,
a member of a building, as the side or front, Hdt.
one limb or half of the race-course (δίαυλος) , Aesch.
a member or clause of a sentence, Lat. membrum, Arist.

div1.head: κώλυμα
div1.sense: a hindrance, impediment, Eur., Thuc.
a defence against a thing, precaution, Thuc.

div1.head: κωλύμη
div1.sense: = κώλυμα, ἐπὶ κωλύμῃ for the purpose ofhindering, Thuc.

div1.head: κωλυτέος
div1.sense: one must hinder, Xen.

div1.head: κωλυτής
div1.sense: a hinderer, Thuc.

div1.head: κωλυτικός
div1.sense: preventive, Xen.

div1.head: κωλύω
div1.sense: to let, hinder, check, prevent:

c. acc. et inf. to hinder or prevent one from doing, Hdt., Soph., etc.; with a negative added, κ. τινὰ μὴ θανεῖν Eur., etc.:—Pass. to be hindered, τοῦ ὕδατος πιεῖν from drinking of the water, Plat.; κωλυόμεσθα μὴ μαθεῖν Eur.; rarely with part., μὴ κωλύωνται περαιούμενοι Thuc.
c. gen. rei, κ. τινά τινος to let or hinder one from a thing, Xen.; so, κ. τινα ἀπό τινος Xen.
c. acc. rei, to hinder, prevent, impede, Eur., Thuc.:—Pass., μηδὲ δαπάνηι κεκωλύσθω and let there be no hindrance by reason of expense, Thuc.
absol., ὁ κωλύσων one to hinder, Soph.; τὸ κωλῦον a hindrance, Xen.
often in 3 pers., οὐδὲν κωλύει there is nothing to hinder, c. acc. et inf., Hdt., Ar.:— οὐδὲν κωλύει, absol., as a form of assent, nothing hinders, be it so, Ar.

div1.head: κωμάζω
div1.sense: to go about with a party of revellers, to revel, make merry, Lat. comissari, Hes., Theogn., Eur., etc.
to go in festal procession, Pind., Dem.
to celebrate a κῶμος in honour of the victor at the games, to join in festivities, Pind.; c. acc. cogn., ἑορτὰν κ. Pind.
c. dat. pers. to approach with a κῶμος, sing in his honour, Pind.
c. acc. pers. to honour or celebrate him in or with the κῶμος, Pind.
to break in upon in the manner of revellers, κ. ποτὶ τὰν Ἀμαρυλλίδα Theocr.:—generally, to burst in, Anth.

div1.head: κῶμα
div1.sense: deep sleep, slumber, Lat. sopor, Hom., Hes.

div1.head: κωμάρχης
div1.sense: the head man of a village, Xen.

div1.head: κωμαστής
div1.sense: a reveller, Plat., Xen.
epith. of Bacchus, the jolly god, Ar.

div1.head: κώμη
div1.sense: = Lat. vicus, a village or country town, opp. to a fortified city; properly a Doric word, = Attic δῆμος, Hes., Hdt.; κατοικῆσθαι κατὰ κώμας to live in separate villages (not in walled towns), of the Medes, Hdt.; so, of a country, κατὰ κώμας οἰκεῖσθαι to have its people distributed into villages, Thuc.

div1.head: κωμήτης
div1.sense: a villager, countryman, Plat., Xen.
in a city, one of the same quarter, Lat. vicinus, Ar.; more loosely, χθονὸς κωμῆται dwellers in a land, Eur.

div1.head: κωμικός
div1.sense: Lat. comicus, = κωμῳδικός, Aeschin.

div1.head: κωμόπολις
div1.sense: a village-town, i. e. a place not entitled to be called a πόλις, NTest.

div1.head: κῶμος
div1.sense: properly a village festival: a revel, carousal, merry-making, Lat. comissatio, Hhymn., Theogn., etc.: it ended in the party parading the streets crowned, bearing torches, singing, dancing, and playing frolics, Ar.
a band of revellers, a jovial troop, Eur.:—metaph. a rout, band, κ. Ἐρινύων Aesch.; of an army, Eur., etc.
the ode sung at one of these festive processions, Pind.

div1.head: κώμυς
div1.sense: a bundle of hay, Lat. manipulus, Theocr.

div1.head: κωμῳδέω
div1.sense: to represent in a comedy, to satirise, lampoon, libel, Ar., Plat.:—Pass. to be so satirised, Ar.
κωμωιδεῖν τὰ δίκαια κωμωιδοῦντα εἰπεῖν τὰ δ., Ar.
to write comedies, Luc.

div1.head: κωμῳδία
div1.sense: a comedy, Ar., etc.:—Two derivs. are suggested: one from κῶμος, ᾠδή, the revel-song; the other from κώμη, ᾠδή, the village-song. There were three periods of Attic Comedy, Old, Middle, New, — παλαιά, μέση, νέα. The Old Comedy was used to attack by name the most powerful persons of the day, ending B. C. 393; the Middle Comedy lost the chorus, but still attacked notabilities under assumed characters, ending B. C. 337; the New was our Comedy of Manners, and may be best understood from Plautus and Terence.

div1.head: κωμῳδικός
div1.sense: of comedy, comic, Ar.

div1.head: κωμῳδοδιδασκαλία
div1.sense: the comic poetʼs art, Ar.

div1.head: κωμῳδοδιδάσκαλος
div1.sense: a comic poet, because he had to train the actors and chorus, Ar.

div1.head: κωμῳδολοιχέω
div1.sense: to play the parasite and buffoon, Ar.

div1.head: κωμῳδοποιός
div1.sense: a maker of comedies, comic poet, Plat.

div1.head: κωμῳδός
div1.sense: a comedian, i. e.,
a comic actor, Xen., Aeschin.
a comic poet, Plat.

div1.head: κώνειον
div1.sense: hemlock, Lat. cicuta:—hemlock-juice, by which criminals were put to death at Athens, Ar., etc.

div1.head: κωνίον
div1.sense: a small cone, Anth.

div1.head: κωνῖτις
div1.sense: extracted from pine-cones, Anth.

div1.head: κῶνος
div1.sense: the fruit of the πεύκη, a pine-cone, Theocr., etc.
a cone, Lat. conus, in Mathematics, Arist.
the cone of a helmet, Anth.

div1.head: κωνοτομέω
div1.sense: to make a conic section, Anth.

div1.head: κωνοφόρος
div1.sense: bearing a cone, Anth.

div1.head: κωνωπεῖον
div1.sense: an Egyptian couch with mosquito-curtains; conopium in Hor.

div1.head: κώνωψ
div1.sense: a gnat, mosquito, Lat. culex, Hdt., Aesch., etc.

div1.head: Κῷος
div1.sense: of, from the island Cos, Coan, Hdt.
as Subst., Κῷος (sc. βόλος) , the highest throw with the ἀστράγαλοι, v. Χῖος.

div1.head: Κωπαΐς
div1.sense: of or near Copae (in Boeotia), ἡ Κ. λίμνη lake Copais Strab.
ἐγχέλεις Κωπαΐδες eels from lake Copais, Ar.

div1.head: κωπεύς
div1.sense: only in pl. κωπέες, Attic κωπῆς, pieces of wood fit for making oars, oar-spars, Hdt., Ar., etc.

div1.head: κωπεύω
div1.sense: to propel with oars, Anth.

div1.head: κωπήεις
div1.sense: hilted, Il.

div1.head: κωπηλατέω
div1.sense: to pull an oar: metaph. of any similar motion forwards and backwards, as of a carpenter using an auger, Eur.

div1.head: κωπηλάτης
div1.sense: a rower, Polyb.

div1.head: κώπη
div1.sense: any handle:

the handle of an oar, and generally an oar, Od., Pind., Attic; νερτέρᾳ προσήμενος κώπῃ, θαλαμίτης, metaph. of a man of low rank, Aesch.; παραπέμπειν ἐφʼ ἕνδεκα κώπαις, a proverb of dub. origin, meaning "to escort with all the honours, " Ar.:—poet. to express ships, σὺν κώπᾳ χιλιοναύτᾳ, of Agamemnonʼs fleet, Eur.
the handle of a sword, the haft, hilt, Lat. capulus, Hom., Soph.
the handle of a key, Od.
the haft of a torch, Eur.

div1.head: κωπήρης
div1.sense: furnished with oars, Aesch., Eur., Thuc.
holding the oar, χείρ Eur.

div1.head: κώρυκος
div1.sense: a leathern sack or wallet for provisions, Od.
in the gymnasium, a large leathern sack hung up, filled with fig-grains (κεγχραμίδες) , flour, or sand, for the athletes to strike, Arist.

div1.head: κώριον
div1.sense: Doric Dim. of κούρα, a little girl, Ar.

div1.head: Κωρύκιος
div1.sense: Corycian (from the Corycian cave in Mt. Parnassus), Soph.; κορυφαὶ Κ. the peaks of Parnassus, Eur.; also Κωρυκὶς, πέτρα Aesch.

div1.head: Κώρυκος
div1.sense: a promontory of Cilicia, Hhymn., Thuc.

div1.head: Κῶς
div1.sense: the island Cos, opposite Caria, Hom.:— Κόωνδε to Cos, Il.

div1.head: κωτίλλω
div1.sense: to prattle, chatter, Lat. garrire, mostly with notion of wheedling, Hes., Theogn., etc.
trans. to talk over, attempt to wheedle, Theogn., Soph.

div1.head: κωτίλος
div1.sense: of a swallow, twittering, Anacr., etc.: of persons, chattering, prattling, babbling, Lat. garrulus, Theogn., Theocr.
metaph. lively, expressive, Theocr., Anth.

div1.head: κωφός
div1.sense: radical sense, blunt, dull, obtuse, κωφὸν βέλος the blunt, dull shaft, opp. to ὀξύ, Il.
metaph.:

dumb, mute, κύματι κωφῷ with dumb wave, before it breaks, Il.; κωφὴν γαῖαν ἀεικίζει dishonours the dumb, senseless earth, Il.; τὰ μὲν ἄλλα ἔσκε κωφά the other parts of the ground sounded dull, opp. to the ringing of the hollow parts, Hdt.; ὁ κ. λιμήν, prob. the bay of Munychia, as opp. to the noisy Peiraeus, Xen.
after Hom., of men, dumb, Orac. ap. Hdt.: deaf and dumb, Hdt.
deaf, Lat. surdus, Hhymn., Aesch., etc.
of the mind, dull, stupid, Lat. fatuus, Soph.; also senseless, unmeaning, κ. καὶ παλαίʼ ἔπη Soph.

div1.head: κωφότης
div1.sense: deafness, Plat., Dem., etc.
